excerpts: The organic tofu miso soup was also good.
organic tofu miso soup.author: Steve S.
organic tofu miso soup.review:
A Japanese delicatessen. Awesome.

Where else can you get wasabi garlic potato salad? Sadly, I didn't try and now looking at all the good reviews here, I wish I had.

Tried the shrimp and crab roll. Saw that it didn't have an expiration date but rather an expiration time! That's how fresh it was, and it tasted very fresh. 

Also tried the katsu don sandwich which was creatively prepared and quite delicious. The organic tofu miso soup was also good.

Definitely recommended.

excerpts: so I decided to try the salmon chowder as well.
salmon chowder.author: Michael Y.
salmon chowder.review:
Had a short window to eat during a conference day lunch break. Hopped across the street from the Hyatt regency and got in line for quick bite. The line moved fairly quickly and I was a little overwhelmed by the menu but decided on the Japanese beef curry as I was in a comfort food mood although the bento boxes and salads were tempting. Was feeling a bit hungry so I decided to try the salmon chowder as well. 

The beef curry was hot and the rice had a nice al dente texture. The sauce was flavorful and had a slight spicy kick. The meat was tender and just the right amount of fat. 

The chowder also had a nice salmon flavor in the broth but the fish was just a bit over cooked. The vegetables were nice but I was way too full to finish both dishes  

A great weekday option at one of my favorite SF eating spots!

excerpts: Ordered Salmon chowder and Beef curry.
Beef curry was great but Salmon chowder was way too runny!
I mean yuck, i had to drink it like milk, except it's not!
It's water down and oily.
I was expecting a rich, flavorful, creamy chowder.
Am I wrong?
My foodie friend whom I was going to share the chowder agrees.
I bring it back which I have never done before.
I talk to a cashier.
A Chinese (I think) woman appears and says, well that's how we cook it.
salmon chowder.author: Jen B.
salmon chowder.review:
Ordered Salmon chowder and Beef curry. Beef curry was great but Salmon chowder was way too runny! I mean yuck, i had to drink it like milk, except it's not! It's water down and oily. I was expecting a rich, flavorful, creamy chowder. Am I wrong? My foodie friend whom I was going to share the chowder agrees. I bring it back which I have never done before. I talk to a cashier. A Chinese (I think) woman appears and says, well that's how we cook it. I can help next!

I felt powerless and humiliated. I didn't even think to ask for a manager. I wanted to dump the chowder into their trash can but couldn't find it so just left it on the counter as I left.

I am totally disgusted by how rude a restaurant employee can be toward a customer. Unbelievable.

excerpts: My favorites are the eggplant salad, Salmon chowder & the Kaki-age Tempura (which is vegetable and shrimp tempura).
The salmon chowder is loaded with fish and is well worth the $1 up-charge.
salmon chowder.author: Ahmad J.
salmon chowder.review:
Delica is one of the restaurants in the Ferry building plaza that I've been to a handful of times for lunch. It is a Japanese themed Deli where you have your standard Bento's, Donburi, Salads & entrees. During lunch you can do a 3-item combo where you get a soup, salad & entree or 2 salads and an entree for $10.99. The menu board is not too clear so you will see a lot of first timers hanging around trying to figure out what to get, but once you get the drift the line moves pretty fast.  

Over a period of time I've tried most of their soups, salads and entrees in different combinations. Surprisingly I've liked almost everything that I've got. The salads specially are unique. I haven't seen these in other Deli's. I thought the combinations are a little weird but they go well together. My favorites are the eggplant salad, Salmon chowder & the Kaki-age Tempura (which is vegetable and shrimp tempura). The salmon chowder is loaded with fish and is well worth the $1 up-charge.

Price is actually cheap when compared to other restaurants in the plaza especially when you factor in the high quality of the food. Delica seems to check all my boxes of quality, service and value for money so I'm going to be generous and round up my 4.5 start rating to 5.

excerpts: I went with a group of friends, and we all ordered the salmon chowder.
On a positive note the flavor and consistency were just right, not too heavy.
The downer was the itty bitty speckles of salmon floating in the soup.
There were definitely more carrots than anything and
my salmon craving left unsatisfied.
salmon chowder.author: Nova P.
salmon chowder.review:
This unique venue is one of the more alluring locations with prime real estate in the heart of the ferry building. I love the Japanese delicatessen concept with a menu of mouthwatering items from sushi, tempura, soups, bento boxes and more. Portions are on the smaller size, and prices are higher. During the middle of lunch rush you'll generally see a long line and a deli counter with Asian fusion menu options. Don't let the long line scare you, they have a well oiled operation that gets the line moving quickly.

Delica uses quality ingredients, locally sourced and hormone free. I went with a group of friends, and we all ordered the salmon chowder. On a positive note the flavor and consistency were just right, not too heavy. The downer was the itty bitty speckles of salmon floating in the soup. There were definitely more carrots than anything and my salmon craving left unsatisfied. The alaskan crab croquette was amazing, but for $5+, I wish it was a more sizable portion. My friends ordered the potato croquette which was substantially larger than its crab counterpart. 

Seating is available in the public communal area with the bay view, adjacent to Delica and a few of the other businesses. There doesn't appear to be any shortage of people going to Delica-whether it be tourists or locals. While this probably won't make it on my regular lunch rotation, on occasion I may stop by to grab a la carte items like the roast beef sushi or that crab croquette.

excerpts: I'm a big fan of their chicken dumplings, eggplant salad, spinach salad and salmon chowder.
I don't recommend coming for dinner though since many of their items are sold out after 5pm and the rest tend not to be fresh, but for lunch Delica is one of the best options around.
salmon chowder.author: Carl W.
salmon chowder.review: Tasty and healthy Japanese food at a reasonable price, considering the location. You can get a 3-item combo for $11 and the portions are big enough to fill you up for sure. I'm a big fan of their chicken dumplings, eggplant salad, spinach salad and salmon chowder. I don't recommend coming for dinner though since many of their items are sold out after 5pm and the rest tend not to be fresh, but for lunch Delica is one of the best options around.

excerpts: - Salmon chowder: It was okay.
salmon chowder.author: Sara L.
salmon chowder.review:
After eating lunch here with my boyfriend, I'm confused as to how Delica has kept its 4 star rating.

Lunch combo plate ($10.50):
- Chicken dumplings: Tasted good, but it only came with two and they were both cold, even though it's under the category of "hot food" :(
- Eggplant salad: Really good flavors. Comes with ground pork, which I enjoyed, but just a note for the vegetarians out there! Probably the best tasting part of our lunch.
- Salmon chowder: It was okay. Could have used more salmon, and the soup itself was a bit watery.

The large beef curry ($11) wasn't very large, and again, it was just okay--Not as flavorful as other Japanese curries that I've had. Tender beef chunks, but no potatoes, to my disappointment.

Overall, our lunch was good, but definitely not great. My biggest complaints were the cold chicken dumplings and the small portion sizes.

excerpts: I also always get the salmon chowder (It is $1 extra with the combo) because I love my chowder.
salmon chowder.author: Benita M.
salmon chowder.review:
If you have the Paypal app, make sure you clip the coupon. You can get $3-$4 off from this place if you pay through the app. What a steal!

Depending on what time you come, expect a line and a wait. Once the line circled to the place where they sell honey, took about 20 minutes until I got my food.

One thing I like about Delica is how fresh their food is. Everything here looks delicious however, the price puts you off. They sell ONE crab croquette for $4. ONE PIECE. Please just kill me. I usually get the lunch combo, Main, Salad, Soup, which is about $9.75.

My favorite so far is the Tofu salad. It does have a heavy cilantro taste (which I hate) but there's just something about that salad that is refreshing. I also always get the salmon chowder (It is $1 extra with the combo) because I love my chowder.

For Main items, anything fried is good haha. I've had the pleasure to try the crab croquette and the pork cutlet. Both were fried well and the insides were cooked nicely. I also tried their Japanese Beef Curry. I like how big the portion is for a regular $8.50. Taste was just ok... I think I will stick to the main items on display.

On regular days, I would not come here because of how pricey it is and the small portions. However, I will take advantage of the Paypal deal!

excerpts: Having been a cool breezy day out in the water, I was hankering for some soul-soothing soup, so salmon chowder it had to be; and included a cup, I did.
salmon chowder.author: Umesh T.
salmon chowder.review:
For a deli-like outfit, it was pretty good and actually exceeded my expectations. I had the combo #4 that was the Main Entree + Salad + Rice.

Having been a cool breezy day out in the water, I was hankering for some soul-soothing soup, so salmon chowder it had to be; and included a cup, I did.

The chowder was pretty good! Lightly creamy and not too thick nor watery. I loved the little chunks of potatoes and veggies in it. The occasional little chunks of salmon (but of course) was always a welcome interlude for the senses.

The rice was jasmine, with some black sesame seeds sprinkled over it. I liked the texture so I had nothing to complain about.

The sweet and spicy chicken was decent, even more so considering that it came out of a hot plate under a heat lamp. It was mildly breaded, as most generic Asian "sweet/spicy chicken" are served, with a touch of crunchiness.

The eggplant salad was what wowed me. I think it contained crumbled/scrambled tofu that gave the dish a minced meat-like texture. There were some noodles and cilantro, and something that gave it a nice umami flavour. I couldn't quite figure out what. It was somewhat like a baba ghanoush.

All in all, it hit the spot and I'd drop in for a quick bite the next time I'm hungry, and around the area looking to not strain my wallet too much (which is not to say it's cheap either, at $15 + tax for my meal including a bottled matcha tea latte).

excerpts: Tried it out, overpriced food, also Salmon chowder was way to salty
I don't know if we are the only ones.
Also, when we got a new soup the person was extremely rude thinking we did not have taste.
All in all overpriced food with food that "looks" good
salmon chowder.author: Taerie K.
salmon chowder.review: I went here because I got off the bart for a quick lunch when we spotted this place. Tried it out, overpriced food, also Salmon chowder was way to salty I don't know if we are the only ones. Also, when we got a new soup the person was extremely rude thinking we did not have taste. All in all overpriced food with food that "looks" good

excerpts: I also recently tried their salmon chowder, which was pretty good, too.
salmon chowder.author: Sara T.
salmon chowder.review:
You know, I love their food. I really do. But the lunch specials they give so little food that makes me so sad. Are they underestimating the amount of food I can eat? Of the couple times I've been and ordered the lunch combo with entree and salad and things, I've only had one server that gave me enough food to eat. I'm thinking next time, I'll order their curry again because that meal is usually filling and hearty. 

All complaints about the portions aside, I really like their eggplant salad and their chicken dumplings. I was weary at first because I thought I was getting one tiny little chicken meatball but you actually get two. Yay! I also recently tried their salmon chowder, which was pretty good, too. 

Really tempted to take a star off for the portion size... but I really am a fan of their food, so four stars it is.

excerpts: SALMON CHOWDER (
$4/cup) - sounds delicious, doesn't it.
Well it's just ok.
I got excited seeing all the orange pieces of salmon floating in my chowder only to realize it's carrots.
I was lucky to he
3 pieces of tiny salmon meat.
Not all bites had salmon and the chowder wasn't rich (unless you get a salmon piece).
salmon chowder.author: Jane A.
salmon chowder.review:
MAYBE ITS JUST ME...
(2 stars) 

But I wasn't feeling this place.

FOOD, meh
PRICES, decent
SERVICE, fast 
AMBIANCE, cafe style 

HEFER STATS. 

Exploring new grounds, don't come here often and I see why!! I regret to inform myself, I wasted money. 

SALMON CHOWDER ($4/cup) - sounds delicious, doesn't it. Well it's just ok. I got excited seeing all the orange pieces of salmon floating in my chowder only to realize it's carrots. I was lucky to he 3 pieces of tiny salmon meat. Not all bites had salmon and the chowder wasn't rich (unless you get a salmon piece). AND it doesn't come with bread. 

HIJIKI RICE BALL ($2) - uhm don't buy something cause it looks pretty. Because it's not tasty. Smells like tofu and tastes LIKE HAY!!!! I can barely consume it without me saying to myself "wff". 

Will I be back? NO. 

Until the next review...

excerpts: so I just went with the suggestion of the person at the cash counter and I  ordered the lunch menu with the Hijiki and Soybean Salad + Salmon Chowder Soup + Crab Croquette .
Also ordered the Matcha Green tea ice cream which was very refreshing and different from the usual ice creams because of the after taste of green tea.
salmon chowder.author: Anand S.
salmon chowder.review: There were so many interesting dishes on the menu so I just went with the suggestion of the person at the cash counter and I  ordered the lunch menu with the Hijiki and Soybean Salad + Salmon Chowder Soup + Crab Croquette . Also ordered the Matcha Green tea ice cream which was very refreshing and different from the usual ice creams because of the after taste of green tea.

excerpts: We also shared a miso soup and the salmon chowder but the portion was ultra small for a bowl size at $7.50.
Flavors were "just ok".
salmon chowder.author: Julie L.
salmon chowder.review: Based on the photos and prior reviews, I was excited to try the 9 item bento. Loved that there was variety but everything fell below my expectations. The pieces of sushi were dry while the small bits of salad were almost the same w/ very few distinguishable ingredients. Ordered the shrimp cake, crab croquette and 3 chicken dumplings. While the shrimp cake and crab croquette were equally enjoyable w/ the deliciously moist filling, we both didn't like the chicken  dumpling. Not only did it not look like a dumpling, I just couldn't find anything that is worth $2+/piece...especially the flavor. We also shared a miso soup and the salmon chowder but the portion was ultra small for a bowl size at $7.50. Flavors were "just ok".

excerpts: I had the chicken patty which was quite good along with some seaweed salad and salmon chowder.
I also liked that you could get tiny pieces of kind of expensive ($1.50) tonkatsu which is quite tender and tasty.
This is nice cause I often want a bite or two of katsu but don't necessarily want to eat a whole pork chop for lunch.
salmon chowder.author: Misha T.
salmon chowder.review:
Reminds me a lot of Tangerine in Berkeley, as something of a fancy and mostly healthy lunch deli that specializes in a certain type of food, Japanese in this case.

I had the chicken patty which was quite good along with some seaweed salad and salmon chowder. I also liked that you could get tiny pieces of kind of expensive ($1.50) tonkatsu which is quite tender and tasty. This is nice cause I often want a bite or two of katsu but don't necessarily want to eat a whole pork chop for lunch.

excerpts: The salmon chowder is surprisingly smooth and creamy.
It tasted earthy; flavors were there.
There were chunks of salmon and did not taste fishy at all.
The cold adashi tofu was refreshing and light.
The shaved dakon and scallion are the stars to the tofu.
salmon chowder.author: Frances C.
salmon chowder.review: Staff is pleasant and friendly.  Had a taste test on carrot ginger soup, didn't really care for that combination.  The salmon chowder is surprisingly smooth and creamy. It tasted earthy; flavors were there.   There were chunks of salmon and did not taste fishy at all.  The cold adashi tofu was refreshing and light.  The shaved dakon and scallion are the stars to the tofu.

excerpts: I loved their eggplant salad, veggie tempura and salmon chowder!
salmon chowder.author: Shanna N.
salmon chowder.review:
Yum! I loved their eggplant salad, veggie tempura and salmon chowder! 

The ginger beef rice bowl looked great too. 

Super quick, fresh, and tasty! Perfect for a grab and go lunch :)

excerpts: The  croquet is delicious as well as the salmon chowder.
salmon chowder.author: Sharine d.
salmon chowder.review: Excellent fast food...Japanese+ American meets for great quick take& go meals. The  croquet is delicious as well as the salmon chowder.

excerpts: I went with the burdock salad, the map tofu salad and the salmon chowder.
Everything tasted great - fresh, flavorful, and satisfying.
In my little to-go box, I mixed the two salads together
and so I'm not sure if one was better than the other because I ate them as one and loved it.
I'll be back to try more - including maybe some of their mains.
salmon chowder.author: David B.
salmon chowder.review: I have walked in and out of Delica multiple times on my many ventures through the Ferry Building but finally did one of their lunch combos, and was very happy I did! I went with the burdock salad, the map tofu salad and the salmon chowder. Everything tasted great - fresh, flavorful, and satisfying. In my little to-go box, I mixed the two salads together and so I'm not sure if one was better than the other because I ate them as one and loved it. I'll be back to try more - including maybe some of their mains.

excerpts: The salmon chowder was delicious though!
Will be back to try other things and hopefully update the review to a better one.
salmon chowder.author: Amanda C.
salmon chowder.review: Expected the food here to be amazing, but it was just alright and overpriced just like other places around this area. The service was nice, and the matcha pudding was not as good as I expected. I had the eggplant salad in my lunch combo and that was probably the best thing. The kakiage tempura thing wasn't as flavorful as I hoped and hard to eat. The salmon chowder was delicious though! Will be back to try other things and hopefully update the review to a better one.

excerpts: I also had the salmon chowder which was served warm, very thick, and creamy.
2 small cubes of salmon and a ton of carrots and celery was found amid the chowder.
salmon chowder.author: Ada C.
salmon chowder.review:
Japanese + Fast food (healthier version) + Deli = Delica.

I came here with my boyfriend yesterday for lunch and was utterly surprised at how tasty everything was. The options for the lunch specials were pretty simple, you get three choices (salad, main, soup) and basically any combo of those will be priced differently. The portions were sufficent enough to get you full, but the flavoring of everything was simply orgasmic.

I can not rave enough about the wasabi potato salad (with lettuce, snap peas, slices of potato) and just enough of that wasabi taste to kick your tastebuds into gear.

I also had the salmon chowder which was served warm, very thick, and creamy. 2 small cubes of salmon and a ton of carrots and celery was found amid the chowder. It was warming to the soul on such a chilly day by the embarcadero.

The adegashi tofu was good, but not out of the ordinary. My boyfriend had the burdock salad and absolutely loved it. There was definitely a lot of items on Delica that looked delicious and worthy of going back to try.

excerpts: My favorite would be that eggplant salad, chicken tofu patty, soba noodles, and the salmon chowder!!!
salmon chowder.author: KaYee W.
salmon chowder.review:
I love this place! Only reason it's missing one star is because of the way they pack their portions for the lunch combo (a bit small...) 

Regardless, their food is always fresh and yummy! I love coming here with my the co-workers at the company I work for for lunch. My favorite would be that eggplant salad, chicken tofu patty, soba noodles, and the salmon chowder!!! :-D

Oh did I mention even with a line, the line moves pretty fast~

I'm wondering how long it's going to take me to get tired of this place...? Like never?!!! :-)

excerpts: Had the chicken meat balls, spinach sesame salad and  salmon chowder.
All really good, just wished I had more than 2 meat balls.
salmon chowder.author: Massimo P.
salmon chowder.review: Had the chicken meat balls, spinach sesame salad and  salmon chowder. All really good, just wished I had more than 2 meat balls.

excerpts: My favorite is the salmon chowder, and the Soybean/Hijiki Salad.
The food is very fresh and tasty, but it comes with a price!
salmon chowder.author: Tanya T.
salmon chowder.review:
They have a wide selection of dishes both vegetarian, non-vegetarian, Vegan, and pre-made bento boxes! Fresh, flavorful, different than other bentos.
My favorite is the salmon chowder, and the Soybean/Hijiki Salad.  The food is very fresh and tasty, but it comes with a price!

excerpts: So far I've had the salmon chowder (the cup is plenty), the carrot-ginger soup, the crab croquette (amaze!), and the wasabi-potato salad (double amaze!).
salmon chowder.author: Marcel M.
salmon chowder.review: This place is delightful. The menu is simple, each dish is made there from scratch, and the ingredients are high quality. Top it off with reasonable prices, and I'm a big fan. So far I've had the salmon chowder (the cup is plenty), the carrot-ginger soup, the crab croquette (amaze!), and the wasabi-potato salad (double amaze!). I really want to try their bento boxes, which are certainly a step up from your average greasy bento box during lunch downtown. Getting to eat this lunch watching the water from the Ferry Building adds to the charm.

excerpts:
This is what we got:

Salmon chowder: watery, undercooked pieces of potatoes and just a few pieces of salmon and served with a tiny piece of bread.
salmon chowder.author: Dave V.
salmon chowder.review:
Had to be some of the worst food in the ferry building. I'm not foreign to new flavors and I love trying new foods. This place had ready made food displayed and it looked good behind the glass. What a disappointment. This is what we got:

Salmon chowder: watery, undercooked pieces of potatoes and just a few pieces of salmon and served with a tiny piece of bread. 

Hijiki salad: just not a good flavor. 

Shrimp cake and tempura nest thing: fried food served cold. We all know how bad that tastes. The nest thing was soggy and nasty. 

Chicken meatball thing and piece of sesame teriyaki chicken. Also cold and bland. 

Wasted 24+ bucks and not going back.

excerpts: Salmon chowder was on the sweet side (not what your taste buds expect) and carrot/ginger soup lacked any seasoning (but was tasty once I added a fair amount of salt).
The "spicy" tuna roll was HORRIBLE.
The tuna was completely without any seasoning at all...
NO salt or SPICE.
I think the chef literally forgot to season the fish before making the roll.
The tempura nest was completely cold and greasy (it's probably decent if you ask them to make it fresh) and the Agassi tofu main dish was as awful as the spicy tuna...
Hard, bland and completely tasteless.

I have to say, though, when I took the unacceptable dishes back inside and gave the manager my feedback, she graciously refunded my money, thanked me twice for letting them know that I was not pleased and offered to make me fresh dishes, free of charge.
Bravo for the excellent customer services.
salmon chowder.author: Nichole M.
salmon chowder.review: Just had an early dinner at Delica. We ordered a variety of items from the menu board and the display case.  My advise is that if something on the case looks good, ask to try it first.  The cold salads were all delicious.  Salmon chowder was on the sweet side (not what your taste buds expect) and carrot/ginger soup lacked any seasoning (but was tasty once I added a fair amount of salt).  The "spicy" tuna roll was HORRIBLE. The tuna was completely without any seasoning at all...NO salt or SPICE. I think the chef literally forgot to season the fish before making the roll.  The tempura nest was completely cold and greasy (it's probably decent if you ask them to make it fresh) and the Agassi tofu main dish was as awful as the spicy tuna... Hard, bland and completely tasteless. I have to say, though, when I took the unacceptable dishes back inside and gave the manager my feedback, she graciously refunded my money, thanked me twice for letting them know that I was not pleased and offered to make me fresh dishes, free of charge. Bravo for the excellent customer services.

excerpts: After waiting in a long line, I got a wasabi potato salad, small salmon chowder, and two pieces of roast beef sushi.
All portions were very small.
salmon chowder.author: Harrison T.
salmon chowder.review: Very pricey lunch for very little food. After waiting in a long line, I got a wasabi potato salad, small salmon chowder, and two pieces of roast beef sushi. All portions were very small.

excerpts: Salmon Chowder -- About a half cup of thick flavorless soup.
What you would expect at a Red lobster.
The "salmon" consisted of about a 1/4 teaspoon of Smoked salmon sprinkled over the top.
salmon chowder.author: Mabel S.
salmon chowder.review:
Too expensive. $12+  for

Wasabi Potato salad -- Whoops forgot the potato. It was limp romain lettuce with a potato slime all over it. The one piece of potato was so undercooked it was crunchy.

Sweet and Spicy chicken -- 3 tiny bites of chicken. Sauce was alright. It had been around for a while. Very dry.

Salmon Chowder -- About a half cup of thick flavorless soup. What you would expect at a Red lobster. The "salmon" consisted of about a 1/4 teaspoon of Smoked salmon sprinkled over the top.

excerpts: The salmon chowder only had one tiny salmon in it, and I looked very hard for my salmon in the soup.
There are many carrots which tricked me into thinking they were salmon at first.
I did not like that feeling.
The taste was expected, nothing special.
The beef curry bowl has 60% rice and 40% curry, when it should be at least 50/50.
Did not like that at all.
salmon chowder.author: Diana C.
salmon chowder.review: The salmon chowder only had one tiny salmon in it, and I looked very hard for my salmon in the soup. There are many carrots which tricked me into thinking they were salmon at first. I did not like that feeling. The taste was expected, nothing special. The beef curry bowl has 60% rice and 40% curry, when it should be at least 50/50. Did not like that at all.

excerpts: it was great though I wish it had been warm instead of cold), and salmon chowder.
The salmon chowder was basically chowder with a small chunk of cooked salmon added in, but it tasted amazing!
salmon chowder.author: Stephanie C.
salmon chowder.review: Came here for lunch during my first time in the Ferry Building and it was pretty good! Basically an Asian fusion takeout place, with assorted entrees, soups, salads, and combos. I had a lunch combo with fried pork cutlets (delicious), Chinese chicken salad (chicken strips with celery and carrot sticks and some other veggies I don't remember - it was great though I wish it had been warm instead of cold), and salmon chowder. The salmon chowder was basically chowder with a small chunk of cooked salmon added in, but it tasted amazing!

excerpts:
Carrot and ginger soup is my favorite among the soups.
Also try the Spicy Burdock and Lotus Roots Salad .
carrot and ginger soup.author: Steffi C.
carrot and ginger soup.review:
I have become quite fond of this place. A great spot for lunch.
Be sure to get in before 12. The line can get long but they do move quickly.
I often get the main + soup + salad combo. The chicken dumplings are great. I also like the Kakiage tempura. 
Carrot and ginger soup is my favorite among the soups.
Also try the Spicy Burdock and Lotus Roots Salad .
The bento boxes look good. Will try it sometime.
Overall worth the money!

excerpts: Agedashi Tofu Steak
- This was my favorite.
I've eaten this in a handful of restaurants in different countries and the tentsuyu sauce was very good.
It was the right amount of sweet and savory.
I ate this cold, which was fine, but I'm not sure if you are supposed to heat it up first.
agedashi tofu steak.author: Junella T.
agedashi tofu steak.review:
I'm so torn. I wanted to love this place, but it was only a like for me. I'll def return and try some of their other items on the menu, but I ordered from Caviar and they didn't carry everything. Warning though the portions are small for the price you're paying. I spent $20+ and only received a piece of tofu and a bento box.

Agedashi Tofu Steak - This was my favorite. I've eaten this in a handful of restaurants in different countries and the tentsuyu sauce was very good. It was the right amount of sweet and savory. I ate this cold, which was fine, but I'm not sure if you are supposed to heat it up first. A little pricey at $5 a piece.

Assorted 9-item Sushi Bento - I loved the arrangement of this and the presentation, but I wish I got to pick what went inside my bento box. It was a pre-set amount of things. I loved most of the things in there, but my favorite was the chicken dumpling and the hijiki & soybean. The flavors were great and pretty close to a bento box from the corner store in japan. I love burdock but I wasn't a fan of the way they mixed theirs. The celery in the mix threw the flavors off.  My least favorite was the Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad. I was expecting it to taste like the sweet potato salad that's available in most Japanese grocery stores, but the wasab was overpowering. 

The bento also came with 4 pieces of sushi from a roll.The bento has one piece Salmon, Tuna, 16 grain, and Shrimp & Crab. Besides the raw piece of salmon and tuna on top of the roll, everything inside the roll was cooked. The roll also had pieces of raw red peppers. It threw off the taste completely. If you had to add a veggie, they should have went with takuwan. The only roll that I finished was the 16 grain and I liked that one the most.

excerpts:
Some other items I love here are:

*Organic Agedashi Tofu Steak: Silken
agedashi tofu steak.author: Michelle T.
agedashi tofu steak.review:
Lines here are RIDIC but worth the wait!

I love Japanese style bento boxes and donburis!

My favorite here is the Ginger Beef Bowl (Natural Japanese supreme ground Kobe Beef and ginger served with shredded egg and steamed rice. Topped with green onion) It is full of protein, filling, a good price, and most importantly SOOO delicious. 

They usually have this bowl as grab and pay so no need to wait in the same RIDIC line as those who are waiting to order from the menu whatever dish their hearts desire. 

For grab and go there's usually onigiri and premade bento boxes.

Some other items I love here are:

*Organic Agedashi Tofu Steak: Silken (Kinugoshi) firm tofu is lightly dusted with potato starch and then deep fried until golden brown. It's then served in a hot tentsuyu broth made od dashi, mirin, and sho-yu (Japanese soy sauce), and topped with grated daikon. Though it is deep fried, it does not taste heavy! It is perfectly fried!

*Spicy Burdock Root Salad: A spicy mix of braised burdock and konnyaku (mountain potato) tossed with thin slices of white onion, celery, julienne carrots, and wild mizuna.
This isn't really spicy but WHATEVER it is amazing!!!

*Hijiki and Soybean Salad: Hijiki (seaweed rich in calcium, iron, and fiber) mixed with dried soybeans, edamame, konnyaku (mountain potato), daikon, wild mizuna, fried tofu, and kuko (wolfberry) cooked with soy sauce.

Gosh, thinking about all the delicious food is making me so hungry.

excerpts: I chose the Agedashi Tofu Steak, which is fancifully described as "Silken tofu lightly dusted with potato starch and deep fried.
agedashi tofu steak.author: Brandi W.
agedashi tofu steak.review:
After a failed attempt at locating a proper sushi restaurant with vegan options in the FiDi, I found Delica on my handy-dandy Yelp app. There are lots of items that cater to vegetarians and vegans, all of which are clearly marked on the menu and the labels. 

I stopped by their to-go deli counter and ordered a lunch combo. It comes with one entree, white rice sprinkled with black sesame seeds, and one salad. I chose the Agedashi Tofu Steak, which is fancifully described as "Silken tofu lightly dusted with potato starch and deep fried. Served in a tentsuyu made of dashi, mirin and shoyu, and topped with grated Daikon". 

It was delicious! I would definitely order this again. When it comes to tofu, I like mine firm, so their version was a perfect fit for my tastebuds. If you prefer your tofu steak on the softer side, you might not care for it. 

For the salad, I chose the Hijiki and Soybean Salad (Hijiki seaweed mixed with dried soybeans, edamame, konnyaku [mountain yam], daikon, wild mizuna, fried tofu, and kuko (wolfberry) and cooked with soy sauce). This was a solid accompaniment, although a touch on the salty side. 

There appears to be no veggie option for the miso soup, which is terribly sad to me. Delica, add a vegan version and I would stop a lot more often!

It's a little pricey, and they give you a LOT of rice but very little salad. Understandable, since it runs for about $18 a pound (jeez!). I think I will venture back to the Ferry Building sometime soon and sample more of their tasty delights.

excerpts: We ended up getting an agedashi tofu steak, roast beef nigiri, chicken dumpling and miso soup.
We enjoyed everything.
The flavors were spot on and you could taste the freshness and lightness of the food.
agedashi tofu steak.author: Cindy T.
agedashi tofu steak.review:
I wish we had something similar to Delica in Silicon Valley. It's fresh, organic and healthy! And SO many choices - bento boxes, sushi, rice bowls, cold sides, soups, hot sides, and so much more. We ended up getting an agedashi tofu steak, roast beef nigiri, chicken dumpling and miso soup. We enjoyed everything. The flavors were spot on and you could taste the freshness and lightness of the food. Definitely makes for a good lunch spot.

Prices are a bit pricey, but what isn't at the Ferry Building?

excerpts: I also got the agedashi tofu steak, which was served cold.
It was pretty good, but a bit pricey.
I didn't know I was suppose to go back up to the counter to pick up my bowl
so I was standing on the side waiting for someone to call it out.
Fortunately for me, the bowl was still warm.
The katsu sandwich was pretty good too, but I wish they would had a choice to make it when you order it.
A fresh and hot tonkatsu sandwich would have been better.
agedashi tofu steak.author: Lan N.
agedashi tofu steak.review: Not bad at all. Interesting concept. Japanese flair on food brought in a deli like atmosphere. There are a bunch of bentos and sandwiches boxed and wrapped up ready to go. It can make for a quick lunch. I got the ginger beef bowl. The crumbled tamago was a nice touch. Gave it a bit of sweetness to the savory beef. I also got the agedashi tofu steak, which was served cold. It was pretty good, but a bit pricey. I didn't know I was suppose to go back up to the counter to pick up my bowl so I was standing on the side waiting for someone to call it out. Fortunately for me, the bowl was still warm. The katsu sandwich was pretty good too, but I wish they would had a choice to make it when you order it. A fresh and hot tonkatsu sandwich would have been better.

excerpts: I'm in love w/ their organic agedashi tofu steak and their tofu/chicken patty w/ Hijiki.
The tofu was soft yet did not break at the touch of my fork... savory, a little sweet, and so light that I would not feel guilty eating 5 of these even though these babies are deep fried.
The tofu/chicken patty was not deep fried and it reminded me of a Vietnamese dish called "trung duc" which is somewhat similar to "cha trung".
I never tasted any dish that reminded me of the 2 dishes I mentioned above
agedashi tofu steak.author: Tram N.
agedashi tofu steak.review:
I'm in love.. 

I'm in love w/ their organic agedashi tofu steak and their tofu/chicken patty w/ Hijiki.  The tofu was soft yet did not break at the touch of my fork... savory, a little sweet, and so light that I would not feel guilty eating 5 of these even though these babies are deep fried.  The tofu/chicken patty was not deep fried and it reminded me of a Vietnamese dish called "trung duc" which is somewhat similar to "cha trung".  I never tasted any dish that reminded me of the 2 dishes I mentioned above so I pretty much inhaled it and was nostalgic a bit because I used to eat trung duc a lot as a kid.  

Service- awesome! 

Selections- didn't notice anything else because I'm trying not to over eat.

Restrictions- no carbonated beverages (that's right, no Coke Zero).  I almost cried.

Pricing- PRICEY but you can't put a price tag on quality!

Overall- one of the best girl dates ever.  Thanks for suggesting lunch here, Lora!

excerpts: Try either the Tofu & Chicken Patty with Hijiki or the Organic Agedashi Tofu Steak.
agedashi tofu steak.author: Diana V.
agedashi tofu steak.review:
I'm a big fan of the tasty bento boxes with choice of combos. I like to enjoy them with a friend while sitting at one of the indoor large wooden tables, or more likely, outdoors enjoying the view from the Ferry Building.

Start with the rice, sprinkled with black sesame seeds. Add the Asparagus with Traditional Sesame Dressing (my favorite!!).

Try either the Tofu & Chicken Patty with Hijiki or the Organic Agedashi Tofu Steak.

I never get any of the fried options.

A filling combination if you don't want a heavy lunchtime meal. 

It's a treat for the $10 price tag, but I always find it satisfying.

The downside are the two crazy lines -- one for bento combo boxes (unless you purchase a pre-made bento outside of the shop) -- and the other for single item orders.

I wish they would put up some signage for the uninitiated to ease confusion.

excerpts:
I tried the Roast Beef Sushi and the Agedashi Tofu Steak and the Potato Croquette. 
Everything was mediocre but the Roast Beef Sushi was NOT good. 
It was flavorless and so chewy that I had to spit it out. 
(UGH!)  
It looks really good but the texture of the beef is not great at all and they need to add some sort of flavor to it. 
i dont know if I'll ever try Delica again.. there are far better places that the ferry building has to offer
agedashi tofu steak.author: Jessica S.
agedashi tofu steak.review:
I had high expectations for this place... I tried the Roast Beef Sushi and the Agedashi Tofu Steak and the Potato Croquette. 
Everything was mediocre but the Roast Beef Sushi was NOT good. 
It was flavorless and so chewy that I had to spit it out. (UGH!)  
It looks really good but the texture of the beef is not great at all and they need to add some sort of flavor to it. 
i dont know if I'll ever try Delica again.. there are far better places that the ferry building has to offer

excerpts: We both got the vegetarian bento - which is actually also vegan as far as I can tell, even though it is labeled "vegetarian" - which came with hijiki and soybean salad, spicy burdock root salad, agedashi tofu steak and rice with black sesame seeds.
The rice was the best part, which I think is a little bizarre.
agedashi tofu steak.author: Madeleine T.
agedashi tofu steak.review:
After a morning of errands I met my omnivorous sweetheart for lunch at the Ferry Building. Somehow I had never eaten here! Delica looked like a fabulous option - clean and pretty in a minimalist way. We hadn't eaten Japanese food in a while, plus never Japanese deli food, specifically, so that was kind of exciting as well. Looking - belatedly! - at other reviews now, perhaps it is because we grabbed the pre-made bento boxes rather than ordering a la carte items  that we were not nearly as satisfied as other reviewers? I honestly have no idea.

We both got the vegetarian bento - which is actually also vegan as far as I can tell, even though it is labeled "vegetarian" - which came with hijiki and soybean salad, spicy burdock root salad, agedashi tofu steak and rice with black sesame seeds. The rice was the best part, which I think is a little bizarre. I mean 

1) I like good rice and 
2) bad rice can certainly ruin a meal, but 
3) I don't know that rice should be the best part of any meal. 

So. The rice was the best part, but not amazingly great, zowie-powie, rock 'em-sock 'em rice. There was no subtlety to the other dishes, and no medley or mixture of flavor - everything was weirdly, overwhelmingly sweet, and the tofu wasn't fresh at all. All that for $10 - each! - makes me a little sad.

I had started this review with two stars but had to take it down to one because I just can't even. Boo.

Veg*ns take note: the spinach sesame salad is prepared with traditional bonito flake dashi - they mention this on their website, but I am not sure if it is clear at the deli.

excerpts: Tofu and chicken patty with hijiki: meatball like with tofu and chicken and bits of carrots.
tofu and chicken patty with hijiki.author: Cici T.
tofu and chicken patty with hijiki.review:
Why are the graphics for this little shop so adorable? I let them lure me in, yes I did. The cartoonized orange carrots, yellow radishes, and green asparagus conjure that homey, organic, and delicate feel. Hence the name Delica, I suppose.

(RyanY, I'm so glad you ate here and approve! Your mom must cook up such memorable Japanese meals.)

For the sake of diversity and equally to appease my gluttony, I ordered 2 lunch meals (I shared with someone else..).

Hijiki and soybean salad: with edamame, konnyaku (mountain potato), daikon, fried tofu, kuko (aka wolfberry or goji, the bright red berry), as well as wild mizuna (a mustard).

Spinach and sesame salad: cold spinach mixed with rougher sesame paste (slightly sweet to the palate).

Spicy burdock root salad: braised burdock (the winner! a mighty root vegetable), konnyaku (mountain potato), onion, celery, julienne carrots, and wild mizuna. (Burdock, which I didn't even know is called that, is so refreshing!)

Chinese chicken salad: with Japanese cucumber, daikon, carrot, and celery in a soy dressing. (I probably wouldn't order this one again for a lack of creativity in the flavors on Delica's part).

Agedashi tofu: firm tofu deep fried and served with a thick tentsuyu broth topped with grated daikon (served cold! that part I didn't like.. the deep fried covering was soggy and the taste of oil was too apparent).

Tofu and chicken patty with hijiki: meatball like with tofu and chicken and bits of carrots. (not mindblowing, but inspiration to something I might try to make in my own kitchen. also served cold).

Accompanying the two lunch dishes, which were carefully carried from Delica to the rustic wooden tables in the hall, were a salmon rice ball and an edamame and kuko rice ball. Our meal definitely looked the part. Now for the tasting!

I was happy with lunch, more because of the ingredients used in the dishes and the way they were presented. Everything tasted delightful: light and yet flavorful. You don't get sick of any one dish and there's the added benefit that what you're dining on is both tasty and healthful.

Certain dishes are vegan friendly, namely the hijiki and soybean salad and the burdock salad. Others are vegetarian like the wasabi garlic potato salad and the green beans salads. Price may be a hindering factor for making this a regular lunch spot, but for the most part, my long time asian food trained tongue says yes.

excerpts:
Tofu and Chicken Patty with Hijiki (seaweed) $4.25 each - sounds like a good combination but not taste good 
2.
Chicken Dumpling with Sweet and Chili Sauce $2.00 each - small but yummy

; good to try 
3.

Carrot & Ginger Soup $3.50 cup/ $5.50 bowl - rich, very creamy and flavorful; good to add it as side dish 
4.
Roast Beef Sushi $2.50 each - really want to try this one, always looks fresh but too bad
I don't eat
tofu and chicken patty with hijiki.author: Liza T.
tofu and chicken patty with hijiki.review:
Came here couple times and I love this place. Clean, fast, creative, healthy and good quality......Although it is kind of overpriced but I think it is still worth it! 

All of their salads are so good, especially Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad. It is so unique and yummy! Besides salads, they also have fried and deli items: 
1. Tofu and Chicken Patty with Hijiki (seaweed) $4.25 each - sounds like a good combination but not taste good 
2. Chicken Dumpling with Sweet and Chili Sauce $2.00 each - small but yummy; good to try 
3. Carrot & Ginger Soup $3.50 cup/ $5.50 bowl - rich, very creamy and flavorful; good to add it as side dish 
4. Roast Beef Sushi $2.50 each - really want to try this one, always looks fresh but too bad I don't eat beef @-@ 

The only thing that I don't like is lack of seating. It is quite difficult to find a seat during peak lunch hour! They should have some more tables so we can all enjoy a good meal there!

excerpts: I had a tofu and chicken patty with hijiki as my main thing, and some kind of tofu salad as my salad, and then of course the white rice.
I also got a hot japanese tea, which comes in a starbucks style mug, and all together it was $10 something.
The thing was, it looked like the hot food/deli counter at wholefoods.
You can even find the same sort of foods there.
Only at wholefoods, they have more seats and tables.
Delica had a counter with some chairs, but not many, and they were full.
All the seats around the place were full, but we walked down over to the dock and found a bench there.
The food was good.
The patty looked like it would be hot
so I kept blowing on it by accident.
Of course it was cold, since it had been sitting on a deli plate with the others.
All 3 of us liked our food.
It filled me up at the time, but less than 2 hrs later, and im really hungry.
It's not as filling as my usual sandwich.
Overall, this is a good place to go if you're in the area and want lunch.
It's not special, but I guess there's nothing like it in walking distance.
Pretty good.
tofu and chicken patty with hijiki.author: Merredith L.
tofu and chicken patty with hijiki.review: I went here with 2 coworkers for lunch today, since one was leaving (boo). We walked to ferry building and wandered around and decided to try delica. There is one line for already made/packed meals, and another line with deli food that happens to be japanese. We got in the latter line. I had a lunch special that lets you choose one main meal, one salad, and rice. I had a tofu and chicken patty with hijiki as my main thing, and some kind of tofu salad as my salad, and then of course the white rice. I also got a hot japanese tea, which comes in a starbucks style mug, and all together it was $10 something. The thing was, it looked like the hot food/deli counter at wholefoods. You can even find the same sort of foods there. Only at wholefoods, they have more seats and tables. Delica had a counter with some chairs, but not many, and they were full. All the seats around the place were full, but we walked down over to the dock and found a bench there. The food was good.  The patty looked like it would be hot so I kept blowing on it by accident. Of course it was cold, since it had been sitting on a deli plate with the others. All 3 of us liked our food. It filled me up at the time, but less than 2 hrs later, and im really hungry. It's not as filling as my usual sandwich. Overall, this is a good place to go if you're in the area and want lunch. It's not special, but I guess there's nothing like it in walking distance. Pretty good.

excerpts: I also like the Kakiage tempura.
kakiage tempura.author: Steffi C.
kakiage tempura.review:
I have become quite fond of this place. A great spot for lunch.
Be sure to get in before 12. The line can get long but they do move quickly.
I often get the main + soup + salad combo. The chicken dumplings are great. I also like the Kakiage tempura. 
Carrot and ginger soup is my favorite among the soups.
Also try the Spicy Burdock and Lotus Roots Salad .
The bento boxes look good. Will try it sometime.
Overall worth the money!

excerpts: I like their Kakiage Tempura and the hoji softserve ice cream (served when available).
The rest of the food looks good, but I haven't tried it.
Very convenient location as it's downtown and the view is great.
No place to sit inside, so
I usually just go outside in the fresh air.
kakiage tempura.author: Roni K.
kakiage tempura.review: I like their Kakiage Tempura and the hoji softserve ice cream (served when available).  The rest of the food looks good, but I haven't tried it.   Very convenient location as it's downtown and the view is great.  No place to sit inside, so I usually just go outside in the fresh air.

excerpts: The kakiage tempura thing wasn't as flavorful as I hoped and hard to eat.
kakiage tempura.author: Amanda C.
kakiage tempura.review: Expected the food here to be amazing, but it was just alright and overpriced just like other places around this area. The service was nice, and the matcha pudding was not as good as I expected. I had the eggplant salad in my lunch combo and that was probably the best thing. The kakiage tempura thing wasn't as flavorful as I hoped and hard to eat. The salmon chowder was delicious though! Will be back to try other things and hopefully update the review to a better one.

excerpts: tonkatsu and the kakiage tempura.
the food looked great and smells awesome.
too bad it was all cold.
i probably shouldve asked if it was still hot or if they had any fresh ones.
but we all know how fried food tastes after its been out in the open for awhile.
kakiage tempura.author: Andy Z.
kakiage tempura.review:
snack

food: tonkatsu and the kakiage tempura. the food looked great and smells awesome. too bad it was all cold. i probably shouldve asked if it was still hot or if they had any fresh ones. but we all know how fried food tastes after its been out in the open for awhile. ***2/5

service: ordered to go. ***4/5

atmosphere: it looks really nice inside the ferry building. i thought it was a bakery at first, but then saw it has japanese food in there. they have shared seating with some other restaurants nearby. hardly any when we were there. we had to sit outside by the benches where a bird almost pooped on me. but at least you get a nice view of the pier. ***3/5

value: if the food was hot and fresh, it will definitely be better. they didnt even attempt heating lamps to keep the fried food warm. ***2/5

excerpts: The Kakiage Tempura was okay as there were a ton of veggies,but not much shrimp.
kakiage tempura.author: Edward W.
kakiage tempura.review:
The shrimp cake was absolutely amazing!! There was plenty of shrimp and it was just so yummy. The roast beef sushi is definitely unique to Delica as I have never seen it before, and a must buy. The Kakiage Tempura was okay as there were a ton of veggies,but not much shrimp. The tofu chicken was nothing special as it had very little taste. 

TLDR; Try the shrimp cake and roast beef sushi. It won't disappoint.

excerpts: The kakiage tempura was good.
It had a lot flavor and substance.
Whereas other sushi restaurants would serve tempura that is 50% batter, this place's tempura had very little batter.
kakiage tempura.author: Hiroshi K.
kakiage tempura.review:
I really like this place.  

The beef curry is excellent.  The quality of the meat is very good.  There were several large chunks of tender beef in the curry sauce.  The potatoes tasted good and was well cooked. They used high quality ingredients.  The curry sauce had the right amount of spice. 

 The hijiki rice ball tastes really good and was inexpensive.  The kakiage tempura was good. It had a lot flavor and substance. Whereas other sushi restaurants would serve tempura that is 50% batter, this place's tempura had very little batter. I could actually taste what is in the tempura. 

  I was really impressed with the roast beef sushi.  The roast beef sushi, aside from being visually striking, tasted really good.  The roast beef is really good (I am  not talking about the roast beef you get at a Subway sandwich shop.) The meat was very tender. It literally melted into my mouth as I bit into it.  

The tonkatsu and wasabi potato salad was fine.  I will go to this place again, even though it is a little pricey.

excerpts: Kakiage Tempura: Basically a cluster-funk of tempura vegetables and shrimp.
Major kudos for innovating on the rather common and boring tempura veggies.
I especially like the inner onions that didn't seem as deep fried and offered a more potent kick.
kakiage tempura.author: Adam B.
kakiage tempura.review:
Delica teaches a valuable lesson-- organic does not mean healthy and neither does Japanese .  They do have salads, but the enticing fried counter by the door will bring out the inner Jennifer Hudson in all of us!  It'd taste better if these treats came directly out of the grease, but they are still decent when slightly cold from behind the counter.  Definitely leaps and bounds ahead of other pre-cooked lunchtime deli options.

Pork Tonkatsu: The outside is crispy despite not being fresh out of the fryer.  The pork inside is partially cold and dry.  The sauce on top is nice.

Chicken Dumpling with Sweet Chili Sauce: Basically a fried chicken meatball.  The outside is really awesome with good seared meat and a nice chili glaze.  This one is small and went down a bit too fast.

Potato Croquette: Executed well, but could use some filling.  The potato and onion get a little boring, even with soy dipping sauce, after a few bites.

Fried Shrimp Cake: Yay for mainly being large pieces of shrimp instead of some crab cake-like filler!  I could do without the unimaginative tartar sauce.  Tastes better with soy or sriracha (from my desk).

Kakiage Tempura: Basically a cluster-funk of tempura vegetables and shrimp.  Major kudos for innovating on the rather common and boring tempura veggies.  I especially like the inner onions that didn't seem as deep fried and offered a more potent kick.  And the soy beans are an awesome taste and texture addition!

Hijiki Rice Ball: Too fishy for my tastes though I appreciated all the textures and flavors coming from the veggies, beans and seeds.  Perhaps a little less seaweed next time...

Cream Puff: When eating a cream puff, you know who I must compare to-- Beard Papa!  The cream was spot on, good vanilla hint and super creamy.  The puff itself was too chewy and tasted like something from a bodega snack section.  PS, I love how sugar is missing the organic prefix in the ingredient list... come one now, couldn't splurge on that one?

excerpts: I had the soba noodles with Kakiage tempura
and I honestly feel like this is the most delicious soup I have ever had in my entire life.
It was $8 and extremely filling.
I don't know if the other items are very filling but this one packs lot for the $.
I do not want to eat white rice
so I thought this would be a better choice since its buckwheat noodles and my tummy is happy.

I have very low knowledge and exposure to Japanese food and what is constituted as authentic vs. not but people say this place is very authentic so it makes me excited to explore Japanese food moving forward.
I have had the carrot ginger soup a few times and that is very creamy even though there is no dairy
and i have had a few dumplings here that were good but
little however the noodle soup is awesome.
The broth itself is so flavorful.
I picked up a rather large piece of tofu steak that is fried with ginger paste and I am excited to try that out tonight for dinner.
I am still way full from the soup

excerpts: The Kakiage Tempura was good
(See my photo).
The fried tofu was meh: the fried outside was good, but the inside was the same old bland tofu.
kakiage tempura.author: Scott F.
kakiage tempura.review: The Kakiage Tempura was good (See my photo).  The fried tofu was meh: the fried outside was good, but the inside was the same old bland tofu.

excerpts: Toss in some Roast Beef Sushi at $2 a piece or some freshly fried items (Kakiage Tempura, etc.)
and you're looking at a rather expensive lunch.
BUT please keep in mind that I have a chronic case of A$IAN CHEAPNE$$ (TM Ken K), so
kakiage tempura.author: d s.
kakiage tempura.review:
I know you all have opinions about who I am and what kind of guys I'm attracted to. To wit: you think I'm a fucking Potato Queen, right? RIGHT?!?! 

Look, look, it's okay, you can say it, who can blame you for thinking that, after all I skew towards the Occident in my bedside reading and The Ex was a white trash wunderkind, so it's easy to picture me trolling for DL tricks at the Aryan Nation compound or something.

HOWEVER, you're 100% wrong so to put it delicately fuck you. I've used ALL the crayons in the box, kids. I mean, I fucking have the Rainbow Coalition on speed dial, my ass is practically a Benetton ad, and my mouth is a branch of the Equal Rights Commission. I'M EQUAL OPPORTUNITY BITCHES! I like it all, especially my Asian brothas! 

Oh yes. I'm not one of those gaysians who recoil at the very thought of hooking up with another gaysian -- WHAT THE FUCK IS UP WITH THAT?!? Shit, I LOST my virginity at 15 to another Japo boy who, curiously enough, shared my first name which, now that I think about it, is a touch disturbing and probably fodder for my next therapy session and I should print this review out for my shrink, so I'll just do what I always do with traumatic incidents and pretend that never happened. 

I suppose I could chronicle all my sexual exploits in diversity in this review, but I'd probably be sued or something, so I'll just say that the delicious sozai food at Delica Rf-1 has been a consistently excellent performer. In fact, if I could describe to you all the wonders of Delica Rf-1, I'd have a composite of my ideal Japanese lover, who is... 

...SEXY. There's something about driftwood + sleek steel surfaces + glass that makes me cream my pants.

...MEATY. While I know that sushi purists may recoil at the thought  -- and for the record, I too hate California-Unicorn-Dragon-Dropping-Mayo-Surprise Jive Ass Rolls -- please understand me when I say that the Roast Beef nigiri sushi is a gustatory revelation of hormone-free local beef topping a lightly vinegared shari mound. Also, the Tonkatsu meets all expectations and the Chicken Gyoza (dumplings) are worth cheating on your spouse for.

...HEALTHY. Even though I'm an avowed carnivore, I often load up on the vegetarian/vegan items here. I love the vegan crunch of the burdock and konnyaku in the Spicy Burdock Root Salad, the Potato Croquettes have always been lightly fried and crisp (at least for me), and I seriously want to eat the Hijiki and Soybean Salad off someone's crotch -- the marvelous, delicate kelp flavor is enhanced by the snap and color of the soybeans. 

...EXPENSIVE.  Pre-packaged bentos range from $9.50 to $11, or you can prepare a plate featuring two salads and a deli item for $9. Toss in some Roast Beef Sushi at $2 a piece or some freshly fried items (Kakiage Tempura, etc.) and you're looking at a rather expensive lunch. BUT please keep in mind that I have a chronic case of A$IAN CHEAPNE$$ (TM Ken K), so the fact that I will happily hand over $10-$15 for a spread here really says A LOT.

Delica Rf-1, WILL YOU MARRY ME?!?

Wait, how big is your penis again?

excerpts: I really wanted to try the Tofu Steak with Miso Sauce and Kakiage Tempura (mixture of shredded vegetables, white shrimp in a tempura batter), but we already had too much food, but I think the next time I go, I'm just going to get three orders of roast beef sushi and call it a day.
kakiage tempura.author: Arnold G.
kakiage tempura.review:
Delica rf-1 is an interesting experiment in Japanese deli food. It's high-end (i.e. expensive), they use fresh ingredients and even utilize some of the vendors that reside in the Ferry Building (Cowgirl Creamery and Prather Meat Company). I was lucky enough to end up here with my wife and sister in law, so we were able to get a pretty good sampling of food between the three of us. $47 later, here's how things broke down. 

For all their talk about fresh, healthy and balanced meals, Delica's strength is definitely in their fried foods. The Potato Croquette was really nice, but the Crab Cream Croquette is even better. Tonkatsu was smaller and bite sized since it's made with pork tenderloin, a smaller, leaner cut of meat that benefits from being fried in panko. They're all perfectly fried, not greasy and still crispy after sitting in the display case for awhile. 

We also tried both curries -- Mushroom and Ground Chicken Curry and Beef Curry served with hot steamed rice -- and they were good, but they also weren't anything special either, although the beef curry featured some perfectly cooked Prather Ranch Meat.

But the real star at Delica is the Roast Beef Sushi. A rare piece of Meyer Ranch meat on top of sushi rice and topped with baby arugula, shallots and julienned radish. It not only looked beautiful, it was absolutely delicious. And to think it was almost an afterthought because it was in a separate box from the rest of the food and we were all pretty full by the time we ate them.

We also ordered the Spinach and Sesame Salad (Goma-ae), which was very bland, but my sister in law said that that's what it's supposed to taste like. The Sweet & Spicy Chicken was good but nothing mind blowing, as was the Chicken Dumpling with sweet chili sauce. 

I really wanted to try the Tofu Steak with Miso Sauce and Kakiage Tempura (mixture of shredded vegetables, white shrimp in a tempura batter), but we already had too much food, but I think the next time I go, I'm just going to get three orders of roast beef sushi and call it a day.

excerpts: The kakiage tempura is probably my least favorite, tempura is never good when it sits around.
kakiage tempura.author: Burrito M.
kakiage tempura.review:
Delica RF-1 is one of my staple favorite restaurants...

All of the fried food choices are fantastic.  They generally fry a batch and then serve from a plate as people order.  If you are lucky enough to get a freshly fried batch, you are in for a treat.  My faves are the tonkatsu (tonkatsu sauce is perfect, the meat is alway tender, I've never bit into any gristle or fat) and the croquette (yum!).  The kakiage tempura is probably my least favorite, tempura is never good when it sits around.

The tofu steaks are pretty damn good, if I do say so myself.  I've always looked at them in the case thinking, those look nasty!  But one day I tried the one with miso/mushroom topping and it was hella good!  Sometimes they do this agedashi style, which is just as good.

The japanese curries are decent, I like the ground beef and mushroom the best, although they are kinda chintzy on the rice.  Definitely hits the spot when it's cold and rainy.

The only thing I don't like from this joint is the okonomi yaki which I thought was sub-par.  Probably has something to do with the fact that they are pre-made and sitting there on the griddle all day until an unlucky chump orders one.

Rounding out their menu offerings, Delica RF-1 has a large variety of interesting salads, my faves are the green beans+sesame dressing and hijiki+soybean salads.  I like to order a bucket and eat it thru the week.

Note: They will sell the fried items by the piece and the salads by weight, but you can also order combo plates and bento boxes with your choice of entree (fried item, tofu steak, etc) and various salads which you can mix and match to your heart's content, great for lunch.

One time I walked by eating a cheese sandwich from Acme, the Japanese owner told me that my sandwich was not healthy and proceeded to give me a sample of his carrot soup.  For a place that deep fries 1/3 of the items on the menu...Sounds kinda hypocritical, what a dorkus, lucky he can cook!

excerpts: Also, the Kakiage Tempura was what seemed like a "hot mess" as it is filled with pretty much anything in my fridge currently, but not much can be said about things that people say are "authentic" to Japanese cuisine.
kakiage tempura.author: Renee Y.
kakiage tempura.review:
Visiting this place during the summer season was quite an expedition as hoards of people congregate to the Ferry Building to sample fine wine and cheeses from the myriad of other stores.

Upon first arrival you come across two separate lines, one which is for Hot/Deli Items and the other for Boxed Items.  However, if you're looking for a quick line, I suggest having cash at hand to fork it over to the guy in the front of the store passing out bento boxes.

The relatively long wait during the lunch hours are worth it as the Roast Beef Sushi is excellent in presentation and taste.  Many people have the misconception that sushi has to be fish, which they would be promptly corrected.  Sushi, literally translated, just means rice vinegar--denoting that if you put it on top of rice, it's sushi. But I digress.

I always enjoy getting the Number 4 combo at the Deli which includes one Hot Item, Rice and one Salad.  With a wide variety of vegetarian items, the Chinese Chicken Salad, Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad, and Spicy Burdock Root Salad are good choices.  However, I would love to try the Corn and Mascarpone Salad.

As far as the curry and fried items, the beef curry wasn't anything too special, as I could easily attain this from any other place in Japantown.  Also, the Kakiage Tempura was what seemed like a "hot mess" as it is filled with pretty much anything in my fridge currently, but not much can be said about things that people say are "authentic" to Japanese cuisine.

The food here, though, is fairly cheap, fairly tasty, and of good quality for the Ferry Building, and because of it, I continue to come back, as most other places in and around Market charge you an arm and a leg for good food.

excerpts: We ended up getting a potato Croquette ($1.75 each, prior to tax) & a fried shrimp cake ($4 each, prior to tax).
Both were good and not really oily at all.
But thought the price was a little expensive for these small little fried food items.
fried shrimp cake.author: Vic C.
fried shrimp cake.review:
I was walking in the Ferry Building with my husband on Saturday and we were hungry, this was a little before 3:30 pm. When we saw this place, we decided to just browse the display case. We ended up getting a potato Croquette ($1.75 each, prior to tax) & a fried shrimp cake ($4 each, prior to tax). Both were good and not really oily at all. But thought the price was a little expensive for these small little fried food items. Also the restaurant seating area was closed so we had to look elsewhere for seating. 

Service was just standard. I think overall, this place is just okay. But of course this was our first and only experience of this place, so I would be willing to give this restaurant another chance in the future.

excerpts: I question if the fried shrimp cake is really worth $4 a pop, but at least it is actually stuffed with shrimp
so I can make a pass on that.
fried shrimp cake.author: Alexander Y.
fried shrimp cake.review:
Not particularly sure what the hype about this place is.  I've been here more than a few times, and the only way I can guarantee that I'm not hungry still is if I order two or three items because the portion size is small for how much you pay for it.  That said, I do have to note the quality of the ingredients here is pretty top-notch.

The Japanese beef curry is pretty good and one of the few items worth coming back for.  Pork cutlet isn't too bad.  I question if the fried shrimp cake is really worth $4 a pop, but at least it is actually stuffed with shrimp so I can make a pass on that.  The roast beef sushi IS worth coming back for, if only because you don't really see too many places sell that.

Overall, it's a decent lunch spot, but nothing more than that.

excerpts: - Fried Shrimp Cake
: You know the kind where it's all breading
and there's only a few tiny pieces of shrimp inside?
NOT the case here.
Instead, the entire block is shrimp and covered in very thin crispy panko.
fried shrimp cake.author: Jen P.
fried shrimp cake.review:
One of the best bento boxes I've had so far. 

- Spinach and Sesame Salad: Pretty straightforward, but cooked in dashi broth.

- Spicy Burdock and Lotus Root Salad: Loved this. It's a mix of so many veggies; there's also konnyaku, onions, celery, carrots, and other greens tossed in there. Everything is thinly sliced, crunchy, light, and flavorful.

- Fried Shrimp Cake: You know the kind where it's all breading and there's only a few tiny pieces of shrimp inside? NOT the case here. Instead, the entire block is shrimp and covered in very thin crispy panko. Yum.

Being a person who prefers eating meat over veggies, I was surprised I liked this place more than usual, and I think that says a lot. Ingredients are high quality and fresh!

excerpts: Out of their main dishes, the tofu steak with chicken is surprisingly hearty and the fried shrimp cake is simply mind-blowing.
fried shrimp cake.author: Jon L.
fried shrimp cake.review:
When I have the time, I like to take a walk to the ferry building to 1. soak in the sunshine 2. feel the bay breeze and 3. get me some Japanese delicatessen grub at Delica. 

It's fairly quick and efficient but more importantly, I really like the food. In particular, the salads are fantastic. I get VERY excited when the eggplant salad is back in season. The eggplant is tender and the sauce is so savory but clean-tasting at the same time. Simply delish! Other standout seasonal salads include the mapo tofu salad and the asparagus salad. 

The regular salads aren't bad either but since they are always there, I don't covet them as much as, say, the eggplant salad for example. But all things considered, the Hijiki and soybean salad, the spinach and sesame salad, and the Chinese chicken salads are all good bets. Out of their main dishes, the tofu steak with chicken is surprisingly hearty and the fried shrimp cake is simply mind-blowing. Perfectly fried without being greasy and fresh shrimp on the inside make it a nice accompaniment to the salads. 

Delica is a great interpretation of what deli food can be, incorporating the "clean" taste of Japanese cuisine to offer a light and delicious lunch while you soak in the sun and bay breeze.

excerpts: My favorite is the combination with Rice, Green Bean Salad (sometimes they use asparagus) and Fried Shrimp Cake.
The Burdock Salad, Wasabi Potato Salad and the Sweet and Spicy Chicken are also very tasty.
One of my lunch buddies loves the Ginger Beef Bowl.
fried shrimp cake.author: Donna P.
fried shrimp cake.review:
I once took my Japanese boyfriend here for lunch.  When we walked in he inhaled deeply and said "smell like Japan." He loved Delica.  Thought the food was very similar to what is found in Tokyo deli style eateries.  I had finally selected a restaurant that he enjoyed and it reminded him of home. 

The food at Delica is very good.  I have lunch here at least once a week.  My favorite is the combination with Rice, Green Bean Salad (sometimes they use asparagus) and Fried Shrimp Cake.  The Burdock Salad, Wasabi Potato Salad and the Sweet and Spicy Chicken are also very tasty.  One of my lunch buddies loves the Ginger Beef Bowl.  She told me that she craves this stuff.

At lunch time during the week there is usually a line but it goes quickly.  Seating is just outside of the café in the Ferry Building at a community table or outdoors on one of the benches.

excerpts: Of course, what can I say about the fried shrimp cake?
It's easily the best shrimp cake in my universe.
I'm drooling just writing about it.
fried shrimp cake.author: Larry Z.
fried shrimp cake.review:
There are so many good options for eats at the Ferry Building.  Delica is one of my go-to's for tasty and different veggie takeout.  

The service is always friendly and very efficient, even patient for those novice customers (tourists) who have no idea what the food is about.  

I often go for the mushroom curry.  The brown sauce is heavy with flavor and texture, and the lightly fried thingys that are sprinkled on top add a nice crunch to the palate.

The salads are all delicious and there are a number of mix-and-match options for the adventurous eaters.  

Of course, what can I say about the fried shrimp cake?  It's easily the best shrimp cake in my universe.  I'm drooling just writing about it.  Chock full of luscious shrimp, it's a taste sensation!!!

Hint:  Check out the prepared to-go items on the left of the lunch line.  They rock and it's way faster.

excerpts: The fried shrimp cake or crab croquette are such a treat.
However, my favorite is the chicken dumpling in sweet chili sauce.
I was just there with a group of friends.
We were making our rounds to different places in the Ferry Building and trying/sharing small bites.
The chicken dumplings were a winner.
fried shrimp cake.author: Lizardp P.
fried shrimp cake.review: I've only had a few things at Delica's but I LOVE them enough to give them 5 stars.  The fried shrimp cake or crab croquette are such a treat.  However, my favorite is the chicken dumpling in sweet chili sauce.  I was just there with a group of friends.  We were making our rounds to different places in the Ferry Building and trying/sharing small bites.  The chicken dumplings were a winner.

excerpts: Fried Shrimp Cake:
Yay for mainly being large pieces of shrimp instead of some crab cake-like filler!
I could do without the unimaginative tartar sauce.
fried shrimp cake.author: Adam B.
fried shrimp cake.review:
Delica teaches a valuable lesson-- organic does not mean healthy and neither does Japanese .  They do have salads, but the enticing fried counter by the door will bring out the inner Jennifer Hudson in all of us!  It'd taste better if these treats came directly out of the grease, but they are still decent when slightly cold from behind the counter.  Definitely leaps and bounds ahead of other pre-cooked lunchtime deli options.

Pork Tonkatsu: The outside is crispy despite not being fresh out of the fryer.  The pork inside is partially cold and dry.  The sauce on top is nice.

Chicken Dumpling with Sweet Chili Sauce: Basically a fried chicken meatball.  The outside is really awesome with good seared meat and a nice chili glaze.  This one is small and went down a bit too fast.

Potato Croquette: Executed well, but could use some filling.  The potato and onion get a little boring, even with soy dipping sauce, after a few bites.

Fried Shrimp Cake: Yay for mainly being large pieces of shrimp instead of some crab cake-like filler!  I could do without the unimaginative tartar sauce.  Tastes better with soy or sriracha (from my desk).

Kakiage Tempura: Basically a cluster-funk of tempura vegetables and shrimp.  Major kudos for innovating on the rather common and boring tempura veggies.  I especially like the inner onions that didn't seem as deep fried and offered a more potent kick.  And the soy beans are an awesome taste and texture addition!

Hijiki Rice Ball: Too fishy for my tastes though I appreciated all the textures and flavors coming from the veggies, beans and seeds.  Perhaps a little less seaweed next time...

Cream Puff: When eating a cream puff, you know who I must compare to-- Beard Papa!  The cream was spot on, good vanilla hint and super creamy.  The puff itself was too chewy and tasted like something from a bodega snack section.  PS, I love how sugar is missing the organic prefix in the ingredient list... come one now, couldn't splurge on that one?

excerpts: Fried Shrimp Cake Potato Croquette $4.00/ea
fried shrimp cake.author: Bill W.
fried shrimp cake.review:
When i walk to the Ferry Building along the embarcadero, i get really hungry but don't always want a sit down meal so i go to Delica and get the Kaki-age: Fried Shrimp Cake Potato Croquette $4.00/ea

A mixture of shredded vegetables (burdock, carrots, onions, and edamame) and white shrimp in a tempura batter.

I just copied and pasted the description from the menu...Because I didn't remember the name but thought of it as "birds nest tampura with shrimp". 

I like my name better. But never mind, just get it. it's a perfect little snack!

excerpts: Fried shrimp cake.
fried shrimp cake.author: Carmen Y.
fried shrimp cake.review:
I don't get to eat at Delica's that often as I would like, but everytime that I do, I am quite pleased.

I always go for the bento box that has yet to disappoint.  Here are the bento box options:

4 Items $9.75 
1 Fried + 2 Salads + Rice 

5 Items $9.75 
3 Salads + Half Cut Shrimp Cake + Chicken Dumpling 

9 Items $11.00 
5 Salads + 3 Salmon Roles + Chicken Dumpling

Awesome selections.  Some faves?  Hijiki and soybean salad.  Green bean salad.  Tofu steak.  Chicken dumpling with sweet chili sauce.  Fried shrimp cake.  

Definitely a great lunch spot if you're by the Ferry Building.

excerpts: I ordered the lunch special and picked the spicy burdock root salad with the fried shrimp cake, sweet and spicy chicken and rice.
The salad wasn't spicy in the least but was tasty for being vegan-
the celery gave it a nice crunch to it.
The shrimp cake was probably my favorite item very tasty and filling and the chicken was yummy
but they only give you 3 small pieces.
I would definitely try Delica again, but it is a bit much for lunch $15 for a small box of food.
I might recommend their sushi or soup next time.
fried shrimp cake.author: Kristy H.
fried shrimp cake.review: Going to the ferry building and can be mind boggling. So many tasty things under one roof and you really don't want to walk away ordering the wrong thing or missing out on something amazing. I hate having plate envy too. I decided to go with Delica because it looked awesome and tasty. I ordered the lunch special and picked the spicy burdock root salad with the fried shrimp cake, sweet and spicy chicken and rice. The salad wasn't spicy in the least but was tasty for being vegan- the celery gave it a nice crunch to it. The shrimp cake was probably my favorite item very tasty and filling and the chicken was yummy but they only give you 3 small pieces. I would definitely try Delica again, but it is a bit much for lunch $15 for a small box of food. I might recommend their sushi or soup next time.

excerpts: we tried the 1 main + 2 side salad combo with the fried shrimp cake, chinese chicken salad and green bean salad.
the shrimp cake was still nice and hot and was served with a little bit of tartar sauce.
i can't resist fried foods, let alone japanese fried foods, so this was a delight!
