the chinese chicken salad was super crunchy and tasty, with the daikon and cucumbers having been marinated in the dressing (i think).
fried shrimp cake.author: Andrey C.
fried shrimp cake.review:
what's wrong with me... why didn't i come here sooner to savor and enjoy all the delicious goodies delica has to offer? very reminiscent of the "depachika" (department store basement food delis) that i saw in japan but was too timid to actually order from, except with fresh local ingredients and a california twist to things... oh yes, and i actually CAN order from here without feeling like a fool!

we tried the 1 main + 2 side salad combo with the fried shrimp cake, chinese chicken salad and green bean salad. the shrimp cake was still nice and hot and was served with a little bit of tartar sauce. i can't resist fried foods, let alone japanese fried foods, so this was a delight! the chinese chicken salad was super crunchy and tasty, with the daikon and cucumbers having been marinated in the dressing (i think). the green bean salad was also crunchy and amazingly creamy.

coupled with the ito-en tea apple drink, delica served up one of the nicest feel-good lunches i've had in a while. the perfect alternative to the hectic crowds that floods the ferry building farmer's market sometimes. man, i really wish i worked closer to here!!

excerpts:
*Fried Shrimp Cake $3.75
*White Corn and Potato Croquette $2
fried shrimp cake.author: Katie K.
fried shrimp cake.review:
A sunny warm day in downtown calls for lunch at the Ferry Building. Since I don't work in Downtown, I don't have the luxury to visit Delica too often. The food is always fresh and reliably delicious.

I really enjoyed:
*Salad Trio for $8
- Hijiki and Soybean Salad
- Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad 
- Corn and Mascarpone Salad 

*Sushi Roll $7.75
*Roast Beef Sushi $2
*Fried Shrimp Cake $3.75
*White Corn and Potato Croquette $2
*Mango Tea $2

Find a bench in the back and enjoy the perfect lunch with an amazing view.

excerpts: i had the bento box today.  for $9.50 you get rice, green bean sesame salad, seaweed salad, and a fried shrimp cake.
they are expensive but they are good.
what i like most is their beef curry.
i love japanese curry and i haven't found a place that serves japanese curry!
unless i'm not looking at the right places.
anyways, the bento box looks small but it was filling.
the shrimp cake alone is $3.75.
it does have shrimp in it!
the seaweed salad comes with edamame, fried tofu, and these reddish orange fruits.
the green bean salad is refreshing.
next on my list to try:  eggplant salad, roast beef sushi, and baked summer peach with custard!
all of their food looks fresh and healthly!
must try if you are near the ferry marketplace!
yum!
fried shrimp cake.author: D W.
fried shrimp cake.review: Yummy!  i love this place.  it's a japanese deli.  they offer salads, fried stuff, and expensive green and fruit teas.  i had the bento box today.  for $9.50 you get rice, green bean sesame salad, seaweed salad, and a fried shrimp cake.  they are expensive but they are good.  what i like most is their beef curry.  i love japanese curry and i haven't found a place that serves japanese curry!  unless i'm not looking at the right places.  anyways, the bento box looks small but it was filling.  the shrimp cake alone is $3.75.  it does have shrimp in it!  the seaweed salad comes with edamame, fried tofu, and these reddish orange fruits.  the green bean salad is refreshing.  next on my list to try:  eggplant salad, roast beef sushi, and baked summer peach with custard! all of their food looks fresh and healthly!   must try if you are near the ferry marketplace!  yum!

excerpts: The fried shrimp cake totally rocks.
It's basically a crab cake made with rock and gulf shrimp instead.
And it has very little filler - just shrimpy goodness.
fried shrimp cake.author: Saw T.
fried shrimp cake.review: Delica is a great lunch spot.  The place is spotless, service is efficient and they use top quality ingredients.  I like the lamb curry quite a bit.  It's great in cold weather - very hearty.   The fried shrimp cake totally rocks.  It's basically a crab cake made with rock and gulf shrimp instead.  And it has very little filler - just shrimpy goodness.  The crab croquette is mighty tasty too.  I like the Bechamel sauce that's blended with the crab meat.  The roast beef sushi sounds weird, but it's actually quite good... along the lines of a tartar.  The chicken dumpling with sweet chili sauce is also a good choice.  I usually will opt for a curry and another smaller item, but it'd be easy to make a meal out of the smaller items.

excerpts: Dont miss the fried shrimp cake or the croquette or the chicken dumpling.
It may be hard to part with
but I highly suggest you refrain from stuffing all your food down and share the wealth with some friends and order a variety.
Its all delicious!
fried shrimp cake.author: Porfirio R.
fried shrimp cake.review: Dont miss the fried shrimp cake or the croquette or the chicken dumpling.  It may be hard to part with but I highly suggest you refrain from stuffing all your food down and share the wealth with some friends and order a variety.  Its all delicious!

excerpts: The alaskan crab croquette was amazing, but for $5+, I wish it was a more sizable portion.
While this probably won't make it on my regular lunch rotation, on occasion I may stop by to grab a la carte items like the roast beef sushi or that crab croquette.
crab croquette.author: Nova P.
crab croquette.review:
This unique venue is one of the more alluring locations with prime real estate in the heart of the ferry building. I love the Japanese delicatessen concept with a menu of mouthwatering items from sushi, tempura, soups, bento boxes and more. Portions are on the smaller size, and prices are higher. During the middle of lunch rush you'll generally see a long line and a deli counter with Asian fusion menu options. Don't let the long line scare you, they have a well oiled operation that gets the line moving quickly.

Delica uses quality ingredients, locally sourced and hormone free. I went with a group of friends, and we all ordered the salmon chowder. On a positive note the flavor and consistency were just right, not too heavy. The downer was the itty bitty speckles of salmon floating in the soup. There were definitely more carrots than anything and my salmon craving left unsatisfied. The alaskan crab croquette was amazing, but for $5+, I wish it was a more sizable portion. My friends ordered the potato croquette which was substantially larger than its crab counterpart. 

Seating is available in the public communal area with the bay view, adjacent to Delica and a few of the other businesses. There doesn't appear to be any shortage of people going to Delica-whether it be tourists or locals. While this probably won't make it on my regular lunch rotation, on occasion I may stop by to grab a la carte items like the roast beef sushi or that crab croquette.

excerpts: I got distracted and ended up buying a crab croquette too, but honestly no regrets.
The crab croquette ($4-5?) was delicious and juicy!
crab croquette.author: Sofia R.
crab croquette.review:
Saw a sign for matcha soft serve and that was all it took to get me to walk in!

Delica offers both Matcha and Hojicha (roasted green tea) flavors. Of course, I had to try them both! So I ordered a small cone ($4) with a swirl of both flavors. 

The way it works, you have to pay at the cashier to receive a receipt for your order. You bring the receipt towards the back (to the left of the counter) of Delica. I got distracted and ended up buying a crab croquette too, but honestly no regrets. The crab croquette ($4-5?) was delicious and juicy! 

Back to the soft serve. The cone is good (sugar waffle) and both flavors are also good. The Matcha is creamy, mildly sweet, and has a mellow matcha flavor that isn't too strong although I personally would have wanted it to be stronger. The Hojicha was not too sweet and had a roasted, nutty flavor with a bitterness that reminded me of coffee. That bitterness was perfect with the sweetness which makes Hojicha my flavor of choice between the two. 

I really loved the Hojicha though, I would probably choose to get that again!

excerpts: I really liked the crab croquette ($4.50).
It had crab with creamy sauce in it.
It's a little pricey but very tasty.
The scallop and potato croquettes ($2 each) were also really good.
The chicken dumpling with sweet chili sauce ($2.25 each) were unique
but I probably wouldn't get that next time especially for the price.
My boyfriend ordered the large beef curry ($11).
It was a huge serving size of rice with tender beef and potato curry.
It was super hearty and filling.
crab croquette.author: Linda X.
crab croquette.review:
Solid choice for food at the ferry building! There's so many options displayed in the glass casing. The people that work here are really nice and offered to make some of the food fresh for me since the ones they had left had been sitting out for awhile. 

I really liked the crab croquette ($4.50). It had crab with creamy sauce in it. It's a little pricey but very tasty. The scallop and potato croquettes ($2 each) were also really good. The chicken dumpling with sweet chili sauce ($2.25 each) were unique but I probably wouldn't get that next time especially for the price. My boyfriend ordered the large beef curry ($11). It was a huge serving size of rice with tender beef and potato curry. It was super hearty and filling.

excerpts: Regular Beef Curry w/ Crab Croquette --
crab croquette.author: Rodney H.
crab croquette.review:
Yeah, it's been 6 years since my last review for Delica, and with this update, it still a solid 5 stars for me!  I just love coming here!

First and foremost that I should mention, I just had their Beef Curry for the first time and it's probably one of the better Japanese Curries I've had in the city.  I got the regular sized curry and it was a pretty hearty bowl with a good amount of tender beef cubes and potatoes.  And from their hot food section, their crab croquettes are still the thing the get!
Regular Beef Curry w/ Crab Croquette -- http://bit.ly/1jnb8VE

Their salads are still some of the tastiest ones you can have in the Ferry Building.  I still recommend getting the 2 salads and rice combo with their Burdock Root Salad and Lotus Salad.

Their bentos have the perfect balance of veggies, carbs, and proteins.  They're always something worth stopping by for lunch.
4 item Bento -- http://bit.ly/1OAPMkA

Other than their prices being higher than most Japanese markets, simply because it's in the Ferry Building, I really can't see any other flaws with Delica.  Their food is totally fresh and delicious!

excerpts: They sell ONE crab croquette for $4.
ONE PIECE.
Please just kill me.
I've had the pleasure to try the crab croquette and the pork cutlet.
Both were fried well and the insides were cooked nicely.
I also tried their Japanese Beef Curry.
I like how big the portion is for a regular $8.50.
Taste was just ok...
crab croquette.author: Benita M.
crab croquette.review:
If you have the Paypal app, make sure you clip the coupon. You can get $3-$4 off from this place if you pay through the app. What a steal!

Depending on what time you come, expect a line and a wait. Once the line circled to the place where they sell honey, took about 20 minutes until I got my food.

One thing I like about Delica is how fresh their food is. Everything here looks delicious however, the price puts you off. They sell ONE crab croquette for $4. ONE PIECE. Please just kill me. I usually get the lunch combo, Main, Salad, Soup, which is about $9.75.

My favorite so far is the Tofu salad. It does have a heavy cilantro taste (which I hate) but there's just something about that salad that is refreshing. I also always get the salmon chowder (It is $1 extra with the combo) because I love my chowder.

For Main items, anything fried is good haha. I've had the pleasure to try the crab croquette and the pork cutlet. Both were fried well and the insides were cooked nicely. I also tried their Japanese Beef Curry. I like how big the portion is for a regular $8.50. Taste was just ok... I think I will stick to the main items on display.

On regular days, I would not come here because of how pricey it is and the small portions. However, I will take advantage of the Paypal deal!

excerpts: so I just went with the suggestion of the person at the cash counter and I  ordered the lunch menu with the Hijiki and Soybean Salad + Salmon Chowder Soup + Crab Croquette .
Also ordered the Matcha Green tea ice cream which was very refreshing and different from the usual ice creams because of the after taste of green tea.
crab croquette.author: Anand S.
crab croquette.review: There were so many interesting dishes on the menu so I just went with the suggestion of the person at the cash counter and I  ordered the lunch menu with the Hijiki and Soybean Salad + Salmon Chowder Soup + Crab Croquette . Also ordered the Matcha Green tea ice cream which was very refreshing and different from the usual ice creams because of the after taste of green tea.

excerpts: Get the crab croquette - it's filled with crab and perfect with their dipping sauce.
Get the mapo tofu salad.
crab croquette.author: Michelle L.
crab croquette.review:
Salad and main combo is the way to go!!

Get the crab croquette - it's filled with crab and perfect with their dipping sauce.
Get the mapo tofu salad. Not quite a 'salad salad', as it's filled with chunks of meat and tofu, but definitely tasty!

Great price + fast.

excerpts: Ordered the shrimp cake, crab croquette and 3 chicken dumplings.
While the shrimp cake and crab croquette were equally enjoyable w/ the deliciously moist filling, we both didn't like the chicken  dumpling.
Not only did it not look like a dumpling, I just couldn't find anything that is worth $2+/piece...especially the flavor.
crab croquette.author: Julie L.
crab croquette.review: Based on the photos and prior reviews, I was excited to try the 9 item bento. Loved that there was variety but everything fell below my expectations. The pieces of sushi were dry while the small bits of salad were almost the same w/ very few distinguishable ingredients. Ordered the shrimp cake, crab croquette and 3 chicken dumplings. While the shrimp cake and crab croquette were equally enjoyable w/ the deliciously moist filling, we both didn't like the chicken  dumpling. Not only did it not look like a dumpling, I just couldn't find anything that is worth $2+/piece...especially the flavor. We also shared a miso soup and the salmon chowder but the portion was ultra small for a bowl size at $7.50. Flavors were "just ok".

excerpts: My favorite is the crab croquette (& tartar sauce!), green bean with creamy sesame dressing and hijiki salad!!
crab croquette.author: Amber S.
crab croquette.review:
Love their create your own bento idea! 2 salads, one fried item and rice. 
My favorite is the crab croquette (& tartar sauce!), green bean with creamy sesame dressing and hijiki salad!!

Their carrot ginger soup is a great way to get your veggie intake too! Would give them 5 stars if they only had brown rice...!

excerpts: Tofu patty and crab croquette are also good add-ons.
crab croquette.author: Jennifer W.
crab croquette.review:
Californian-inspired Japanese deli catering to the lunchtime working crowd. It's a healthy and fast option for lunch, offering a mix of bento boxes, sushi rolls, salads, croquettes, soups, and noodle dishes. Everything I've had here if flavorful, tasty, and very filling. I always get combo #2, which is 2 salads+salad or soup, and at just under $10, a good lunch option.

I usually get the burdock salad, sesame spinach, eggplant nasu or mabo tofu salad. Tofu patty and crab croquette are also good add-ons.

excerpts: I tried the sweet/sour chicken  , crab croquette, Chicken dumpling w/side of rice.
All items were cold not just a little cold ...real cold!
Threw it away to be honest, they have better chicken at Safeway to go.
The customer service was horrible the asian lady kept getting frustrated with customers.
crab croquette.author: T. C.
crab croquette.review:
I don't know why I even came in here... I mean Japanese food I am all in but this place
is meh! To clarify I only tried the cooked items on the far right of the restaurant. I tried the sweet/sour chicken  , crab croquette, Chicken dumpling w/side of rice. All items were cold not just a little cold ...real cold! Threw it away to be honest, they have better chicken at Safeway to go. The customer service was horrible the asian lady kept getting frustrated with customers.

excerpts: Tried the crab croquette and the spicy burdock salad was a nice complement for lunch...
but honestly I expected a bigger portion than what I got.
Or maybe I just love food too much that one serving wasn't enough for me...
=D
Regardless of the portion size, not particularly impressed...
crab croquette.author: Kevin C.
crab croquette.review: Tried the crab croquette and the spicy burdock salad was a nice complement for lunch...but honestly I expected a bigger portion than what I got.  Or maybe I just love food too much that one serving wasn't enough for me... =D  Regardless of the portion size, not particularly impressed...

excerpts: I also love their SEASONAL Crab Croquette.
Croquette is French for potatoes that are usually rolled in with peas and onions and then fried in breadcrumbs.
Their Crab Croquette has this nice mayo flavor which is called "Béchamel sauce" and full of crab!
crab croquette.author: Food G.
crab croquette.review:
If you are craving fast Japanese food, this is the place. It's located right in front the ferry building. Their food is just like their name, very delicate and deli like. The food is already fresh and all you have to do is choose what you want to eat. They are slightly pricy, but their food is amazing. I love their SEASONAL Mabo Salad, that contains; tofu, romaine lettuce, chili sauce, ginger, bean thread noodles, and chicken. It's very light but filling. I also love their SEASONAL Crab Croquette. Croquette is French for potatoes that are usually rolled in with peas and onions and then fried in breadcrumbs. Their Crab Croquette has this nice mayo flavor which is called "Béchamel sauce" and full of crab! If you every get a chance to visit them, it is worth the money!


Check out my profile to find my official blogs as well as more food reviews

excerpts: + The crab croquette is delish.
crab croquette.author: Cynthia L.
crab croquette.review:
Love this place! 

It's the perfect spot for a quick and delicious meal in the ferry building. 

+ Must get their curry bowl = bomb.com
+ The spicy tuna roll is amaz. The rolls are actually really big and the quality of fish is really high. 
+ The crab croquette is delish.

excerpts: So for main I had the crab croquette - warm, tasty, nicely breaded and fried.
This is the best part of my lunch.
For you only get 1 piece, so...
yeah, not filling enough.
For salad I got the very ordinary spinach with sesame, wakame usually it's called.
It's different from what I get from more traditional Japanese restaurants, but I like this.
You get a hearty amount of spinach goodness, which I happen to like.
For soup I got the ginger carrot.
Let me say I've had other ginger carrot soup around, I have my particular likings.
This one is watery
(I saw them puree with chicken stock) and looks oily (probably also from the chicken stock).
Too much of stock.
I like thick puree of carrot with hearty ginger flavor.
This one has almost no ginger flavor.
I was disappointed.
crab croquette.author: Lisa Z.
crab croquette.review:
Let me start by saying the lunch line is ALWAYS long. So if you don't want something warm and what you want is at the To Go Counter, grab and go. But the line moves fairly quick too. 

The food I think is a bit pricey for the quantity/quality. but I mean how do you put a definite price to something you like, right? So the food...

I got the #1 lunch combo - main + salad + soup (you can choose another salad instead of soup). So for main I had the crab croquette - warm, tasty, nicely breaded and fried. This is the best part of my lunch. For you only get 1 piece, so...yeah, not filling enough. For salad I got the very ordinary spinach with sesame, wakame usually it's called. It's different from what I get from more traditional Japanese restaurants, but I like this. You get a hearty amount of spinach goodness, which I happen to like. For soup I got the ginger carrot. Let me say I've had other ginger carrot soup around, I have my particular likings. This one is watery (I saw them puree with chicken stock) and looks oily (probably also from the chicken stock). Too much of stock. I like thick puree of carrot with hearty ginger flavor. This one has almost no ginger flavor. I was disappointed. And the whole set is $10.50+ tax, so about $11.45.

Over all, I'd want to try again, getting something else. Maybe rolls, curry, or sushi. But a scoop of spinach, 1 piece of croquette and 1 small cup of soup does not add up to $11 for me. And the soup was not good.

excerpts: At $4 a piece you can live without the potato croquettes, but the shrimp cake and crab croquette were the bomb diggity and I encourage everyone to try them.
crab croquette.author: Gretchen S.
crab croquette.review:
Pretty solid eatery, although watch out for the price, long lines, and lack of seating. Don't come here around lunchtime and expect there to be anywhere to sit. You're going to have to search around outside for an empty bench or get ready to get cozy with some strangers at the Mijita tables next door. 

I tried the potato and crab croquettes, shrimp cake, and the beef curry. At $4 a piece you can live without the potato croquettes, but the shrimp cake and crab croquette were the bomb diggity and I encourage everyone to try them. Good flavors inside and a nice crunch outside. 

The beef curry is very good as well, although I'm not sure I would call it traditional Japanese curry. Granted, I'm not Japanese, but it's not like the curry I'm used to getting in Japantown or at other Japanese restaurants. Rather, this reminds me a little more of an American beef stew. Still good, but if you're craving really traditional Japanese curry this might not hit the spot.

excerpts:
crab croquette
beef curry
mapo tofu salad (genius)
crab croquette.author: Nattie X.
crab croquette.review:
I was pleasantly surprised by this little market deli-ish spot in the ferry building. 
Didn't realize they served Japanese food until I walked inside. Love that all the food is pre-made (no waiting) and displayed right in front of you. Also love that you can order everything by the piece and try half the menu. 

Loved: 
crab croquette
beef curry
mapo tofu salad (genius)

the chicken meatballs were a little dry

would definitely come back again to sample the other half of the menu. love the pre-arranged bento boxes!

excerpts: So far I've had the salmon chowder (the cup is plenty), the carrot-ginger soup, the crab croquette (amaze!), and the wasabi-potato salad (double amaze!).
crab croquette.author: Marcel M.
crab croquette.review: This place is delightful. The menu is simple, each dish is made there from scratch, and the ingredients are high quality. Top it off with reasonable prices, and I'm a big fan. So far I've had the salmon chowder (the cup is plenty), the carrot-ginger soup, the crab croquette (amaze!), and the wasabi-potato salad (double amaze!). I really want to try their bento boxes, which are certainly a step up from your average greasy bento box during lunch downtown. Getting to eat this lunch watching the water from the Ferry Building adds to the charm.

excerpts: The fried shrimp cake or crab croquette are such a treat.
However, my favorite is the chicken dumpling in sweet chili sauce.
I was just there with a group of friends.
We were making our rounds to different places in the Ferry Building and trying/sharing small bites.
The chicken dumplings were a winner.
crab croquette.author: Lizardp P.
crab croquette.review: I've only had a few things at Delica's but I LOVE them enough to give them 5 stars.  The fried shrimp cake or crab croquette are such a treat.  However, my favorite is the chicken dumpling in sweet chili sauce.  I was just there with a group of friends.  We were making our rounds to different places in the Ferry Building and trying/sharing small bites.  The chicken dumplings were a winner.

excerpts: My favorite mains are the pork cutlets, the sweet spicy chicken and the crab croquette.
The salmon Onigilly (rice ball) is also a tasty add-on.
I tried the soup option once -
I think it was a seasonal Pumpkin soup.
The soup wasn't my favorite.
4 stars also because lunch costs just under $15 which is pricey
but I do appreciate that they use organic ingredients
.. also it's hard to deny how beautiful SF is as you're walking towards the Embarcadero during a lunch break.
crab croquette.author: Nadine D.
crab croquette.review: One of my favorite lunch spots. I always get the #1 Lunch Combo (1 Main, 2 Salads). You could also substitute one of the salads for a cup of their soup of the day. My favorite salads are the eggplant salad (seasonal), the asparagus salad (seasonal), the chicken salad and the spinach salad. My favorite mains are the pork cutlets, the sweet spicy chicken and the crab croquette. The salmon Onigilly (rice ball) is also a tasty add-on. I tried the soup option once - I think it was a seasonal Pumpkin soup. The soup wasn't my favorite. 4 stars also because lunch costs just under $15 which is pricey but I do appreciate that they use organic ingredients.. also it's hard to deny how beautiful SF is as you're walking towards the Embarcadero during a lunch break.

excerpts: I also ordered a crab croquette which was good.
crab croquette.author: Eddie D.
crab croquette.review:
I ordered the beef  curry under the recommendation of the yelp reviews. it was decent, but nothing special. I'd describe it as kind of like a beef-chuck stew meat dish, but with Asian flavors. I'm sure it's an authentic Japanese dish but my guess is if you are a big fan of the spicy Thai or Indian curries you will probably find it a bit boring like I did. 

It's probably not fair for me to rate something 3 stars for a Japanese dish I've ever had before , but regardless $10 is kind of expensive for a stew meat dish. 

I also ordered a crab croquette which was good. I knew beforehand it would be cold since they are served ready-made sitting chilled under the counter, though I think it could be even better if served hot. 

Service was friendly!

excerpts: I usually get the shrimp and crab croquette with the Japanese beef curry.
There's usually a line weekdays
lunchtime
but it goes by quick.
No place for sit down.
Buy it to go.
crab croquette.author: Cj P.
crab croquette.review: I occasionally get lunch here.  I usually get the shrimp and crab croquette with the Japanese beef curry.  There's usually a line weekdays lunchtime but it goes by quick.    No place for sit down.  Buy it to go.

excerpts: They used to have crab croquette, but discontinued it.
They lose one star for that in hopes that they might bring it back!
crab croquette.author: Ryan W.
crab croquette.review:
$20 for two is about standard.  $30 if you are really hungry.  The #4 lunch plate is pretty good (1 main item, 1 salad item, and rice).

The spicy burdock salad, wasabi potato salad, and asparagus salad are all fantastic.  I also really like the potato croquette.  They used to have crab croquette, but discontinued it.  They lose one star for that in hopes that they might bring it back!

excerpts: I love their crab croquette (eat fried food, die young), their precious bento boxes, and that I can easily buy the Japanese style curry (which is neither like Indian curry nor like Thai curry but something made from a large bar resembling large chocolate bars... who knows what's really in it...
it's a little like loving spam...
but hopefully Delica's version is made with other ingredients?).
crab croquette.author: Sooj O.
crab croquette.review:
If only this place was cheaper...but like so many other places in the Ferry Building, the prices are for the tourists and not for the regular office worker.

I love their crab croquette (eat fried food, die young), their precious bento boxes, and that I can easily buy the Japanese style curry (which is neither like Indian curry nor like Thai curry but something made from a large bar resembling large chocolate bars... who knows what's really in it...it's a little like loving spam...but hopefully Delica's version is made with other ingredients?).  I try to stay away from their soba noodles because it always irks me to pay so much for just soba noodles. 

I also adore their signature roll which is some rice rolled around a fried item and then wrapped with rice paper.  Very yummy.  

Great lunch food, bad lunch prices.

excerpts: Hijiki salad, wasabe potato salad, crab croquette.
crab croquette.author: Shawn S.
crab croquette.review:
Expensive. Delicious. Japanese... deli?  That's the Ferry Building for you.

I'm a creature of habit and here, as with so many other places, I always order the same thing.

Hijiki salad, wasabe potato salad, crab croquette.

One day I will succeed in duplicating their hijiki salad, and I will undercut them. I will dominate the hijiki salad market, and from there, the world.

Until then Delica, you can count on about $9 each week from me.

excerpts:
Tried:  

Crab croquette -- Wolfed that down.
crab croquette.author: Natasha S.
crab croquette.review:
Lovely Dianne D.  accompanied me to this place.

Very fresh and flavorful ingredients.  Wonderful selection.

Tried:  

Crab croquette -- Wolfed that down.  Light and crispy but not greasy.
Asparagus salad (part of Dianne's $9.50 bento box) -- Super good.
Roast beef sushi -- This works.
Lotus root salad & chinese chicken salad -- really good, really fresh ingredients and very flavorful.  But probably won't get if I go here again.  As much as I'd like to think I am partial to good for me stuff.  That is sheer DENIAL (Don't Even (K)now I Am Lying).

Almost forgot:  indifferent service.  I ordered the RBS (that's Roast Beef Sushi) when I was paying for my BB (that's Bento Box). And I swear the guy's exasperation was palpable (that's They Don't Pay Me Enough Here To Make Nice To You).

excerpts: The chicken dumplings and crab croquette are delicious and really well done too.
crab croquette.author: Shyam P.
crab croquette.review:
Another ultra-cool eatery in the ferry building?  say it ain't so!  Their service is cafeteria style but one look at the food and you know they're striving for quality (the prices say the same of course).  

I had the lamb curry, it was spicy and full of flavor with the lamb being nice and tender!  The chicken dumplings and crab croquette are delicious and really well done too.

excerpts:
typical sweet chili sauce, no real chili kick. 
crab croquette - ok, this was probably the best.
I'm a croquette connoiseur.
scratch that
, I'll eat the frozen ones
so I'm not picky, but I know what's good.
this one was good.
I'll stick to the croquettes next time for some fried goodness.
crab croquette.author: The Sock S.
crab croquette.review:
So I was kinda skeptical, but figured I'd try it based on the recommendation a friendly Yelper. It really reminded me of the basement level of a department store in Japan, but with all the shops squished into one tiny one that tried to sell everything. Here are my impressions: 

hijiki/soybean salad - slightly above average, though a little bland. personally I could do without the dried soybeans which were hard and the fresh soybeans which were hard too.
burdock/lotus root salad - again a little bland. I'm used to it with a bit more bite.
spicy chicken - kinda dry and they had just brought out a new batch from the kitchen
tofu/chicken patty - was good, though the texture was a tad heavy/dense. the daikon was flavorless.
chicken dumpling w/ chili sauce - may be the best thing I had. typical sweet chili sauce, no real chili kick. 
crab croquette - ok, this was probably the best. I'm a croquette connoiseur. scratch that, I'll eat the frozen ones so I'm not picky, but I know what's good. this one was good. I'll stick to the croquettes next time for some fried goodness.

excerpts: Also spotted a crab croquette in a bento box....give it a try next week.
I come to this 'deli' at least once a week for their spectacular tonkatsu bento.
I have tried everything short of their tofu patty (which still looks delicious) but will opt not to do so since everything else there is so good!
Drop a 10 spot and you'll get 3 perfectly fried pieces of pork cutlets, 2 side salads, and a serving of rice
; all neatly compartmentalized in your 'bento' box!
crab croquette.author: William R.
crab croquette.review:
12:00PM
4.2.2007

***NEW DESSERT!!!***  Mango and Avocado delight...

Also spotted a crab croquette in a bento box....give it a try next week.

Bomb...

1:25PM
3.21.2007

***NEW SALAD!!!***   Asparagus Salad in a creamy sesame dressing!  

Bomb....

3.8.2007
12:00PM

I come to this 'deli' at least once a week for their spectacular tonkatsu bento.  I have tried everything short of their tofu patty (which still looks delicious) but will opt not to do so since everything else there is so good!  Drop a 10 spot and you'll get 3 perfectly fried pieces of pork cutlets, 2 side salads, and a serving of rice; all neatly compartmentalized in your 'bento' box!  

ALL of their salads taste fantastic and are made with fresh ingredients.  (Wasabi mashed potatoes, hijiki salad, lotus root salad, asparagus salad, chinese chicken salad.)  They also sell Japanese style curry (which is bomb) and cold soba noodles with a side of shrimp cake.  Their 'hot' items include my all time fave the tonkatsu, spicy fried chicken, chicken meatball, kakiage (mixed assortment of tempura battered veggies and shrimp), potato croquettes, and shrimp cakes.

I don't think most people who come here understand how good this place is; it's truly amazing how well they prepare their foods!  Probably the best Japanese food in the City; we are blessed to have Delica-rf1.

Expect a line during the week.

excerpts: Great crab croquette.
Tasty Japanese deli style dishes.
crab croquette.author: Jennifer A.
crab croquette.review: Great crab croquette.  Tasty Japanese deli style dishes.

excerpts: Their cream crab croquette is so gooood too....
I can't really decide whether I want to be a carnivore for my whole life or a vegetarian.
Their tofu salad is purfeeect.
Combined it with wasabi salad.....
oh...
that's an ideal lunch for me.
With a view of the bay bridge and lazy ambiance of the Ferry Building, you get a killer combination
crab croquette.author: Cliff T.
crab croquette.review: I'm a fan of their salad. I can be a vegetarian if all I eat for my whole life is food from Delica. No sorry, I kid. Their cream crab croquette is so gooood too.... I can't really decide whether I want to be a carnivore for my whole life or a vegetarian. Their tofu salad is purfeeect. Combined it with wasabi salad..... oh... that's an ideal lunch for me. With a view of the bay bridge and lazy ambiance of the Ferry Building, you get a killer combination

excerpts: Although I enjoyed their donkatsu, crab croquette, and fried chicken thingy, I did not like their soba salad (too much radish shavings), and other fusion items.
crab croquette.author: YJ H.
crab croquette.review:
When I arrived at the Ferry Building starving I was really glad to see this place.  I was so happy to see they had curry, and my all time favorite donkatsu (fried pork cutlet).  Although I enjoyed their donkatsu, crab croquette, and fried chicken thingy, I did not like their soba salad (too much radish shavings), and other fusion items. 

I don't know may be I'm old fashioned. 
As others have stated, it is little pricey, but I would still get their fried items, and the likelihood of my coming back is pretty high.

Bon Appetit

excerpts: The man had the crab croquette which he loves
but, I felt it was way too rich and heavy.
The selection was extensive and almost overwhelming.
I really wanted to try one of everything.
I will definitely be back and try some of the yummy looking salads.
crab croquette.author: Douggers M.
crab croquette.review:
Ferry Building yummy munchies!
 I really like the steak "sushi" which is basically nigiri but rare steak instead of fish. The shrimp cakes was excellent with homemade tartar sauce. The man had the crab croquette which he loves but, I felt it was way too rich and heavy. 
  The selection was extensive and almost overwhelming. I really wanted to try one of everything. I will definitely be back and try some of the yummy looking salads.

excerpts: One thing I really miss that they apparently don't make anymore is the crab croquette...
crab croquette.author: Brian T.
crab croquette.review: Awesome Japanese fusion foods along with delicious traditional Japanese dishes. One thing I really miss that they apparently don't make anymore is the crab croquette...

excerpts:
wonderful~
chinese chicken salad - tastes good and proportional to each other
green bean salad - tastey and crunchy, nice sesame flavor
tofu steak - had bits of bamboo i think on top tastes really good with rice
crab croquette - warm and creamy crunchy on the outside
tofu n chicken n hijiki meatball - tastes like grandmas!!!
crab croquette.author: phillip w.
crab croquette.review:
yum~~!!

roast beef nigiri - a lot more wasabi than i expected but still love it
wasabi potato salad - faint taste of wasabi wonderful~
chinese chicken salad - tastes good and proportional to each other
green bean salad - tastey and crunchy, nice sesame flavor
tofu steak - had bits of bamboo i think on top tastes really good with rice
crab croquette - warm and creamy crunchy on the outside
tofu n chicken n hijiki meatball - tastes like grandmas!!! yumm!!

forgot what the name of the fried vegetable thing with shrimp was but that was also really good...almost the same as my grandmas tooo~~

i want to come back more often but it closes after i get off work ARGH~!!

excerpts: the crab croquette?  creamy and rich.
definitely a must-try, if you're a japanese food snob (or just a foodie in general), like me!
crab croquette.author: Jill k.
crab croquette.review:
the beef and mushroom curry?  authentic and hearty.

the soba?  light and tasty.

the crab croquette?  creamy and rich.

definitely a must-try, if you're a japanese food snob (or just a foodie in general), like me!

excerpts: I got the fried crab croquette ($3.75), which was so tasty.
It is crab mixed with bechamel sauce and fried in tasty panko breadcrumbs or something.
Delicious, warm, rich.
I also like getting the $2.00 salmon sushi rice balls, made with wild salmon and brown rice.
Drizzle some soy sauce on it
and you're good to go.
crab croquette.author: O K.
crab croquette.review: Yum!! I got the fried crab croquette ($3.75), which was so tasty. It is crab mixed with bechamel sauce and fried in tasty panko breadcrumbs or something. Delicious, warm, rich. I also like getting the $2.00 salmon sushi rice balls, made with wild salmon and brown rice. Drizzle some soy sauce on it and you're good to go.

excerpts: I scooped up a bento with a creamy crab croquette, white rice, asparagus salad with a sesame dressing and hijiki and soybean salad.
I then went to the counter to custom create a lunch plate #1 with a choice of one entree and two salads.
I picked the tofu and chicken hijiki patty, mushroom salad and a wonderfully aromatic and zesty burdock and lotus root salad.
Everything was perfectly prepared, not over-dressed and the proportions were nice.
The flavors were especially clean and most had a light "tang" that was a nice contract to the rice and fried croquette.
With a bottle of green tea, my total came to just over $22.
crab croquette.author: Michele B.
crab croquette.review:
Coming to San Fran for a spur of the moment get away with the bf (and to check out the madness that is B2B), we ducked in here after getting some beautiful morning photos of the bay bridge and the hub-bub and hustle of the market outside. There were plenty of options but with a name like Delica rf-1, it's pretty unique and stirred the memory senses of my yelp browsing from yester years. I was a little overwhelmed by the know-how of the regulars and where to stand to order what and such so I took a second to get a lay of the land, perused the deli counter and the bento boxes and decided a sampler plate would be best. I scooped up a bento with a creamy crab croquette, white rice, asparagus salad with a sesame dressing and hijiki and soybean salad. I then went to the counter to custom create a lunch plate #1 with a choice of one entree and two salads.  I picked the tofu and chicken hijiki patty, mushroom salad and a wonderfully aromatic and zesty burdock and lotus root salad. Everything was perfectly prepared, not over-dressed and the proportions were nice. The flavors were especially clean and most had a light "tang" that was a nice contract to the rice and fried croquette. With a bottle of green tea, my total came to just over $22. I recommend getting the lunch plates or bento boxes because some of the salads were costly, upwards of $15.00 a lb. and since they are dressed, the ounces can add up.  My favorites were the hijiki salad and tofu and chicken hijiki patty - didn't really care for the creamy texture to the croquette but of course I ate it anyway. Over-all: 
DELISH DELICA!

****sidenote**** 
You can request to taste anything before you buy. They really DO NOT mind. In fact, they encourage it.

excerpts: The crab croquette is mighty tasty too.
I like the Bechamel sauce that's blended with the crab meat.
The roast beef sushi sounds weird, but it's actually quite good... along the lines of a tartar.
The chicken dumpling with sweet chili sauce is also a good choice.
I usually will opt for a curry and another smaller item, but it'd be easy to make a meal out of the smaller items.
crab croquette.author: Saw T.
crab croquette.review: Delica is a great lunch spot.  The place is spotless, service is efficient and they use top quality ingredients.  I like the lamb curry quite a bit.  It's great in cold weather - very hearty.   The fried shrimp cake totally rocks.  It's basically a crab cake made with rock and gulf shrimp instead.  And it has very little filler - just shrimpy goodness.  The crab croquette is mighty tasty too.  I like the Bechamel sauce that's blended with the crab meat.  The roast beef sushi sounds weird, but it's actually quite good... along the lines of a tartar.  The chicken dumpling with sweet chili sauce is also a good choice.  I usually will opt for a curry and another smaller item, but it'd be easy to make a meal out of the smaller items.

excerpts: I had the shrimp cake and the crab croquette.
They were both delicious.
I love the yummy panko crumbs that coat them.
I'll have to try other things there next time.
crab croquette.author: Diana S.
crab croquette.review: I had the shrimp cake and the crab croquette. They were both delicious. I love the yummy panko crumbs that coat them. I'll have to try other things there next time.

excerpts: The crab croquette is a must get, but try to get them to customize the box for you.
That way, the croquettes will be warm, instead of getting the ones that's been sitting in the boxes in the fridge for who knows how long.
The hijike salad is a bit salty/sea-tasty for me
but it is healthy at least.
A ferry building must-stop.
crab croquette.author: Annie C.
crab croquette.review: Need I say more after 270+ reviews? Yes, the place is very good. The portion looks small but it is actually very filling. Japanese people like to eat in small portions. Duh.  The crab croquette is a must get, but try to get them to customize the box for you. That way, the croquettes will be warm, instead of getting the ones that's been sitting in the boxes in the fridge for who knows how long. The hijike salad is a bit salty/sea-tasty for me but it is healthy at least. A ferry building must-stop.

excerpts: things like the crab croquette and the asparagus cream croquette are mighty tasty.
crab croquette.author: Junglist S.
crab croquette.review:
one of the better places in the ferry building for lunch!  ill take this 9 times out of 10 over slanted door (which is just trendy, overpriced vietnamese).

i havent tried the curries/soups etc but they look damn good.

every single one of the fried items are exquisite.  the scallops come back later, but i dont even like scallops and i love these.  things like the crab croquette and the asparagus cream croquette are mighty tasty.  great breading, nice fry job (more difficult than you think) and fresh ingredients.

their other prepared salads and items are also good.  string beans or asparagus in seasame dressing, chicken salad with carrots/celery... simple items that are fresh and tasty.  get a few!  

yes, the place is a bit expensive.  but then again, everything in the ferry building is, and you get what you pay for...

excerpts: I've had the mushroom curry -but was in the bathroom the entire evening.
I feel like it's such a waste of money.
mushroom curry.author: Kiki A.
mushroom curry.review: Just. Not. Good. The sushi is very bland and doesn't seem fresh. I've given them multiple visits and it's always the same. I've had the mushroom curry -but was in the bathroom the entire evening. I feel like it's such a waste of money.

excerpts: It would be nice if they introduce chicken curry similar to beef/mushroom curry.
I will highly recommend this place for a good Iapanese food.
mushroom curry.author: Pandeeswaran B.
mushroom curry.review: The chicken dumpling and the spicy chickens are fantastic. It would be nice if they introduce chicken curry similar to beef/mushroom curry. I will highly recommend this place for a good Iapanese food.

excerpts: I got the mushroom curry and it was delicious, but for $10, I wish there was some veggies or tofu in there, instead of just button mushrooms and thin lotus slices.
mushroom curry.author: Crystal Y.
mushroom curry.review: Tasty but overpriced. Great selection, sushi, bento boxes, soups, curries etc. Plenty of veggie options. I got the mushroom curry and it was delicious, but for $10, I wish there was some veggies or tofu in there, instead of just button mushrooms and thin lotus slices.

excerpts: Mushroom curry that uses Far West Fungi mushrooms?
mushroom curry.author: トモ T.
mushroom curry.review:
I will tell a big secret - Delica RF1 is a VERY Japanese place.  Of all the SF Japanese restaurants, this place could best compete if they sold the same food in Japan, evident by the fact that you could find RF-1 at the basement floor of department stores in Tokyo (see downloaded pic).  It is not Japanese food from 1970's (like many J-town restaurants).  It gives you a small insight into some of the popular foods in modern Japan.  I am not saying RF-1 is the most popular type of food found in Tokyo as there are vast variety of other options available.  When transplants from Tokyo finds Delica, they are so happy to see a piece of Japan they miss.  

Many people are surprised to hear this, because Delica offers food seemly Americanized.  Nope.  Americanized means taste was altered to fit the likings of American customers.  Food at Delica, along with many places in Tokyo, has been Japanized.  The taste was altered to the likings of Japanese customers - altered so much that it is now considered Japanese food.  Items in this category include: Ramen, Kasutera, Tonkatsu, Hamburg, egg sandwich, etc.

What does this mean?  Well, you might not like their food.  Selling food that was designed to meet Japanese people's preferences to Americans is a crazy idea.  But, they opened a branch here, probably more for marketing purposes rather than for profits.  Japanese companies like to show the equity holders that they are expanding abroad, just like Beard Papa.  I don't care, because I am happy that it is here.   

Like I said, 80% of the Japanese restaurants in SF wouldn't survive if they moved to Tokyo.  Just like San Francisco, restaurant industry in Tokyo is fiercely competitive, so if you are serving food that tastes like something I could cook at home (80% of SF J-Food), you are done.  All you need to know is that Delica's food is surviving the competition in Tokyo.  The food is especially popular among OLs (office ladies) (yes, the word is sexist, but I didn't invent the word).  Don't get me wrong, the traditional Japanese food like tempura and unaju is still popular in Japan, but food in Japan has done though significant transformations since 1945.  It is now quite diverse - while the passion for food has not changed.        

Delica is a creation of Rock Field Co., Ltd.   The founder, Mr. Iwata Kozo, did a direct translation of his kanji characters and named the company Rock (Iwa) Field (ta).  Although the company sounds western, it is completely Japanese company.  The company has an impressive mission - to address the environment, safety, and freshness of Japanese food.  The founder had concerns about the direction of Japanese diet and is making the effort to change for the better.  Positioning Delica branch at the Ferry Building is fitting to their theme.  Where else would you find beef curry that uses Prather Ranch Meat?  Mushroom curry that uses Far West Fungi mushrooms?     

SEATS:  Very limited.  Find a place outside to sit and eat under the sun.

PRICE:  There is a price to the environment, safety, and freshness.  If you want cheaper food, look for MSG infused dishes at cheaper restaurants.  Expect to pay $10-14 for lunch.
$9.50 - Bento box with five items
$7.75 - Regular size curry
$1.50 - Potato coroke

excerpts: I often go for the mushroom curry.
mushroom curry.author: Larry Z.
mushroom curry.review:
There are so many good options for eats at the Ferry Building.  Delica is one of my go-to's for tasty and different veggie takeout.  

The service is always friendly and very efficient, even patient for those novice customers (tourists) who have no idea what the food is about.  

I often go for the mushroom curry.  The brown sauce is heavy with flavor and texture, and the lightly fried thingys that are sprinkled on top add a nice crunch to the palate.

The salads are all delicious and there are a number of mix-and-match options for the adventurous eaters.  

Of course, what can I say about the fried shrimp cake?  It's easily the best shrimp cake in my universe.  I'm drooling just writing about it.  Chock full of luscious shrimp, it's a taste sensation!!!

Hint:  Check out the prepared to-go items on the left of the lunch line.  They rock and it's way faster.

excerpts: I ordered their mushroom curry which was pre-cooked as all their other food.
It was in a big pot
and I got it on top of rice.
10 minutes into my meal when I brought it back to the office, I noticed something that shouldn't have been there - a strand of hair!
I was so repulsed that I took the time to go back to them after work and made complain.
By that time, the lunch shift has ended and Delica turned into a sushi place.
So the lady said she can't do anything for me then, but will call me back.
Guess what, one week later, NOTHING!
I will never eat here again as they completely lost my respect on how a food business should run.
When a customer takes the time to go back and make a formal complaint, standard procedure will be to follow up.
mushroom curry.author: Sheri T.
mushroom curry.review: Delica has some very yummy albeit pricy Japanese dishes but when I went there last time I was in for a rude surprise. I ordered their mushroom curry which was pre-cooked as all their other food. It was in a big pot and I got it on top of rice. 10 minutes into my meal when I brought it back to the office, I noticed something that shouldn't have been there - a strand of hair! I was so repulsed that I took the time to go back to them after work and made complain. By that time, the lunch shift has ended and Delica turned into a sushi place. So the lady said she can't do anything for me then, but will call me back. Guess what, one week later, NOTHING! I will never eat here again as they completely lost my respect on how a food business should run. When a customer takes the time to go back and make a formal complaint, standard procedure will be to follow up.

excerpts: My favorite is the mushroom curry, savory steaming hot and kinda spicy, with yummy fried lotus root chips on top.
The rice served with the curry is perfectly cooked.
mushroom curry.author: kathy c.
mushroom curry.review:
I have eaten almost everything here and it's all delicious!  My favorite is the mushroom curry, savory steaming hot and kinda spicy, with yummy fried lotus root chips on top.  The rice served with the curry is perfectly cooked.   Very satisfying on a cold SF day. 

I also love the burdock root salad -- refreshing tasty and interesting.  When I go to the Ferry Bldg there are so many wonderful things to eat, but Delica is my favorite! (with Acme Bread a close second).  The Karaage Chicken is good too.  My least favorite thing is probably the soba noodles with the fried tempura thing on top -- the broth tastes kinda sour to me.

Service is excellent -- everyone who works here is so polite.

excerpts: The first time this week I had their mushroom curry.
That's one delicious plate of authentic Japanese curry!
Please don't tell me that is not real curry, as in Naan n' Curry, or Thai coconut green curry.

I like all three varieties of curry equally, and Delica serves up the best Japanese version--- a bit tangy, a bit spicy, with the texture that is just thick enough for the rice to absorb all the goodness.
The second time I came this week
I had the ginger beef.
Very delicious.
mushroom curry.author: Jiajia C.
mushroom curry.review:
Delica is now my favorite destination in the Ferry Building.  I actually ate here 2X this week.  Man can you tell I like their food.

The first time this week I had their mushroom curry.  That's one delicious plate of authentic Japanese curry!  Please don't tell me that is not real curry, as in Naan n' Curry, or Thai coconut green curry.  I like all three varieties of curry equally, and Delica serves up the best Japanese version--- a bit tangy, a bit spicy, with the texture that is just thick enough for the rice to absorb all the goodness.  The second time I came this week I had the ginger beef.  Very delicious.  I also love their salmon rice balls.

I might go again!  That would make it 3X in one week.  Ok I'll wait.  Don't want to seem desperate.

excerpts: Veggie Mushroom Curry -
Oh my GOD it was good!
It was the best Japanese curry I've ever had.
It was very hot, creamy and... crunchy?
Yes!
The curry was topped with thinly sliced lotus roots that were fried so they have the texture of chips.
The two types of mushrooms used in the curry were button and oyter.
The taste of the dish as a whole was so unusally satisfying.
I've never had any other curry like it.
It seriously beats Muracci's and Hotei out of the water.
mushroom curry.author: Sam L.
mushroom curry.review:
I've always avoided this place in the Ferry Building because I once tried a sample of the carrot ginger soup and I almost gagged. I'm no fan of ginger.

So, last week L and I were having a long internal debate on where to eat and chose Delica because it had the shortest line.

The scene:

Much like every other store in the Ferry Building, Delica was fancy. They've got 2 lines out the door - one for salads and one for hot foods. We automatically got into the hot food line not knowing the difference. Each of the food items are on display behind a glass case that stretched throughout the entire restaurant. Items such as chicken dumplings, tonkatsu, tempura, and other fried items as well as ginger kobe beef rice bowls, bento boxes, sushi and salads.

The food:

I totally was not craving anything hot because it was such a beautiful day in the city, but I went for the veggie curry.

Veggie Mushroom Curry - Oh my GOD it was good! It was the best Japanese curry I've ever had. It was very hot, creamy and... crunchy? Yes! The curry was topped with thinly sliced lotus roots that were fried so they have the texture of chips. The two types of mushrooms used in the curry were button and oyter. The taste of the dish as a whole was so unusally satisfying. I've never had any other curry like it. It seriously beats Muracci's and Hotei out of the water.

excerpts: I have dreams about their mushroom curry & wasabi potato salad.
mushroom curry.author: Anna G.
mushroom curry.review:
Pretty much everything I've ever eaten here has been amazing. I have dreams about their mushroom curry & wasabi potato salad.

Loses a star for the prices, which are a bit high for Japanese food, even though I get that it's inflated for the Embarcadero location.

excerpts: I order the mushroom curry (which was a little over salted), and my friend had the beef.
His feedback was, its not the best, but its alright.
He also ordered the chicken cutlets, which he said had no taste.
I also ordered the tofu steak (which was cold, and would much prefer warm), but my fav was the Kaki-age tempura.
It was like shredded carrots, onions, sweet potato fritters, topped with shrimp.
Super oily, but super good.
Who cares. . .
but I would definitely go again.
Its adorable. . .
.ewww
, I'm getting all warm and fuzzy up in here.
Lol!
mushroom curry.author: Janice F.
mushroom curry.review: Its a very cute spot.  Its Japanese fast food, but still classy and sheek.  All the cutie Asian chicks are behind the counter, with the chef suit on.  They have a variety of goodies, from curry, to sushi to salads.  I order the mushroom curry (which was a little over salted), and my friend had the beef.  His feedback was, its not the best, but its alright.  He also ordered the chicken cutlets, which he said had no taste.  I also ordered the tofu steak (which was cold, and would much prefer warm), but my fav was the Kaki-age tempura.  It was like shredded carrots, onions, sweet potato fritters, topped with shrimp.  Super oily, but super good.  Who cares. . . but I would definitely go again.  Its adorable. . . .ewww, I'm getting all warm and fuzzy up in here.  Lol!

excerpts: I had the mushroom curry
and it was amazing.
mushroom curry.author: Anand G.
mushroom curry.review: I am not a frequenter to sushi places since they normally don't have a lot of vegetarian options. But this one is an exception. Not only did they have a decent size of vegetarian options the taste is also really good. I had the mushroom curry and it was amazing.

excerpts: The one item I always order is the beef and mushroom curry.
I'd also suggest getting the corquette and the edamame salad.
The portions here will fill you up and prices are fair.
The only bad thing I'd have to say about it is that seating is limited.
mushroom curry.author: Lynn V.
mushroom curry.review: This Japanese spot in the Ferry Building has the quick service of a deli, but its food is high quality and delcious. The one item I always order is the beef and mushroom curry. I'd also suggest getting the corquette and the edamame salad. The portions here will fill you up and prices are fair. The only bad thing I'd have to say about it is that seating is limited.

excerpts: The wasabi potato salad and mushroom curry
w/fried lotus is sooooo good!
mushroom curry.author: Denise A.
mushroom curry.review: The wasabi potato salad and mushroom curry w/fried lotus is sooooo good!

excerpts: Am a little sad, I swear they had a lamb mushroom curry that was absolute luxury and was a little confused by comments made in my Muracci's review about a shrimp curry
but... went recently yet once again to meet a friend over some Ito
-En green tea and lucious bentos and was satisfied with their regular beef curry!
Still, after two years of patronage Delica has failed to disappoint.
It's efficient line system, it's variety of obento options and smaller take-home dishes, and it's loyal relationship with delicious, cold refreshing Ito
-En teas just makes Delica my place of choice to go to while lunching in the FiDi, or before a day out to the farmer's market on Saturdays.
About $10 a person, it is a bit pricey but still somewhat normal for city rates and totally acceptable as an occasional treat.
mushroom curry.author: Jessica L.
mushroom curry.review: Have been here several times for a more special lunch experience, and often order the curry. Am a little sad, I swear they had a lamb mushroom curry that was absolute luxury and was a little confused by comments made in my Muracci's review about a shrimp curry but... went recently yet once again to meet a friend over some Ito-En green tea and lucious bentos and was satisfied with their regular beef curry! Still, after two years of patronage Delica has failed to disappoint. It's efficient line system, it's variety of obento options and smaller take-home dishes, and it's loyal relationship with delicious, cold refreshing Ito-En teas just makes Delica my place of choice to go to while lunching in the FiDi, or before a day out to the farmer's market on Saturdays. About $10 a person, it is a bit pricey but still somewhat normal for city rates and totally acceptable as an occasional treat.

excerpts: the beef and mushroom curry?
authentic and hearty.
the soba?
light and tasty.
mushroom curry.author: Jill k.
mushroom curry.review:
the beef and mushroom curry?  authentic and hearty.

the soba?  light and tasty.

the crab croquette?  creamy and rich.

definitely a must-try, if you're a japanese food snob (or just a foodie in general), like me!

excerpts: The mushroom curry has a very sweet distinct taste and like the other reviewers, it reminds me of food that I could buy in a  department store.
mushroom curry.author: Jen L.
mushroom curry.review: I love their roast beef sushi!  Prices here are a little expensive but I am willing to spend out a couple of extra dollars for some good Japanese food.  The mushroom curry has a very sweet distinct taste and like the other reviewers, it reminds me of food that I could buy in a  department store.   I like the casual atmosphere and the extensive display of salads, rolls and bento boxes.

excerpts: I ordered the pork tonkatsu bento box and the shrimp cake with tartar sauce, and also
their Tea's tea peach ginger tea.
They were near closing time, and the cashier helped me where the stuff are like beverages and chopsticks.
The pork tonkatsu bento box was at room temperature and laying out at the counter.
This is probably the last 2.
I took one - so
it had 3 small pieces of pork tonkatsu with sauce on top of it, soy sauce brined lotus root salad, black seaweed salad with natto, edamame and sushi rice with black sesame seeds.
Then I also ordered a shrimp cake with a side of tartar sauce.
The food was really good, and ate the whole thing.
I did enjoyed what I ate today late afternoon like around 5:27 PM.
Then drank some peach ginger tea.
It was satisfying and enjoyable dinner.
The shrimp cake is a shrimp with little Kewpie mayo, onions covered with panko bread crumbs and deep fried.
This was excellent with their mildly flavored Japanese tartar sauce.
So yummy!
This is still one of my go-to-places for quick Japanese deli foods- quite a unique menu still.
bento.author: Jade M.
bento.review:
I have been coming to Delica when they first opened, and I am having dinner at this place since I want some Japanese food. I was so hungry and craving for some Japanese food.
I ordered the pork tonkatsu bento box and the shrimp cake with tartar sauce, and also their Tea's tea peach ginger tea. They were near closing time, and the cashier helped me where the stuff are like beverages and chopsticks. 
The pork tonkatsu bento box was at room temperature and laying out at the counter. This is probably the last 2. I took one - so it had 3 small pieces of pork tonkatsu with sauce on top of it, soy sauce brined lotus root salad, black seaweed salad with natto, edamame and sushi rice with black sesame seeds. Then I also ordered a shrimp cake with a side of tartar sauce.
The food was really good, and ate the whole thing. I did enjoyed what I ate today late afternoon like around 5:27 PM. Then drank some peach ginger tea. It was satisfying and enjoyable dinner. 
The shrimp cake is a shrimp with little Kewpie mayo, onions covered with panko bread crumbs and deep fried. This was excellent with their mildly flavored Japanese tartar sauce. So yummy!
This is still one of my go-to-places for quick Japanese deli foods- quite a unique menu still.

excerpts: Build your own bento - I love the pork tonkatsu, sweet and spicy chicken and potato croquette.
bento.author: Dave K.
bento.review:
Everything here is authentic and phenomenal. 

Usually a long line at lunch but it moves fast. 

The salads are perfectly prepared with the right amount of dressing to add flavor but not take away from the greens. 

Build your own bento - I love the pork tonkatsu, sweet and spicy chicken and potato croquette. 

But the Japanese Beef Curry earns Delica 5 stars on its own. Without question the best beef curry I've had in San Francisco. Perfect flavor, cut with a spoon, melt in your mouth, savory, mild heat goodness. I could eat it everyday. We

excerpts: It's essentially a hipster bento box place that was just meh.
Definitely not worth the long lines and pretty spendy too.
Bento with tea was $20.
bento.author: Cindy G.
bento.review:
Like a moth to flame, I followed the crowds and found myself in a long line anticipating a yummy lunch.   Should have paid attention to the meaning of that allusion!

It's essentially a hipster bento box place that was just meh.  Definitely not worth the long lines and pretty spendy too.  Bento with tea was $20. 

So, just move along, skip the lines and save your money and calorie intake for something worthy.

excerpts: They have a lot of good lunch time deals, even bento boxes and after checking out the menu I knew I had to try the beef curry and a potato croquette.
bento.author: Monica O.
bento.review:
It was a few hours before I had to leave the city and make my way to the airport to head back to Phoenix, so I wanted to head on over the Ferry building and grab a meal and eat by the bay one last time. 

I wanted to try something different this time, so I went with Delica. They have a lot of good lunch time deals, even bento boxes and after checking out the menu I knew I had to try the beef curry and a potato croquette. 

The potato croquette was a blend of russet and Yukon gold potatoes with caramelized onions, and it was pretty dang tasty.

The beef curry had tender pieces of beef and potatoes in a curry sauce over white rice. This was the perfect meal on a cool summer day by the bay.

Glad to have given Delica a try and look forward to coming back!

excerpts: I'm not impressed by their lunch bento.
I heard the hype, got two 9 items bento to share with bff.
Meh, I didn't touch anything but my bff ate everything and took mine.
It's just too fresh for me.
It's a great idea, and great execution but things just didn't come together.
The box didn't look appetizing.
Looks great on the phone but in person it's not as sexy and def doesn't taste as good.
2 bento and 2 snack a la cart came out to be over $40.
bento.author: Kris J.
bento.review:
Soft serve was the best! I never had green tea ice cream so creamy and full bodied. felt like I drank a green tea latte. 

I'm not impressed by their lunch bento. I heard the hype, got two 9 items bento to share with bff. Meh, I didn't touch anything but my bff ate everything and took mine. It's just too fresh for me. It's a great idea, and great execution but things just didn't come together. The box didn't look appetizing. Looks great on the phone but in person it's not as sexy and def doesn't taste as good. 2 bento and 2 snack a la cart came out to be over $40. 

Probably will not return. Lunch wait was not bad tho.

excerpts: The line moved fairly quickly and I was a little overwhelmed by the menu but decided on the Japanese beef curry as I was in a comfort food mood although the bento boxes and salads were tempting.
Was feeling a bit hungry
bento.author: Michael Y.
bento.review:
Had a short window to eat during a conference day lunch break. Hopped across the street from the Hyatt regency and got in line for quick bite. The line moved fairly quickly and I was a little overwhelmed by the menu but decided on the Japanese beef curry as I was in a comfort food mood although the bento boxes and salads were tempting. Was feeling a bit hungry so I decided to try the salmon chowder as well. 

The beef curry was hot and the rice had a nice al dente texture. The sauce was flavorful and had a slight spicy kick. The meat was tender and just the right amount of fat. 

The chowder also had a nice salmon flavor in the broth but the fish was just a bit over cooked. The vegetables were nice but I was way too full to finish both dishes  

A great weekday option at one of my favorite SF eating spots!

excerpts: It is a Japanese themed Deli where you have your standard Bento's, Donburi, Salads & entrees.
During lunch you can do a 3-item combo where you get a soup, salad & entree or 2 salads and an entree for $10.99.
bento.author: Ahmad J.
bento.review:
Delica is one of the restaurants in the Ferry building plaza that I've been to a handful of times for lunch. It is a Japanese themed Deli where you have your standard Bento's, Donburi, Salads & entrees. During lunch you can do a 3-item combo where you get a soup, salad & entree or 2 salads and an entree for $10.99. The menu board is not too clear so you will see a lot of first timers hanging around trying to figure out what to get, but once you get the drift the line moves pretty fast.  

Over a period of time I've tried most of their soups, salads and entrees in different combinations. Surprisingly I've liked almost everything that I've got. The salads specially are unique. I haven't seen these in other Deli's. I thought the combinations are a little weird but they go well together. My favorites are the eggplant salad, Salmon chowder & the Kaki-age Tempura (which is vegetable and shrimp tempura). The salmon chowder is loaded with fish and is well worth the $1 up-charge.

Price is actually cheap when compared to other restaurants in the plaza especially when you factor in the high quality of the food. Delica seems to check all my boxes of quality, service and value for money so I'm going to be generous and round up my 4.5 start rating to 5.

excerpts: Stopped by here for a veggie bento box.
Looked better than it taste and a little on the pricy side ($13) but as expected at the ferry building.
bento.author: Allen G.
bento.review: Was starving and needed some food. Stopped by here for a veggie bento box. Looked better than it taste and a little on the pricy side ($13) but as expected at the ferry building.

excerpts: I spent $20+ and only received a piece of tofu and a bento box.
Assorted 9-item Sushi Bento -
I loved the arrangement of this and the presentation, but I wish I got to pick what went inside my bento box.
It was a pre-set amount of things.
I loved most of the things in there, but my favorite was the chicken dumpling and the hijiki & soybean.
The flavors were great and pretty close to a bento box from the corner store in japan.
I love burdock
but I wasn't a fan of the way they mixed theirs.
The celery in the mix threw the flavors off.
The bento also came with 4 pieces of sushi from a roll.
The bento has one piece Salmon, Tuna, 16 grain, and Shrimp & Crab.
Besides the raw piece of salmon and tuna on top of the roll, everything inside the roll was cooked.
The roll also had pieces of raw red peppers.
It threw off the taste completely.
If you had to add a veggie, they should have went with takuwan.
The only roll that I finished was the 16 grain and I liked that one the most.
bento.author: Junella T.
bento.review:
I'm so torn. I wanted to love this place, but it was only a like for me. I'll def return and try some of their other items on the menu, but I ordered from Caviar and they didn't carry everything. Warning though the portions are small for the price you're paying. I spent $20+ and only received a piece of tofu and a bento box.

Agedashi Tofu Steak - This was my favorite. I've eaten this in a handful of restaurants in different countries and the tentsuyu sauce was very good. It was the right amount of sweet and savory. I ate this cold, which was fine, but I'm not sure if you are supposed to heat it up first. A little pricey at $5 a piece.

Assorted 9-item Sushi Bento - I loved the arrangement of this and the presentation, but I wish I got to pick what went inside my bento box. It was a pre-set amount of things. I loved most of the things in there, but my favorite was the chicken dumpling and the hijiki & soybean. The flavors were great and pretty close to a bento box from the corner store in japan. I love burdock but I wasn't a fan of the way they mixed theirs. The celery in the mix threw the flavors off.  My least favorite was the Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad. I was expecting it to taste like the sweet potato salad that's available in most Japanese grocery stores, but the wasab was overpowering. 

The bento also came with 4 pieces of sushi from a roll.The bento has one piece Salmon, Tuna, 16 grain, and Shrimp & Crab. Besides the raw piece of salmon and tuna on top of the roll, everything inside the roll was cooked. The roll also had pieces of raw red peppers. It threw off the taste completely. If you had to add a veggie, they should have went with takuwan. The only roll that I finished was the 16 grain and I liked that one the most.

excerpts: They have bento boxes for lunch as well and you can get a completely vegetarian one.
bento.author: Kelly T.
bento.review:
This adorable little Japanese deli inside the Ferry Building is crave-able. They always have a myriad of fresh salads, both vegetarian and some with chicken. My absolute favorite is their asparagus or green bean salad with fresh carrots and light but very flavorful sesame seed dressing, I only wish they bottled and sold it! 

The croquettes range from peppery potato, creamy veggie with corn, crab and shrimp. All of them are yummy, sometimes during the lunch hour you may have to wait for them to drop a few into the oil but the wait is worth it. 

Their chicken teriyaki dumpling = heaven and they reheat really well in the oven so get a bunch just ask for a little extra sauce to keep them juicy.  They have bento boxes for lunch as well and you can get a completely vegetarian one. They offer quite a few sushi rolls including an avo roll that is 100% vegan. 

On a nice cool crisp SF day their unique MAMEstrone vegetarian soup really hits the spot, the broth is complex, lots of veggies and strange but good parmesan cheese (who'd have thought). 

If you stop by here for lunch or simply to enjoy wandering around the building this place is worth a stop even if just for a croquette, dumpling and small salad.

excerpts:
I love their 
- bento boxes
- veggie curry
- any salads (I like the hijiki seaweed salad and the gobo/burdock salad)
bento.author: Wendy K.
bento.review:
Always good quality food at a great location. I commute by ferry and work near here, this is one of my favorite place to have a quick lunch with out-of-towners, or have a dinner-to-go to eat on the ferry (dinner cruises, woo hoo!) 

I love their 
- bento boxes
- veggie curry
- any salads (I like the hijiki seaweed salad and the gobo/burdock salad)
- ice creams

What is definitely worth mentioning is their hojicha icecream (soft serve) - it's out of the world. Give it a try yourself!

excerpts: They have bento boxes with the most delicious rice green beans
salad seaweed salad and lotus root salad in addition to a variety of protein choices.
When I'm at the ferry building I go to Delica.
The food is fresh enough high-quality.
They also have sushi and you can get items deli style to go as well.
It doesn't have to be in the Bento box.
I love their food and I have been going there for 11 years happily every single time.
If they had one closer to my house it would probably be a weekly visit.
As it stands, it has to be a special ferry building excursion
and I'm thrilled each time I get to enjoy their food.
bento.author: Nettie A.
bento.review:
In the spirit of honesty, my daughter went to school years ago with the owner's son but we are in no means close. I wish we were because the food at Delica is so delicious. 
They have bento boxes with the most delicious rice green beans salad seaweed salad and lotus root salad in addition to a variety of protein choices. When I'm at the ferry building I go to Delica. The food is fresh enough high-quality. They also have sushi and you can get items deli style to go as well. It doesn't have to be in the Bento box. I love their food and I have been going there for 11 years happily every single time. If they had one closer to my house it would probably be a weekly visit. As it stands, it has to be a special ferry building excursion and I'm thrilled each time I get to enjoy their food.

excerpts: I love the Japanese delicatessen concept with a menu of mouthwatering items from sushi, tempura, soups, bento boxes and more.
Portions are on the smaller size, and prices are higher.
During the middle of lunch rush you'll generally see a long line and a deli counter with Asian fusion menu options.
bento.author: Nova P.
bento.review:
This unique venue is one of the more alluring locations with prime real estate in the heart of the ferry building. I love the Japanese delicatessen concept with a menu of mouthwatering items from sushi, tempura, soups, bento boxes and more. Portions are on the smaller size, and prices are higher. During the middle of lunch rush you'll generally see a long line and a deli counter with Asian fusion menu options. Don't let the long line scare you, they have a well oiled operation that gets the line moving quickly.

Delica uses quality ingredients, locally sourced and hormone free. I went with a group of friends, and we all ordered the salmon chowder. On a positive note the flavor and consistency were just right, not too heavy. The downer was the itty bitty speckles of salmon floating in the soup. There were definitely more carrots than anything and my salmon craving left unsatisfied. The alaskan crab croquette was amazing, but for $5+, I wish it was a more sizable portion. My friends ordered the potato croquette which was substantially larger than its crab counterpart. 

Seating is available in the public communal area with the bay view, adjacent to Delica and a few of the other businesses. There doesn't appear to be any shortage of people going to Delica-whether it be tourists or locals. While this probably won't make it on my regular lunch rotation, on occasion I may stop by to grab a la carte items like the roast beef sushi or that crab croquette.

excerpts: My favorite is the Vegetarian Bento Box.
Their miso soup is delicious too!
Plus you can seat in the dining area with a nice view.
bento.author: David V.
bento.review: Everything here is fresh and tasty. My favorite is the Vegetarian Bento Box. Their miso soup is delicious too! Plus you can seat in the dining area with a nice view.

excerpts: We really like their Sushi Sampler Bento Box with inventive and tasty dishes that are a terrific value for the price.
