My faves are the tonkatsu (tonkatsu sauce is perfect, the meat is alway tender, I've never bit into any gristle or fat) and the croquette (yum!).  The kakiage tempura is probably my least favorite, tempura is never good when it sits around.

The tofu steaks are pretty damn good, if I do say so myself.  I've always looked at them in the case thinking, those look nasty!  But one day I tried the one with miso/mushroom topping and it was hella good!  Sometimes they do this agedashi style, which is just as good.

The japanese curries are decent, I like the ground beef and mushroom the best, although they are kinda chintzy on the rice.  Definitely hits the spot when it's cold and rainy.

The only thing I don't like from this joint is the okonomi yaki which I thought was sub-par.  Probably has something to do with the fact that they are pre-made and sitting there on the griddle all day until an unlucky chump orders one.

Rounding out their menu offerings, Delica RF-1 has a large variety of interesting salads, my faves are the green beans+sesame dressing and hijiki+soybean salads.  I like to order a bucket and eat it thru the week.

Note: They will sell the fried items by the piece and the salads by weight, but you can also order combo plates and bento boxes with your choice of entree (fried item, tofu steak, etc) and various salads which you can mix and match to your heart's content, great for lunch.

One time I walked by eating a cheese sandwich from Acme, the Japanese owner told me that my sandwich was not healthy and proceeded to give me a sample of his carrot soup.  For a place that deep fries 1/3 of the items on the menu...Sounds kinda hypocritical, what a dorkus, lucky he can cook!

excerpts: Looking - belatedly! - at other reviews now, perhaps it is because we grabbed the pre-made bento boxes rather than ordering a la carte items  that we were not nearly as satisfied as other reviewers?

We both got the vegetarian bento - which is actually also vegan as far as I can tell, even though it is labeled "vegetarian" - which came with hijiki and soybean salad, spicy burdock root salad, agedashi tofu steak and rice with black sesame seeds.
The rice was the best part, which I think is a little bizarre.
bento.author: Madeleine T.
bento.review:
After a morning of errands I met my omnivorous sweetheart for lunch at the Ferry Building. Somehow I had never eaten here! Delica looked like a fabulous option - clean and pretty in a minimalist way. We hadn't eaten Japanese food in a while, plus never Japanese deli food, specifically, so that was kind of exciting as well. Looking - belatedly! - at other reviews now, perhaps it is because we grabbed the pre-made bento boxes rather than ordering a la carte items  that we were not nearly as satisfied as other reviewers? I honestly have no idea.

We both got the vegetarian bento - which is actually also vegan as far as I can tell, even though it is labeled "vegetarian" - which came with hijiki and soybean salad, spicy burdock root salad, agedashi tofu steak and rice with black sesame seeds. The rice was the best part, which I think is a little bizarre. I mean 

1) I like good rice and 
2) bad rice can certainly ruin a meal, but 
3) I don't know that rice should be the best part of any meal. 

So. The rice was the best part, but not amazingly great, zowie-powie, rock 'em-sock 'em rice. There was no subtlety to the other dishes, and no medley or mixture of flavor - everything was weirdly, overwhelmingly sweet, and the tofu wasn't fresh at all. All that for $10 - each! - makes me a little sad.

I had started this review with two stars but had to take it down to one because I just can't even. Boo.

Veg*ns take note: the spinach sesame salad is prepared with traditional bonito flake dashi - they mention this on their website, but I am not sure if it is clear at the deli.

excerpts: But they have an express line that carries bento boxes.
$10, cash only and with a good selection of drinks

The bento box contained Hijiki and soybean salad, asparagus with creamy seasoning, chicken dumplings that were mixed with water chestnuts and sweet chili sauce on top, in addition to a good portion of steam rice.
All were good and service was fast so that you would be enjoying the food and the weather rather than waiting in line for 15 mins...
bento.author: T L.
bento.review:
Coming to the Ferry Building is a very different experience during the week vs. weekends. Lots of locals and people who work in the hoods, pick up food and enjoy the Vitamin D outside.

Delica had a long line as most places in the FB do. But they have an express line that carries bento boxes. $10, cash only and with a good selection of drinks (Cafe Sepia Matcha Latte that is actually Green Tea milk tea was good.)

The bento box contained Hijiki and soybean salad, asparagus with creamy seasoning, chicken dumplings that were mixed with water chestnuts and sweet chili sauce on top, in addition to a good portion of steam rice. All were good and service was fast so that you would be enjoying the food and the weather rather than waiting in line for 15 mins...

excerpts: The curries, udon soup, bento boxes, seaweed salads, shrimp or potato croquettes are all delicious.
You can taste the freshness in all of their ingredients.
This is the only place I've been able to find the Japanese apple tea.
And I love the apple tea pairing with the beef curry.
but they try to alleviate the lunch time rush by setting up a bento box and cash payment on the side of the venue.
bento.author: Cathy L.
bento.review:
I love this place.  The curries, udon soup, bento boxes, seaweed salads, shrimp or potato croquettes are all delicious.  You can taste the freshness in all of their ingredients.  This is the only place I've been able to find the Japanese apple tea.  And I love the apple tea pairing with the beef curry.  This is one of my favorite lunch time hot spots in the ferry building.   

The line to order or pay can be confusing but they try to alleviate the lunch time rush by setting up a bento box and cash payment on the side of the venue.

You can also purchase the salads by the pound and occasionally I've ordered it to bring to potluck dinners and it's been a hit with friends every time.

excerpts: Asparagus salad (part of Dianne's $9.50 bento box) -- Super good.
Roast beef sushi --
This works.
Lotus root salad & chinese chicken salad -- really good, really fresh ingredients and very flavorful.
But probably won't get if I go here again.
As much as I'd like to think I am partial to good for me stuff.
That is sheer DENIAL (
I ordered the RBS (that's Roast Beef Sushi) when I was paying for my BB (that's Bento Box).
And I swear the guy's exasperation was palpable (that's
They Don't Pay Me Enough
Here To Make Nice To You).
bento.author: Natasha S.
bento.review:
Lovely Dianne D.  accompanied me to this place.

Very fresh and flavorful ingredients.  Wonderful selection.

Tried:  

Crab croquette -- Wolfed that down.  Light and crispy but not greasy.
Asparagus salad (part of Dianne's $9.50 bento box) -- Super good.
Roast beef sushi -- This works.
Lotus root salad & chinese chicken salad -- really good, really fresh ingredients and very flavorful.  But probably won't get if I go here again.  As much as I'd like to think I am partial to good for me stuff.  That is sheer DENIAL (Don't Even (K)now I Am Lying).

Almost forgot:  indifferent service.  I ordered the RBS (that's Roast Beef Sushi) when I was paying for my BB (that's Bento Box). And I swear the guy's exasperation was palpable (that's They Don't Pay Me Enough Here To Make Nice To You).

excerpts: So ended up picking a  Summer bento box which consists of 9 items for $11 from Delica.
It was rather pricey considering most of the items (morsel-like) were different kinds of Japanese salads with 3 slices of  vege/salmon roll and a chicken dumpling.
Was a great way to sample the different salads.
bento.author: Yan M.
bento.review: I went on a rampage in Ferry Building and wanted to try all the different things that Yelpers have reviewed which I had bookmarked previously. So ended up picking a  Summer bento box which consists of 9 items for $11 from Delica. It was rather pricey considering most of the items (morsel-like) were different kinds of Japanese salads with 3 slices of  vege/salmon roll and a chicken dumpling. Was a great way to sample the different salads.

excerpts: And I will probably order the same thing, the bento box with tonkatsu.
I might try different side dishes because they have all been really good, but tonkatsu will probably stay the same.
Even though I know their corn croquette is delicious too.
But how do they make their tonkatsu so crunchy?
Extra large panko?
If I were to become a housewife ever, I aspire to be the one that can duplicate bento boxes like this place.
I wouldn't care if my husband gets sick of it, or if my kids hate it, I'd still be a successful housewife in my mind.
bento.author: Candice B.
bento.review:
If I didn't bring my lunch to work, I'd eat at Delica rf-1 everyday.  And I will probably order the same thing, the bento box with tonkatsu.  I might try different side dishes because they have all been really good, but tonkatsu will probably stay the same.  Even though I know their corn croquette is delicious too.   But how do they make their tonkatsu so crunchy?  Extra large panko?  Cuz my home-made tonkatsu doesn't have big golden flakes like that. 

If I were to become a housewife ever, I aspire to be the one that can duplicate bento boxes like this place.   I wouldn't care if my husband gets sick of it, or if my kids hate it, I'd still be a successful housewife in my mind.

excerpts: Bento Boxes, Dumplings, Wasabi Potato Salad (super delicious), Croquettes, Curry, Sushi, Green Tea!
This place is just rad.
Great Japanese take away that tastes fresh.
If you love anything Japanese, you must go!
bento.author: Alenna S.
bento.review:
I was just going up to visit friends in Pasadena for a couple of days when one of them says, I'm going up to SF for the day, come with! OKAY!

I love the Ferry Building even though it's tourist central but my favorite spot there is Delica rf-1.  

Bento Boxes, Dumplings, Wasabi Potato Salad (super delicious), Croquettes, Curry, Sushi, Green Tea!  This place is just rad.  Great Japanese take away that tastes fresh.  If you love anything Japanese, you must go!

excerpts: I had the spring bento which had like 6 different items including mushrooms, spinach, green beans, edamame wasabi potato salad, salmon spring roll, and something else.
My personal favorites were the green beans and potato salad.
bento.author: Paweena P.
bento.review:
I went here for lunch today. This place is absolutely delicious and very, very fresh tasting. I had the spring bento which had like 6 different items including mushrooms, spinach, green beans, edamame wasabi potato salad, salmon spring roll, and something else. My personal favorites were the green beans and potato salad. So good!

The only thing is that it's a bit pricey, but great for a payday lunch!

This is the best fast food restaurant I've ever been to.

excerpts: This food is so fresh, very vegetarian and vegan friendly, ample selections to chose from, and excellent bento boxes for taking out to the docks and enjoying some sun.
bento.author: E.Mo. ..
bento.review:
MY goodness this place is fantastic. Fantastic, Sally!!!
Asian fusion if a nice high-caliber (your wallets will concur). I do not agree with the review that says everything in this place is deep-fried or over-sauced. If you chose something deep-fried, chances are it's going to have been deep-fried. The over-sauced items, though few and far between, tend to need the extra sauce. Granted, I'm sauce biased, but it's an honest review.

This food is so fresh, very vegetarian and vegan friendly, ample selections to chose from, and excellent bento boxes for taking out to the docks and enjoying some sun.

As soon as your alimony, year-end bonus or tax refund comes in - go and treat yourself people.

excerpts: When I'm in the mood for GREAT bento, this place does it for me.
bento.author: Kelly K.
bento.review:
Mmm... I love this place.  When I'm in the mood for GREAT bento, this place does it for me.  

The Tonkatsu has to be the some of the best I've had in my lifetime, and I'm Japanese... a twinkie to the fullest extent, but still Japanese.  The Tonkatsu is tender, juicy, and perfectly crunchy on the outside.  Simply perfection.  

I also have a deep love for the Hijiki Salad.  Delicious!  With soybeans, konyaku (yam cake), age (fried tofu), and edamame.  Even the Lotus and Burdock Root salad is tops!

Now onto the Potato Croquette... divine.  Now with corn, a wonderful addition, however I do miss the old version from time to time.  Hopefully they bring it back in the winter.  We shall see.  

Beef curry is also sublime.  It depends who serves though.  I heard them training one day, and they stated the regular size is to have ONLY 3 pieces of meat, and however much sauce, potatoes and carrots that seem reasonable.  3 pieces of meat!  What a bummer.  Today I had the beef curry and I must've had at least 6 pieces of meat.  Tender, juicy, and full of flavor.  Thank goodness for the indiscretion of the server today, because beef curry ought to have plenty of beef... but maybe that's just me.  

Anyhoo, you can find me there at least a couple times a month, if not more, much more.  I'm always down for a #4 lunch plate, a salad, main item, and rice... this translates to Hijiki Salad, Tonkatsu and rice.  YUM!  LOVE IT!  

This Japanese Twinkie LURVES me some Delica Rf-1...  ayup, yes I do, indeed!

excerpts: If you want to make a custom bento box, wait to add your salad at the end of the line -- didn't notice all the extra choices!
bento.author: Susan T.
bento.review:
Yummy food, so glad to discover this Japanese deli! If you want to make a custom bento box, wait to add your salad at the end of the line -- didn't notice all the extra choices! 

The chicken dumplings are good, and actually their rice is really good :) You may have some trouble looking for seating in the area, as the Ferry building is a bit crowded.

excerpts: Second trip: I'm eating the Summer Bento Box right now.
It's really good.
It includes a small sample of nine of their items.
Great for trying different things.
The seaweed in the seaweed salad is a little more cooked than I'm used to (almost melts in the mouth).
bento.author: Keane L.
bento.review:
Really quick service since most of it is already prepared. Extremely high quality at slightly high prices. They use non-hormonal beef (in other words: whilst alive, the cow didn't "have a cow" hahaha... ha...    ...sorry) and fresh Acme bread to make their panko. 

I tried the Ginger Beef bowl (sweet, sweet meat at $6.50) and the roast beef sushi ($2 each). Both were good and required no wait. Prices are almost as high as the quality.

Second trip: I'm eating the Summer Bento Box right now. It's really good. It includes a small sample of nine of their items. Great for trying different things. The seaweed in the seaweed salad is a little more cooked than I'm used to (almost melts in the mouth). $11.94 after tax. 

Third trip: Tofu patty with 2 Salads Lunch Combo (I chose the Hijiki and Chicken salads) for $9. Chicken salad has a good deal of celery in it = me, pissing off the guy in the next cubicle with *crunch*..*crunch*....I also added a Corn Croquette. All very good, especially the croquette, but it seems I'll never spend under $10 here...

Would come here more if it were cheaper. It's busy during peak times but very fluid on the off. 

Excepts credit cards (including AMEX).

excerpts: They have wonderful and well prepared bento boxes, as well as Japanese curries, sushi to go, and many other items.
My one complaint would be that it's a bit pricey for what you get.
Nevertheless, I go here at least twice a month.
bento.author: Brian M.
bento.review: DELICA offers good, high-quality, Japanese deli cuisine. They have wonderful and well prepared bento boxes, as well as Japanese curries, sushi to go, and many other items. My one complaint would be that it's a bit pricey for what you get. Nevertheless, I go here at least twice a month.

excerpts: I recommend skipping the bento box because it always seems to have 2 great things and 1 just ok thing.
Go for a la carte and then sit on the pier and eat lunch.
A great treat during the workday!
bento.author: Kimberly H.
bento.review:
Wow. The Japanese really know how to do tasty and healthy food. I love this place so much, the only thing from stopping me some days is the cost. I drop about $12 each time I go here and I am a tiny woman - I don't eat a lot! 

The seaweed salad is very good and full of Iron. All of their meats are flavorable and cooked perfectly. I recommend skipping the bento box because it always seems to have 2 great things and 1 just ok thing. Go for a la carte and then sit on the pier and eat lunch. A great treat during the workday!

excerpts: If you're not in a mood for such a bovine delicacy, grab one of the Bento boxes.
bento.author: Eston B.
bento.review:
Delica RF-1? What the hell is this? A sister series to New Mobile Report Gundam Wing? A new Toyota sports car? A really awesome Japanese radio?

While all of those things sound like they'd make more sense, what Delica really is about is ROAST BEEF SUSHI. While it sounds weird and looks weird, it's awesome. If you're not in a mood for such a bovine delicacy, grab one of the Bento boxes. They're good too.

The only reason I'm knocking off a star is because the place is a little expensive, but the ambiance of the Ferry Building may make up for it.

excerpts: Great concept; their bento boxes are a nice, convenient lunch on the lighter side.
Good potato and pumpkin croquettes too; try one of each.
Grab a cold Oolong to go with your meal and you are good to go.
Pricey for deli food
but they do have a lease in the Ferry Building.
bento.author: Adam W.
bento.review:
Great concept; their bento boxes are a nice, convenient lunch on the lighter side. Good potato and pumpkin croquettes too; try one of each. Grab a cold Oolong to go with your meal and you are good to go.

Pricey for deli food but they do have a lease in the Ferry Building.

excerpts: If you want something already packed in a bento, pick it up and pay on the right, If you want something from the cases, get in line to the left.
bento.author: Cheryl D.
bento.review:
If you want something already packed in a bento, pick it up and pay on the right, If you want something from the cases, get in line to the left. The individually pre-packed refrigeration needed items are also on the left.

I liked the tempura veggie fritter - which I thought was similar to filipino ukoy - it was good. 

The eggplant salad  was tasty, but there was a lot of sauce, I should've ordered some rice to throw it on. Delicious!

The tofu chicken mound with onions was good, but served cold - I think it would be better warm.

The Meyers roast beef on sushi rice(refrigerated =P) was OK, tasty, I dont think I'd pay $2 each for it again. Maybe made fresh at dinner in a sit down restaurant.

Most of the time my lunch here ends up over $15 (I order everything seperate without rice and a drink). The best deal here is a combo box, and although the poritons may seem small, flavors and ingredient quality make up for it. Plus the view... *sigh*

excerpts: My daughter was the one who really scored with the shrimp bento box from Delicia rf-1.
The shrimp cakes were incredible, and the two salads she had were great.
We also got a tempura with soybeans and
We were sitting here at home this morning, drinking tea, reading the paper, when my daughter sighed and said, "I really want another bento box from the Ferry Building.
"  Guess that will be our first stop on our next trip:)
bento.author: Mary C.
bento.review:
Oh yum!  We were heading to Sacramento around lunch time, so we decided to wander through the Ferry Building to find road food.  I got a great cheese sandwich from the Acme Bread Co., husband got a sloppy pork sandwich from the Golden Gate Meat place (really, BBQ sauce, when you're DRIVING?  Good thing it was a rental car.)  My daughter was the one who really scored with the shrimp bento box from Delicia rf-1.  The shrimp cakes were incredible, and the two salads she had were great. We also got a tempura with soybeans and a few other things that really should have been eaten while it was still warm.  

We completely messed up our order and the young woman who was putting it together was very nice about it.  The man working the register wasn't too happy, but hey, we ordered MORE food, and gave him MORE money, so once he realized that, he smiled.  

I'm so glad my daughter shared some of her salad and shrimp with me.  It would have been sad to push her out of the car on the freeway just to get a taste of it.  

We were sitting here at home this morning, drinking tea, reading the paper, when my daughter sighed and said, "I really want another bento box from the Ferry Building."  Guess that will be our first stop on our next trip:)

excerpts: There are options to purchase individual items, combine them into a bento box, or get salads by the pound.
I sampled the hijiki and soybean salad ($15/lb) as well as the green beans with sesame dressing salad ($12/lb).
bento.author: Karen Y.
bento.review:
Cute, somewhat upscale Japanese deli in the Ferry Building. There are options to purchase individual items, combine them into a bento box, or get salads by the pound. I sampled the hijiki and soybean salad ($15/lb) as well as the green beans with sesame dressing salad ($12/lb). Both were delicious and tasted healthy...must get more next time!

I've always wanted to try okonomiyaki ($5) so I ordered the chicken one...there's a veggie one with mushrooms too. It's like a savory Japanese pancake made with some kind of batter, eggs, cabbage and topped with Japanese mayo, this sweet sauce, as well as fish/seaweed flakes. The okonomiyaki was just sitting on the griddle so I didn't know how long they had been out (minus 1 star). 

Nonetheless, $5 for a fairly filling, tasty lunch wasn't bad at all. I'm glad I tried the okonomiyaki even though the chicken was a little dry...I really enjoyed the sauces and toppings though. Service was quick and wasn't very busy for lunch hours. Will be returning to try their curry!

excerpts: Also spotted a crab croquette in a bento box....give it a try next week.
I come to this 'deli' at least once a week for their spectacular tonkatsu bento.
I have tried everything short of their tofu patty (which still looks delicious) but will opt not to do so since everything else there is so good!
Drop a 10 spot and you'll get 3 perfectly fried pieces of pork cutlets, 2 side salads, and a serving of rice
; all neatly compartmentalized in your 'bento' box!
bento.author: William R.
bento.review:
12:00PM
4.2.2007

***NEW DESSERT!!!***  Mango and Avocado delight...

Also spotted a crab croquette in a bento box....give it a try next week.

Bomb...

1:25PM
3.21.2007

***NEW SALAD!!!***   Asparagus Salad in a creamy sesame dressing!  

Bomb....

3.8.2007
12:00PM

I come to this 'deli' at least once a week for their spectacular tonkatsu bento.  I have tried everything short of their tofu patty (which still looks delicious) but will opt not to do so since everything else there is so good!  Drop a 10 spot and you'll get 3 perfectly fried pieces of pork cutlets, 2 side salads, and a serving of rice; all neatly compartmentalized in your 'bento' box!  

ALL of their salads taste fantastic and are made with fresh ingredients.  (Wasabi mashed potatoes, hijiki salad, lotus root salad, asparagus salad, chinese chicken salad.)  They also sell Japanese style curry (which is bomb) and cold soba noodles with a side of shrimp cake.  Their 'hot' items include my all time fave the tonkatsu, spicy fried chicken, chicken meatball, kakiage (mixed assortment of tempura battered veggies and shrimp), potato croquettes, and shrimp cakes.

I don't think most people who come here understand how good this place is; it's truly amazing how well they prepare their foods!  Probably the best Japanese food in the City; we are blessed to have Delica-rf1.

Expect a line during the week.

excerpts: I know I know, Bento box at 10:30 am?
I had the five piece bento box with the chicken dumpling, shrimp cake, salad, wasabi potato salad and cheddar rice pilaf.
bento.author: Tom V.
bento.review:
Ok so maybe Im a little crazy.. I choose to eat here for brunch on tuesday. I know I know, Bento box at 10:30 am? It obviously didnt work for me.

I could see why this place is rated so highly by other yelp users, but honestly I just couldnt get into it at this time in the morning. Actually I dont think I could get into it period. 

I had the five piece bento box with the chicken dumpling, shrimp cake, salad, wasabi potato salad and cheddar rice pilaf.

The shrimp cake was pretty good, but Im pretty sure it was because it was doused in tartar sauce, and the rice pilaf looking dish with almonds was good. The chicken dumpling was awful. Im not sure exactly what the salad was but it was like  weird ginger/teryaki with tofu creation that I didnt really enjoy.

Overall I had to balance my rating, because I think people will enjoy it, but my own experience was not that good.

excerpts: Nice spot for a quick lunch with the bento boxes.
But if you wanna eat something light and delicious
I recommend Chinese chicken salad and the green beans salad.
So yummy!
bento.author: Pat M.
bento.review: Nice spot for a quick lunch with the bento boxes. But if you wanna eat something light and delicious I recommend Chinese chicken salad and the green beans salad. So yummy!

excerpts: You can either buy pre-made, fresh Bento OR make your own.
The Bento Box comes with 2 salads, rice, and your choice of one other item.
I always double up on the green bean salad and get pork nuggets too.
My husband usually orders the triple salad and picks a variety of 3 different salads.
If I had to make a list of my top 10 favorite foods of all time, the green bean salad would make the list.
Yes, it is that good!
They also have a variety of other vittles like roast beef sushi.
bento.author: PictureGirl F.
bento.review: So, over the past year or so I tried out some other stuff and it was all fantastic.  You can either buy pre-made, fresh Bento OR make your own.  The Bento Box comes with 2 salads, rice, and your choice of one other item.  I always double up on the green bean salad and get pork nuggets too.  My husband usually orders the triple salad and picks a variety of 3 different salads.  If I had to make a list of my top 10 favorite foods of all time, the green bean salad would make the list.  Yes, it is that good!  They also have a variety of other vittles like roast beef sushi.

excerpts: I stopped in the Ferry Building the other day to do a quick pick up of my wine shipment (holla!) and grabbed a bento box to go.
I did NOT expect to be blown away by a pre-packaged lunch box place with a short line and great prices.
bento.author: Claire C.
bento.review:
Scrummy with a capital SCRUM!  I stopped in the Ferry Building the other day to do a quick pick up of my wine shipment (holla!) and grabbed a bento box to go.  I did NOT expect to be blown away by a pre-packaged lunch box place with a short line and great prices.  All of my squares were excellent, particularly the eggplant with meat sauce and the potato salad with soy beans and wasabi!  

Highly recommended. I've grabbed the catering menu too to go over options for some events I have coming up, so I'll get back to you on this end.  All in all, some serious lunch time yumminess at this place!

excerpts: Vegetarian grab-n-go bento - with a bottle of green tea, you have one of the most delicious, healthy, Japanese-style lunches available in the city.
But the veggie ones sell out quickly, so get there at the start of the lunch rush.
bento.author: Ashley H.
bento.review: Vegetarian grab-n-go bento - with a bottle of green tea, you have one of the most delicious, healthy, Japanese-style lunches available in the city. But the veggie ones sell out quickly, so get there at the start of the lunch rush.

excerpts: I ended up with a 5 item bento box from Delica.
It lives up to its name - the flavors of the items in the box are delicate and subtle and delicious.
Light, but highly rewarding to the palate.
bento.author: Doc L.
bento.review:
I had no idea what to expect. I was looking for a light dinner to take back to my hotel, and wandered through the Ferry Building looking for something interesting.

I ended up with a 5 item bento box from Delica.  It lives up to its name - the flavors of the items in the box are delicate and subtle and delicious. Light, but highly rewarding to the palate.

excerpts: but I would definitely come back again to try a Bento box or beef bowl :)
bento.author: CHERiE Y.
bento.review:
I was here today because  I love their Potato Croquettes. Fresh, warm, and crispy!  At $1.50 each, they make a perfect afternoon snack. I can't speak for anything else on the menu (yet!) but I would definitely come back again to try a Bento box or beef bowl :) 

The only other place I've had croquettes was in the Roppongi Hills Shopping Center food court in Tokyo. Delica rf-1 reminded me of those *nostalgic sigh*

excerpts: Everything is really good, and the salads in the bento box are exciting not filler.
It feels subtley delicious the way that good Japanese food can.
Delica is true to it's first name.
bento.author: Leo C.
bento.review:
The cash-only-table-with-discount outfront gives me a quick option for a gourmet lunch fix at the Ferry Building.  Easier than getting the ready to go items (buns, spring rolls) at Out the Door.

It's got the freshness and quality you can easily taste.  Everything is really good, and the salads in the bento box are exciting not filler.  It feels subtley delicious the way that good Japanese food can.  Delica is true to it's first name.  (rf-1?  Who knows...)

Oh, and a shout out for the compost/recycling options in house.

excerpts: Order the seasonal bento box lunch.
bento.author: Erica A.
bento.review:
Order the seasonal bento box lunch. It contains small samples of different yummy dishes.

Food is fresh and tasty.

excerpts: Fantastic bento style lunches in the ferry building.
On the pricey side but worth it for a special picnic.
Note to foreigners - bentos are box lunches are are meant to be eaten cold.
bento.author: Karen N.
bento.review: Fantastic bento style lunches in the ferry building.  On the pricey side but worth it for a special picnic. Note to foreigners - bentos are box lunches are are meant to be eaten cold.

excerpts: I'm coming back for the katsus and other bento boxes.
Do not pass this up.
Plus you can fill up on some Petes coffee across the hall in case you get food coma,
cuz next time I will be ordering  A LOT of food.
bento.author: Thomas L.
bento.review: I havent had this good a hot soba noodle in a LONG TIME. They also topped it w/ a fried kariage (fried shrimp/veggie) which melted nicely into the noodles and soup. I never realized the wonders of the Ferry Building until this past weekend. And I'm glad this place helped me realize it. Prices are also reasonable for Japanese food. I'm coming back for the katsus and other bento boxes. Do not pass this up. Plus you can fill up on some Petes coffee across the hall in case you get food coma, cuz next time I will be ordering  A LOT of food.

excerpts: Oh wow, bento boxes ftw here!
Admittedly I'm a bit of a Japanese-food "newbie" so boxes filled with random foods was a bit scary for me.
But they turned out so delicious!
My favorite was the wasabi mashed potatoes (pleasantly hot) and the chicken dumpling.
bento.author: Tracy O.
bento.review:
Oh wow, bento boxes ftw here! Admittedly I'm a bit of a Japanese-food "newbie" so boxes filled with random foods was a bit scary for me. But they turned out so delicious! My favorite was the wasabi mashed potatoes (pleasantly hot) and the chicken dumpling. I do wish things were better labeled because I didn't know what I ate until I looked here!

Miso was DELICIOUS; giant chunks of tofu, not the piddly chunks other places have. And fast; pick up a box and pay... no waiting for a server.

excerpts: Everything on the menu, all the sushi rolls, bento boxes, and deli items looked so healthy and fresh!
I was contemplating what to get for the longest time.
Since I wasn't too hungry
I got the combo sushi roll- with smoked salmon and shrimp wrapped in rice paper.
The rice paper really did it for me because it actually made me feel good after finishing all 6 pieces.
The roll was very fresh and lite.
For $8, kinda pricey, but I think it was worth it.
I'd definitely want to try their deli selections and bento boxes the next time I'm here.
bento.author: Lisa C.
bento.review: It's like a fast food Japanese joint minus all the unhealthiness that entails fast food. Everything on the menu, all the sushi rolls, bento boxes, and deli items looked so healthy and fresh! I was contemplating what to get for the longest time.  Since I wasn't too hungry I got the combo sushi roll- with smoked salmon and shrimp wrapped in rice paper.  The rice paper really did it for me because it actually made me feel good after finishing all 6 pieces.  The roll was very fresh and lite.  For $8, kinda pricey, but I think it was worth it.  I'd definitely want to try their deli selections and bento boxes the next time I'm here.

excerpts: I usually get a bento but the katsu's been less than impressive of late
and sometimes they're a little skimpy with the rice and/or the salads.
There's also some japanese curry which is good, but not nearly as tasty as muracci's and some sushi rolls.
it's good, but not necessarily at their price point.
bento.author: Jennifer C.
bento.review: I really like this place for what it is - a Japanese deli. I'm only here for lunch, so it's a grab it and go type of deal for me. It's all stuff made with organic beautiful ingredients and they have an interesting variety of salads ranging from wasabi potato to hijiki to mabo tofu. There's also some fried foods, like karaage tempura, croquettes and katsu. I usually get a bento but the katsu's been less than impressive of late and sometimes they're a little skimpy with the rice and/or the salads. There's also some japanese curry which is good, but not nearly as tasty as muracci's and some sushi rolls. it's good, but not necessarily at their price point.

excerpts: The bento for $11 is a little heavy on price but well-worth it.
What you get is not only filling, tasty, and worth a picture or two...
it tasted fresh!
Which is very important for my bento box affections.
bento.author: Andrew W.
bento.review:
How come no one thought of this before? A japanese-style restaurant and DELI! I love the setup and location immensely. The food, is heart-breakingly artistic and beautiful... because, in the end, you have to eat it. 

The bento for $11 is a little heavy on price but well-worth it. What you get is not only filling, tasty, and worth a picture or two... it tasted fresh! Which is very important for my bento box affections.

I have to come back for the curry... maybe, tomorrow? :)

excerpts: And for bento box fans take a look at the bento boxes they have here.
When I was in Japan as a kid once
(I was 12 yrs old)
the thing that stuck out to me the most was the lil neatly packed bento boxes.
Seeing the bento boxes here brought back some childhood flashbacks.
bento.author: Sherman H.
bento.review:
What a great concept!  Think Italian deli or small plates tapas, but Japanese style.  I am sure these are a dime a dozen back in the motherland, but for us Californian Japanese food luvers we must admit that our range of Japanese cuisines is very limited.  Sure we've all had our lunch boxes, raw tunas and fancy rolls.  A few creative souls probably tried out some Japanese curries and udon/sobas/ramen but DELICA rf-1 is fun, unique, clean and you just feel this is a whole different type of Japanese food that the locals in CA haven't had before, but would try once they go.

DELICA rf-1 is a perfect lunch place (especially once summer comes and this damn rain goes away).  I had the Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad and its yummy -- who doesn't like a mix of wasabi mayo + edamames and for the sushi fans try out the Roast Beef Sushi.  And for bento box fans take a look at the bento boxes they have here.  When I was in Japan as a kid once (I was 12 yrs old) the thing that stuck out to me the most was the lil neatly packed bento boxes.  Seeing the bento boxes here brought back some childhood flashbacks.

excerpts:
However, 4 stars is by no means bad in my book-- MAKING it worth the jacked-up ferry plaza prices ($9.50 for bento, approx $3.75 for panko-fried items).  

Those bento boxes (various items, always a healthy, square meal) sure are handy for buying to-go and finding a people watching or bayview perch in the back of the ferry plaza or the nearby Embarcadero.
bento.author: E L.
bento.review:
FERRY PLAZA FRUGAL:  Lunch curry specials rock the house and always a vegetarian option, usually under $10.  SO crazy good was the eggplant curry with GROUND CHICKEN ($7.75), I felt like I was rising out of my chair.  And, you can certainly make a meal out of their little fried goodies.  At 2.75-3.75 a piece it seems dear until you get that first bite of panko goodness.  Add in 1/2 pinto of edamame or green bean salad with miso dressing and a pro bono view of the bay and you're stylin'.


People!  It's all about the PANKO!  (those yum-licious breadcrumbs that fry ever so delicately to encase delica's fried specialties: potato and mushroom croquettes, shrimp cake, tonkatsu, et al).  

The panko-fried items get 5 stars, but the unfortunate (fast japanese food hazard) BLANDNESS of some items like sweet-n-sour chicken (chunks of orangey chicken, had it today), hijiki and soybean salad (not sea-salty enough-- this is seaweed, isn't it??) and glazed chicken meatballs (apparently, the glaze is COSMETIC) brings this super-sanitary and well-run by happy-shiny-counterpeople upscale deli down to 4 stars.  

However, 4 stars is by no means bad in my book-- MAKING it worth the jacked-up ferry plaza prices ($9.50 for bento, approx $3.75 for panko-fried items).  

Notable items (aside from the amazing FRIED MENU) include:  Chinese Chicken Salad, made with the delica touch:  julienne veggies and chicken, the best use of baby celery I've ever tasted and DEAD-ON chinese chicken salad vinaigrette without all of the fuss of an americanized chinese chix salad.  

Also, wasabi, garlic and edamame potato salad:  who the hell thought of this?  It's crazy good.  Half-mashed wasabi-garlic potatoes, whole fresh edamame beans in a cold potato salad-- great intimate picnic food.  

And, another one of my personal favs, the roast beef nigiri, just like it sounds, thinly sliced rare roast beef atop a finger of japanese sushi rice (the rice it pretty decent, not gross or cheap or sticky), maybe some scallion garnish.  

They also have other sushi, some wrapped in rice paper rather than seaweed, that I have yet to try...

Those bento boxes (various items, always a healthy, square meal) sure are handy for buying to-go and finding a people watching or bayview perch in the back of the ferry plaza or the nearby Embarcadero.  

Also, Japanese style cooking and dining is engineered to be 'systematically beautiful' and therefore a non-messy, organized and tranquililty-inducing eating experience (think Zen...) which explains why some items lack the flavor kick. (Gloppy, sloppy sweet and sour sauce? No way, sensai!).  

This Japanese tradition of food presentaion carried out at Delica also explains the CALM I feel even when I'm CHOWING on one of their panko-fried mushroom croquettes and dipping them in the delicate tomato or herbed mayo sauces-- with chopsticks!

Can't beat the bayview location, friendly staff (and very cute asian guys).  Ferry plaza standard.

excerpts: More bento boxes than you can shake a stick at.
And lots of tasty little bites.
My faves are the fried shrimp cakes and potato croquettes.
Lots of healthy choices too; salads, soups and sushi.
bento.author: Marcus W.
bento.review:
This is a great Japanese deli and could be my new favorite quick lunch / take-out place in the Ferry Building.

Lots of choices, including a few vegetarian items and even a couple of vegan items.  More bento boxes than you can shake a stick at.  And lots of tasty little bites.  My faves are the fried shrimp cakes and potato croquettes.  Lots of healthy choices too; salads, soups and sushi.  The beef curry sauce is super tasty, but because the meat is organic, you'll only get a few pieces.

While everything on the menu is slightly less than $10, you'll probably spend around $10-15.  Just like tapas and dim sum, those little plates add up fast.

It gets busy at lunch.  And with all the people trying to choose from the many items, do yourself a favor and show up before noon.

excerpts: Mmmmm, I love to go here and get the bento boxes - full of stuff
I know I like, and maybe a new thing or two that's guaranteed to be tasty.
Delica rf-1 is a delicious, healthy way to jolt yourself out of the weekday lunch doldrums.
The flavors are interesting, and the food is fresh - it won't make you feel like you need to take a big nap under your desk.
It is on the slightly pricier end of the lunch spectrum - a box is around
$10-$11 - but it's a great treat, and you can fill up there for less if you're content to try only one or two of their offerings.
As for me, if I'm going all the way to the Ferry Building, I'm determined to sample several items.
It's all good
but I'll mention a few offerings
bento.author: Natalie S.
bento.review:
Mmmmm, I love to go here and get the bento boxes - full of stuff I know I like, and maybe a new thing or two that's guaranteed to be tasty.  Delica rf-1 is a delicious, healthy way to jolt yourself out of the weekday lunch doldrums.  The flavors are interesting, and the food is fresh - it won't make you feel like you need to take a big nap under your desk.  It is on the slightly pricier end of the lunch spectrum - a box is around $10-$11 - but it's a great treat, and you can fill up there for less if you're content to try only one or two of their offerings.  As for me, if I'm going all the way to the Ferry Building, I'm determined to sample several items.  It's all good but I'll mention a few offerings so you know what you're getting into . . . 

Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad (with edamame!)
Corn and Mascarpone Cheese Salad
Eggplant Salad (with chicken and onions)
Crab Cream Croquette
Chicken Dumpling with Sweet Chili Sauce (and water chestnutes and mushrooms)

it's pretty deli-style - I'm such a visual person that I usually just go for the stuff on display, but evidently they have sushi rolls, rice bowls, and several kinds of soup.

excerpts: I always go for the tonkatsu bento and beef curry.
I tried to order bento in the hot food line and was told by a lady to order from the cold food line.
bento.author: danny m.
bento.review:
The food here is a tad more than I would like to pay, but it's the Ferry Building so it's expected.

The food is always good and fresh.  I always go for the tonkatsu bento and beef curry.  It's also nice to be able to eat by the water on a nice sunny day.

My only complaint is the confusing ordering system.  I tried to order bento in the hot food line and was told by a lady to order from the cold food line.  When I moved over to the cold food line, the same lady ended up taking my order, hmmm?????  

I've also had an experience when I tried to pay for my food, which they held at the register, they had sold my food to someone else. 

Other than the confusing ordering system, I'm happy with the food.

excerpts: Authentic Japanese bento boxes.
Great kare rice (kare, not curry).
When I want Japanese food like the kind of food I would eat at home, I come here to select one main and 2 salad items or 3 salad items.
Sit on a bench and eat by the water.
It's not cheap, but it's worth every penny.
My only complaint is that the menu doesn't change, so I'm getting a little sick of the items . . .
bento.author: Su K.
bento.review: Authentic Japanese bento boxes. Great kare rice (kare, not curry). When I want Japanese food like the kind of food I would eat at home, I come here to select one main and 2 salad items or 3 salad items. Sit on a bench and eat by the water. It's not cheap, but it's worth every penny. My only complaint is that the menu doesn't change, so I'm getting a little sick of the items . . .

excerpts: On my most recent visit, I had the bento with the hijiki and soybean salad, lotus root salad, chicken meatballs (2) and steamed rice.
Everything was delicious!
Fresh and healthy.
Nice presentation in the bento box.
The bento was $9.50.
bento.author: Miu M.
bento.review:
oishi-i-i-i!!

As others have noted, the food at Delica is just like the food sold in department store basements in Japan.   

On my most recent visit, I had the bento with the hijiki and soybean salad, lotus root salad, chicken meatballs (2) and steamed rice.  Everything was delicious!  Fresh and healthy.  Nice presentation in the bento box.  The bento was $9.50.  

If anyone over at Delica is reading, can you please put kabocha on the menu?

excerpts: The bento boxes are a good way to go if you want to sample a few things in one fell swoop.
bento.author: cyndi L.
bento.review:
I love it here. The food is tasty and interesting. Pricey but worth it.

I've tried most everything. The items I keep going back to are the soba noodle salad, wasabi potato salad, the white corn salad with a cheese vinaigrette (sounds weird buts it really good. It's also seasonal, I think), shrimp cake, potato croquette (can't go wrong with fried items). The bento boxes are a good way to go if you want to sample a few things in one fell swoop.

After you've made your selection, have a seat outside. Nice.

excerpts: The bento boxes are pretty nice.
They are right there, ready for pick-up, and range about 9 or 10 bucks.
Perhaps grab a small deli item to go with your bento box if you think you might be starving.
bento.author: Nicolas H.
bento.review:
This is a great place to go if you are in the area and need a lunch that is good and healthy.

The bento boxes are pretty nice. They are right there, ready for pick-up, and range about 9 or 10 bucks. Not too bad, if you want to eat some good food.

They also have food that you can pick and choose from in their deli which is also a good treat. 

My only set-back is that I like to eat (alot actually) and so the food isn't always as filling as I'd hope. This is definitely a place to go if you want a semi-filling lunch, because you had a late breakfast or are planning an early dinner. Perhaps grab a small deli item to go with your bento box if you think you might be starving.

Overall, great place.

excerpts: The sushi is probably what I would buy again if I had to; the bento boxes are alright.
bento.author: Romeo And Lola K.
bento.review:
There is nothing special about this place. The food is fine but really nothing I couldn't live without. The sushi is probably what I would buy again if I had to; the bento boxes are alright. Sure the food is fresh but my mouth was not "wowed."  

With all the other options in the Ferry Building I doubt I will end up here again.

excerpts: Never had the bento boxes or the sushi rolls (pricey), but the brown rice ball with salmon is delicious.
Roast beef sushi is also good, as are the chicken dumplings.
bento.author: Amy N.
bento.review:
3.5, but erring on the side of 4 because they have onigiri!

Delica's great for a nice light lunch.  Never had the bento boxes or the sushi rolls (pricey), but the brown rice ball with salmon is delicious.  Roast beef sushi is also good, as are the chicken dumplings.  There's a fried potato/shrimp thing that would be better served hot, but refrigerated it's just OK.  

It's hard not to want to try everything, but it is possible to eat cheap if you're not that hungry.  Example: get the burdock salad (light and refreshing) with a rice ball (or two or three or four... but then it's not so cheap).

I can't recommend their beef curry over rice, though.  It's good, bit tastes like it's made with those store-bought roux blocks.  Save your money and make it at home.

excerpts: you can pick bento style lunch boxes: rice, a protein and a veg.
or you can pick and choose a-la carte.
seaweed-spinach salad and tofu in a miso glaze is my fav!
bento.author: Lorraine T.
bento.review:
LOVE this place!

i was taken here by a friend for a work lunch and now i take friends that come visit me during work lunches as well! 

fast, simple, easy and tasty! what more can you ask for? authentic japanese food is done to perfection here. Lunch goes for $9-$12, a lil more pricey for lunch but it's a nice treat once and a while.

you can pick bento style lunch boxes: rice, a protein and a veg. or you can pick and choose a-la carte. seaweed-spinach salad and tofu in a miso glaze is my fav! good options for vegetarian diners!

lovely views of the bay bridge and treasure island for the out of towners too.

excerpts: The bento box is a little pricy as 8-11 dollers but still much much better than random Japanese places in the city.
We don't have to pay for tips, just buy one bento box and sit down outside of Ferry Building.
bento.author: Yoko S.
bento.review:
My favorite lunch place in SF.
Derica rf-1 is operated by a Japanese department store and has been reputable for quality in Japan. The bento box is a little pricy as 8-11 dollers but still much much better than random Japanese places in the city. We don't have to pay for tips, just buy one bento box and sit down outside of Ferry Building. The view is even gorgeous. 

My favorite is chicken pate and 2 salad plate. Yummy.

excerpts: Until I discovered their Bento Boxes and their roast beef nigiri... imagine a succelent thick slice of Niman Ranch roast beef over sushi rice with wasabi topped with coarse salt...
bento.author: BroSauce J.
bento.review:
I used to think this place was a pretentiously lame... you know...  "Japanese Delicatessen." Wha?? 

Until I discovered their Bento Boxes and their roast beef nigiri... imagine a succelent thick slice of Niman Ranch roast beef over sushi rice with wasabi topped with coarse salt... it's like a heartier sushi... 

They have unique little fried concoctions like the dungeness crab croquettes - made with acme breadcrumbs and cowgirl creamery cheese - and the shrimp and veggie "nests." 

Most importantly, they are super-sustainable and devoted to using local ingredients. Their parent company, Rock Field (hence the rf) is a very green Japanese company, so I don't mind paying a little extra for organic Japanese goodness! 

I'm glad this unique little place is doing well.

excerpts: We enjoyed Delica's bento.
In my opinion, any visit to the Ferry Building warrants a visit here.
bento.author: Barry A.
bento.review:
Good food, good quality.
The Hijiki reminds me of sitting in Granny and Gramps' dining room in Kaimuki, eating chazuke and other tsukemono.
Sometimes even just a hint at easier times is all you need to become a fan.  Nostalgia is very important to me.
We enjoyed Delica's bento.
In my opinion, any visit to the Ferry Building warrants a visit here.

excerpts: However, if you're looking for a quick line, I suggest having cash at hand to fork it over to the guy in the front of the store passing out bento boxes.
bento.author: Renee Y.
bento.review:
Visiting this place during the summer season was quite an expedition as hoards of people congregate to the Ferry Building to sample fine wine and cheeses from the myriad of other stores.

Upon first arrival you come across two separate lines, one which is for Hot/Deli Items and the other for Boxed Items.  However, if you're looking for a quick line, I suggest having cash at hand to fork it over to the guy in the front of the store passing out bento boxes.

The relatively long wait during the lunch hours are worth it as the Roast Beef Sushi is excellent in presentation and taste.  Many people have the misconception that sushi has to be fish, which they would be promptly corrected.  Sushi, literally translated, just means rice vinegar--denoting that if you put it on top of rice, it's sushi. But I digress.

I always enjoy getting the Number 4 combo at the Deli which includes one Hot Item, Rice and one Salad.  With a wide variety of vegetarian items, the Chinese Chicken Salad, Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad, and Spicy Burdock Root Salad are good choices.  However, I would love to try the Corn and Mascarpone Salad.

As far as the curry and fried items, the beef curry wasn't anything too special, as I could easily attain this from any other place in Japantown.  Also, the Kakiage Tempura was what seemed like a "hot mess" as it is filled with pretty much anything in my fridge currently, but not much can be said about things that people say are "authentic" to Japanese cuisine.

The food here, though, is fairly cheap, fairly tasty, and of good quality for the Ferry Building, and because of it, I continue to come back, as most other places in and around Market charge you an arm and a leg for good food.

excerpts: At Delica rf-1, I ordered a bento box and asked the man behind the counter to surprise me.
He chose rice, seaweed salad, mushroom salad and a crab and cheese croquette.
My friend got the same seaweed salad, I think a lotus root salad and the tofu steak.
bento.author: Sarah R.
bento.review:
I came here with a friend who was visiting from Indiana. I work in the city but a little too far from the Ferry Building to visit with any regularity. I'm not a tourist hating elitist , so I actually feel like it's kind of a treat to go there when someone is in town (but that's fodder for another review) and I don't mind spending a little extra money to try something new.

At Delica rf-1, I ordered a bento box and asked the man behind the counter to surprise me. He chose rice, seaweed salad, mushroom salad and a crab and cheese croquette. My friend got the same seaweed salad, I think a lotus root salad and the tofu steak. We saw some people eating tempura; it looked delicious, so we went back and got some of that, too.

With the exception of the tempura (it looked a lot yummier than it actually was.), the food was all quite tasty. I got the feeling it was pretty healthy, too. But, that was just a feeling. What do I know? Not much, that's for sure! Also, it was filling. And, that's pretty important to a girl like me!

I noticed that some people complained in their reviews that the food at Delica-rf1 is expensive. It's definitely not a place I could afford to eat at every day, but I tend to think it's unique enough that it doesn't warrant everyday eating.

If you want a dollar menu, go to McDonalds. If you want to try something a little different, check out Delica-rf-1.

excerpts: I used to always get the bento boxes.
My favorite was the vegetarian ma po tofu and the wasabi potato salad.
This place is a little expensive and I usually left a little hungry but everything tastes so good that I almost don't care.
bento.author: Brent G.
bento.review: When I used to work in the Embarcadero Centers, I loved coming here.  I used to always get the bento boxes.  My favorite was the vegetarian ma po tofu and the wasabi potato salad.  This place is a little expensive and I usually left a little hungry but everything tastes so good that I almost don't care.

excerpts: I usually get the bento box - i love all the salads, wasabe potatoes, everything!
bento.author: Spoon G.
bento.review:
If I worked close to Delica I would eat here for lunch every day.  

The food at Delica is delicious. I have eaten here with very discerning Asian friends who love this place as much as I do. The food is fresh, delicious, perfectly cooked and presented, and healthy. No wonder Japanese live such long lives, their food is wonderfully balanced and nutritious.

I usually get the bento box - i love all the salads, wasabe potatoes, everything!

excerpts: , I was a bit confused (do I grab a pre-prepared bento or do I order one?
where are the drinks?) and the cashier was anything but helpful.
A smile and a "can I help you?
" would have made this a 5 star instead of 4.
But it was so good
, I'll be back.
bento.author: Noor A.
bento.review: I went here last weekend for the first time.  I love the concept and the food was excellent.  It was a bit pricey but the view and the sleek, modern interior made up for it.  Their service was pretty bad, though.  Being that it was the first time I had ever been there, I was a bit confused (do I grab a pre-prepared bento or do I order one? where are the drinks?) and the cashier was anything but helpful.  A smile and a "can I help you?" would have made this a 5 star instead of 4.  But it was so good, I'll be back.

excerpts: it's like bento boxed lunch heaven.
just love the care and presentation of the food and the boxes.
it's just great, and the food looks so fresh and tasty as well.
had the tonkatsu, just something simple and tasty.
also had the green tea drink to go.
bento.author: Joel G.
bento.review:
pros... love it here, reminded me of a trip to a japanese super market, but a good one of course.  it's like bento boxed lunch heaven.  just love the care and presentation of the food and the boxes.  it's just great, and the food looks so fresh and tasty as well.  had the tonkatsu, just something simple and tasty. also had the green tea drink to go.  all good.

cons... wish we had something like this in san diego.  a bit on the high side for prices.  but the food, i believe is worth it.

excerpts: This place is great for bento boxes, but if you want a discount with the same quality, go to Nijiya Market in J-town.
bento.author: Jenny K.
bento.review:
Upscale, fast Japanese.  The food is good but the prices come at a premium.  I definitely like the interesting combos they think up, like wasabi edamame potato salad.  The tempura is yummy and if I recall, made with organic veggies.

This place is great for bento boxes, but if you want a discount with the same quality, go to Nijiya Market in J-town.

excerpts: Had the 5 item bento, and really loved the potato salad and chicken dumpling.
I learned that they also have dinner now.
Will definitely come back for dinner.
I just love this place!!
bento.author: Michael-Paggy W.
bento.review: I love this place! You taste quality in each bite! Had the 5 item bento, and really loved the potato salad and chicken dumpling. I learned that they also have dinner now. Will definitely come back for dinner. I just love this place!!

excerpts:
The ground radish on top was a nice touch
 - Sweet chicken bento box: Filled with veggies and only 3 pieces of chicken, it would not be enough alone
bento.author: Matt K.
bento.review:
This was the only place on Monday during lunch hour that didn't have a huge line so my friends and I decided to go here. I would say that the food is pretty good but expensive.

What I ordered:
 - Rice triangle thingy: Edamame, some other stuff, rice, seaweed...actually quite nice and light.
 - Roast beef sushi: YUM, this was good. The ground radish on top was a nice touch
 - Sweet chicken bento box: Filled with veggies and only 3 pieces of chicken, it would not be enough alone

My other friends got some of the other items but I didn't really try it. The consensus was that it was very expensive for what you get, my order was over $15. There are definitely better values in the city, but if you are in the Ferry building craving Japanese food, Delica it is.

excerpts: Bento with seaweed and crabcakes, enjoyed with compostable chopsticks, sitting overlooking the bay, in the company of my favorite young poet.
Good food, healthy food, lovely weather, great company.
Delica can't claim credit for all of that, but I'll give it 5 stars anyway, because it was a 5-star lunch for me
bento.author: Joe C.
bento.review: Bento with seaweed and crabcakes, enjoyed with compostable chopsticks, sitting overlooking the bay, in the company of my favorite young poet.   Good food, healthy food, lovely weather, great company.  Delica can't claim credit for all of that, but I'll give it 5 stars anyway, because it was a 5-star lunch for me :)

excerpts: im not a fan of bento boxes, too many compartments and too complicated.
the bentos here are definitely some of the better one's you'll see around.
very fresh and unique selections.
bento.author: helen l.
bento.review:
wandering thru the ferry building on a weekday afternoon w/the mr is always enjoyable. on this particular day, i was ready to slab a baguette with butter and call it lunch. mr x mandated i have some "real" food so i begrudgingly approached delica. im not a fan of bento boxes, too many compartments and too complicated. the bentos here are definitely some of the better one's you'll see around. very fresh and unique selections. the deli case had so many interesting and pretty items i decided to sacrifice my carbs and butter and give them a shot. 

i nibbled on some chicken pieces, age-dashi tofu steak, tofu salad, and the wasabi potato salad. all delicious...not overly flavored just the way japanese cuisine should be. and service was top-notch with the guy behind the counter patiently waiting while i spent a good five minutes walking back and forth deciding what to get and if i should really settle for healthy fare instead of my beloved acme bread. total came to around $10...which is not bad at all for what you get. i'm definitely adding delica to my list of favorites!

excerpts: i will gladly pay you on tuesday for a bento box today...
bento.author: Jessie J.
bento.review:
i will gladly pay you on tuesday for a bento box today...

jesus h.christ this place is delicious.  i think we spent $47.00 on the most amazing dumpling i've ever eaten and a hot tea.  i don't care, if i'm ever homeless i will seriously panhandle outside the ferry building for three days just for one of those fucking dumplings.  

but can whitey get a fork and not be forced to steal one from the mexican restaurant?

excerpts: There are about 4-5 salad selections (my faves:  hijiki salad and green bean/sesame salad) and 4-5 fried food selections you can get individually or in a multi-item bento box.
Also, they have items like curry and soba that don't quite fall in the "sohzai" category.
The cold dishes are healthy and are pretty much vegetarian.
The hot dishes are fried and meaty
(I haven't tried the potato croquet, but traditionally those have ground meat in them so if you're veg, ask first.).
I think the food is pretty tasty, but definitely not make-a-special-trip-to-Ferry-Building or call-my-Mom-and-tell-her-I-found-a-replacement
-cook good.
I also have a beef (and not delicious rare beef sushi) with the fact that they count rice as an "item" in the bento.
Apparently, one of Delica's twists on Japanese is not getting the math right.
That's like a BBQ joint saying a three-way is chicken, ribs, and bread.
Or Panda Express telling you that a two-item plate is orange chicken and rice.
In Japan, rice ain't an "item."
It's a blank,
bento.author: maiko h.
bento.review:
Look, I apologize in advance that this will be an annoying review.  Maybe not the most annoying ever, but I'll be pushing it.  I can't help it.  Here is the usual caveat:  My family is from Japan so I am compelled to measure Japanese places, however it is spun (I dunno, is fusionified a word?), with my extremely fine-tuned and calibrated meterstick.  Oh no no, I don't even use a yardstick to measure Japanese food.  It's gotta be metric.  

But I must include an additional caveat that I studied postmodern critical theory.  So, really, instead of reading this review, I think you ought to read Roland Barthes's "Empire of Signs"--his excellent mini-book about his trip to Japan--especially the chapter on Japanese food.  He can talk about signs and signifier/signified mumbo jumbo better than I, in a poetic, poignant writing style to boot.  This place really makes me think of all that crap I had to read and spew out in 20 page term papers.

Delica bills itself as a sohzai/okazu-ya, a prepared food deli selling hot and cold Japanese dishes.  There are about 4-5 salad selections (my faves:  hijiki salad and green bean/sesame salad) and 4-5 fried food selections you can get individually or in a multi-item bento box.  Also, they have items like curry and soba that don't quite fall in the "sohzai" category.  The cold dishes are healthy and are pretty much vegetarian.  The hot dishes are fried and meaty (I haven't tried the potato croquet, but traditionally those have ground meat in them so if you're veg, ask first.).  I think the food is pretty tasty, but definitely not make-a-special-trip-to-Ferry-Building or call-my-Mom-and-tell-her-I-found-a-replacement-cook good.  I also have a beef (and not delicious rare beef sushi) with the fact that they count rice as an "item" in the bento.  Apparently, one of Delica's twists on Japanese is not getting the math right.  That's like a BBQ joint saying a three-way is chicken, ribs, and bread.  Or Panda Express telling you that a two-item plate is orange chicken and rice.  In Japan, rice ain't an "item."  It's a blank, if you will, to cleanse palates, catch dripping sauces, and dilute strongly flavored foods.

I think what makes me feel really "whatever" about this place is that it's wishy washy in whether it wants to be a haute fusion fast food joint or to be as true-to-form sohzai-ya as one can be in the Ferry Building.  I would embrace either extreme in its fully fledged form, but for now, I wonder why a kakiage (bits-n-pieces tempura) is cylindrical instead of flat and round.  Or why they put daizu (mature soy beans) AND edamame (young soy beans) in the hijiki salad.  Meaning, the twist they put on the original version doesn't elicit an "aha!" reaction, in that it's not functional to the actual flavor.  If they're gonna be half-assed about coming up with their own version of Japanese classics, why not go authentic and show everyone a new facet of the cuisine that's not sushi or ramen or teppan-yaki?

So yes, it's annoying that I am not really critiquing the food or the service, but the concept of the restaurant.  But what can I do?  I gotta do something with my college education.

excerpts: wonderfully filling and delish bento boxes!  a bit pricey for what you get compared to LA prices, but still tasty and worth the experience.
bento.author: Janice M.
bento.review: wonderfully filling and delish bento boxes!  a bit pricey for what you get compared to LA prices, but still tasty and worth the experience.

excerpts: You get to choose from a couple of bento plates that are pre-packaged, but fresh off the oven or fryer or broiler...

I ended up having one of these bento plates with fried shrimp cakes, organic asparagus with sesame dressing, some sorta noodle thing, and rice...although it was very tasty and delicious the price was kinda on the steep side for a small little bento dish, nevertheless still worth it...
I want to try out their chicken dumpling next time, which looked pretty tasty as well
and i'm sure it is...very cool place to check out
bento.author: murs.one ..
bento.review: When you walk into this place everything seems to be methodically in place and organized not to mention impeccably clean. You get to choose from a couple of bento plates that are pre-packaged, but fresh off the oven or fryer or broiler...I ended up having one of these bento plates with fried shrimp cakes, organic asparagus with sesame dressing, some sorta noodle thing, and rice...although it was very tasty and delicious the price was kinda on the steep side for a small little bento dish, nevertheless still worth it...I want to try out their chicken dumpling next time, which looked pretty tasty as well and i'm sure it is...very cool place to check out

excerpts: The 9 compartment bento filled with well prepared veggie were pretty good.
I am not a heavy veggie eater too!
bento.author: S.K. Y.
bento.review: Killer shrimp cake. They have some elegantly prepared food that taste very good and health. The 9 compartment bento filled with well prepared veggie were pretty good. I am not a heavy veggie eater too!

excerpts: I ended up getting a bento box from the glass case.
It was just okay.
I was definitely expecting better.
No plans to return.
bento.author: Erin L.
bento.review: This place looked promising.  I was a bit intimidated and confused on the menu and the glass case, and not quite sure how to order.  I ended up getting a bento box from the glass case.  It was just okay.  I was definitely expecting better.  No plans to return.

excerpts: refreshing small bites, healthy, and tasty.  go for the seasonal bento and you'll be hooked.
oh yeah, the crazy looking tempura
bento.author: Rob C.
bento.review:
straight from japan and quite successful
so good, wish i could add it to my lunch rotation.  refreshing small bites, healthy, and tasty.  go for the seasonal bento and you'll be hooked.  oh yeah, the crazy looking tempura thingie is a bit soggy rather than crispy

bentos really good, try the one with the chicken meatball
interesting potato, lima bean, wasabi
also good veges, just a solid place

excerpts: After working nearby for near 3 years, I finally got around to trying out the Vegetarian Bento Box.
It was tasty and there were a plethora of interesting flavors in the various small sides that made up the box.
I would have loved a bit of rice with my veggies, though.
If they'd included that and dropped the price of the box $2, I would easily have thrown them another star.
bento.author: Milk and Cheese ..
bento.review: After working nearby for near 3 years, I finally got around to trying out the Vegetarian Bento Box. It was tasty and there were a plethora of interesting flavors in the various small sides that made up the box. I would have loved a bit of rice with my veggies, though. If they'd included that and dropped the price of the box $2, I would easily have thrown them another star.

excerpts: Still like the Bento Boxes they offer, while still overpriced for the amount of food you're getting, but it's the city
so that's part of the deal.
I wouldn't recommend it if you're hungry at lunch time since it will not fill your appetite.
It's ok but use to be much better in the past.
bento.author: Neil K.
bento.review: We use to go to this place all the time when we were done with the Farmers Market.  But recently, we found the food and service has declined.  Still like the Bento Boxes they offer, while still overpriced for the amount of food you're getting, but it's the city so that's part of the deal.  I wouldn't recommend it if you're hungry at lunch time since it will not fill your appetite.  It's ok but use to be much better in the past.

excerpts: I like the casual atmosphere and the extensive display of salads, rolls and bento boxes.
bento.author: Jen L.
bento.review: I love their roast beef sushi!  Prices here are a little expensive but I am willing to spend out a couple of extra dollars for some good Japanese food.  The mushroom curry has a very sweet distinct taste and like the other reviewers, it reminds me of food that I could buy in a  department store.   I like the casual atmosphere and the extensive display of salads, rolls and bento boxes.

excerpts: The bento box idea allows you to combine different side dishes and main entrees together.
bento.author: Mandy C.
bento.review: I LOVE THIS PLACE!  i love the causal ambiance... fusion style... light and healthy food.  The bento box idea allows you to combine different side dishes and main entrees together.

excerpts: i had the bento box today.  for $9.50 you get rice, green bean sesame salad, seaweed salad, and a fried shrimp cake.
they are expensive but they are good.
what i like most is their beef curry.
i love japanese curry and i haven't found a place that serves japanese curry!
unless i'm not looking at the right places.
anyways, the bento box looks small but it was filling.
the shrimp cake alone is $3.75.
it does have shrimp in it!
the seaweed salad comes with edamame, fried tofu, and these reddish orange fruits.
the green bean salad is refreshing.
next on my list to try:  eggplant salad, roast beef sushi, and baked summer peach with custard!
all of their food looks fresh and healthly!
must try if you are near the ferry marketplace!
yum!
bento.author: D W.
bento.review: Yummy!  i love this place.  it's a japanese deli.  they offer salads, fried stuff, and expensive green and fruit teas.  i had the bento box today.  for $9.50 you get rice, green bean sesame salad, seaweed salad, and a fried shrimp cake.  they are expensive but they are good.  what i like most is their beef curry.  i love japanese curry and i haven't found a place that serves japanese curry!  unless i'm not looking at the right places.  anyways, the bento box looks small but it was filling.  the shrimp cake alone is $3.75.  it does have shrimp in it!  the seaweed salad comes with edamame, fried tofu, and these reddish orange fruits.  the green bean salad is refreshing.  next on my list to try:  eggplant salad, roast beef sushi, and baked summer peach with custard! all of their food looks fresh and healthly!   must try if you are near the ferry marketplace!  yum!

excerpts: I loved the potato croquettes, the meatballs, the egg and beef over rice, and the bento boxes.
The ingredients were always fresh, and the food was always so neatly presented.
Love the shops in the Ferry Building in general, and definitely love Delica!
bento.author: Rose W.
bento.review: Delica, in the Ferry Building, was my favorite lunch spot downtown.  I loved the potato croquettes, the meatballs, the egg and beef over rice, and the bento boxes.  The ingredients were always fresh, and the food was always so neatly presented.  Love the shops in the Ferry Building in general, and definitely love Delica!

excerpts: This place is always packed so the pre-packed Bento Boxes are a great idea.
He even rounded the prices down to an even 10 and 12 dollars so that the money exchange can go faster.

Kudos to you Yasuhiro !
See a short video of the place @ http://sf-lunch.com/2008/04/04/bite-byte-delica-rf-1-%e2%80%93-japanese-delicatessen/
bento.author: SF Luncher z.
bento.review:
While walking to a meeting in the Ferry Building, I noticed Yasuhiro Iwata was setting up a table outside of his restaurant. He told me that he was setting it up to prepare for the coming tourist season and that he wanted to serve his regular customers...
This place is always packed so the pre-packed Bento Boxes are a great idea. He even rounded the prices down to an even 10 and 12 dollars so that the money exchange can go faster. Kudos to you Yasuhiro !
See a short video of the place @ http://sf-lunch.com/2008/04/04/bite-byte-delica-rf-1-%e2%80%93-japanese-delicatessen/

excerpts: so I took a second to get a lay of the land, perused the deli counter and the bento boxes and decided a sampler plate would be best.
I scooped up a bento with a creamy crab croquette, white rice, asparagus salad with a sesame dressing and hijiki and soybean salad.
I then went to the counter to custom create a lunch plate #1 with a choice of one entree and two salads.
I picked the tofu and chicken hijiki patty, mushroom salad and a wonderfully aromatic and zesty burdock and lotus root salad.
Everything was perfectly prepared, not over-dressed and the proportions were nice.
The flavors were especially clean and most had a light "tang" that was a nice contract to the rice and fried croquette.
With a bottle of green tea, my total came to just over $22.
I recommend getting the lunch plates or bento boxes because some of the salads were costly, upwards of $15.00 a lb.
and since they are dressed, the ounces can add up.
My favorites were the hijiki salad and tofu and chicken hijiki patty - didn't really care for the creamy texture to the croquette but of course I ate it anyway.
bento.author: Michele B.
bento.review:
Coming to San Fran for a spur of the moment get away with the bf (and to check out the madness that is B2B), we ducked in here after getting some beautiful morning photos of the bay bridge and the hub-bub and hustle of the market outside. There were plenty of options but with a name like Delica rf-1, it's pretty unique and stirred the memory senses of my yelp browsing from yester years. I was a little overwhelmed by the know-how of the regulars and where to stand to order what and such so I took a second to get a lay of the land, perused the deli counter and the bento boxes and decided a sampler plate would be best. I scooped up a bento with a creamy crab croquette, white rice, asparagus salad with a sesame dressing and hijiki and soybean salad. I then went to the counter to custom create a lunch plate #1 with a choice of one entree and two salads.  I picked the tofu and chicken hijiki patty, mushroom salad and a wonderfully aromatic and zesty burdock and lotus root salad. Everything was perfectly prepared, not over-dressed and the proportions were nice. The flavors were especially clean and most had a light "tang" that was a nice contract to the rice and fried croquette. With a bottle of green tea, my total came to just over $22. I recommend getting the lunch plates or bento boxes because some of the salads were costly, upwards of $15.00 a lb. and since they are dressed, the ounces can add up.  My favorites were the hijiki salad and tofu and chicken hijiki patty - didn't really care for the creamy texture to the croquette but of course I ate it anyway. Over-all: 
DELISH DELICA!

****sidenote**** 
You can request to taste anything before you buy. They really DO NOT mind. In fact, they encourage it.

excerpts: The bento boxes look like little works of art.
Grab a couple of those and sit out by the water and have a little picnic.
Don't forget to invite me!
bento.author: happy t.
bento.review: Expensive, yes.  But so yummy!  Whenever I visit the Ferry Building, I stop by Delica to have a little snack.  I love getting little bites of a variety of things...even their tonkatsu tastes extra yummy.  The bento boxes look like little works of art.  Grab a couple of those and sit out by the water and have a little picnic.  Don't forget to invite me!

excerpts: lots of goodies to fill the bento box.
bento.author: Ligaya T.
bento.review:
panko-fantastique! best croquettes in SF thus far. very pleasing, delicate flavored cold salads: green beans with sesame dressing, hijiki and soybean salad, potato wasabi mash. yum. lots of goodies to fill the bento box. the chicken chili dumplings were tasty, too.

while i would rather go eat oysters at the ferry bldg, delica is a nice change. they have my favorite jasmine tea as well! oh and they're clean and decor is simple, nothing extravagant, but fitting. i'll be back to try the curry!

excerpts: How could anybody beat their 5 item Bento box for $9.75?
I would've expected this place to cost more than your regular lunch take-out spots, since it's located inside the Ferry Building too.
All of their salads are outta of the world, especially the spicy burdock roots salad and chinese chicken salad.
My favorite dish from here will definitely be the tofu chicken patty topped off with shaved daikon.
All I gotta say this place is a bargain and they have the best selection of non-traditional Japanese food.
Did I mention the food they served are totally healthy?
