Even their fried items aren't greasy and oily at all.
bento.author: KC K.
bento.review: Delica totally rocks my taste buds with their Californian influenced Japanese food.  This place is really cheap compared to the Westfield Food Emporium's Mr.Hana ( My thoughts of Mr.Hana are nasty overpriced unauthentic Japanese food wannabe).  How could anybody beat their 5 item Bento box for $9.75?  I would've expected this place to cost more than your regular lunch take-out spots, since it's located inside the Ferry Building too.  All of their salads are outta of the world, especially the spicy burdock roots salad and chinese chicken salad.  My favorite dish from here will definitely be the tofu chicken patty topped off with shaved daikon.  All I gotta say this place is a bargain and they have the best selection of non-traditional Japanese food.  Did I mention the food they served are totally healthy? Even their fried items aren't greasy and oily at all.

excerpts: I'm not sure how many places can make seaweed and tofu taste so delicious, so cheers to Delica rf-1 for creating such wonderful salads and bento boxes.
They get extra bonus stars for figuring out a way to incorporate California's seasonal ingredients into Japanese cuisine.
One star deduction because sometimes the seaweed gives me a momentary feeling of ickiness.
bento.author: Heather F.
bento.review: There's just something about eating seaweed and tofu that makes me feel all healthy and virtuous, so I go to Delica rf-1 at least once a week to get my fix. I'm not sure how many places can make seaweed and tofu taste so delicious, so cheers to Delica rf-1 for creating such wonderful salads and bento boxes. They get extra bonus stars for figuring out a way to incorporate California's seasonal ingredients into Japanese cuisine. One star deduction because sometimes the seaweed gives me a momentary feeling of ickiness.

excerpts: Got a bento box with four different things.
Deep fried scallops, shrimp cake, a ground chicken patty with tofu and some vegetables.
The scallops were juicy and the chicken patty was deliciously well seasoned.
My meal was definitely satisfying!
bento.author: Juliane N.
bento.review: Working at the Ferry Building, I try to eat something other then the food that is served at the restaurant I work at. (not that it's not good, I just get tired of eating Vietnamese food all the time) So I  went to grab some food here. Got a bento box with four different things. Deep fried scallops, shrimp cake, a ground chicken patty with tofu and some vegetables. The scallops were juicy and the chicken patty was deliciously well seasoned. My meal was definitely satisfying!

excerpts: I got a bento box with many different things including my favorite - wasabi potato salad.
Everything in that box was amazing - great flavors and incredibly fresh.
The people working the registers are very friendly and there are many choices of yummy food for fairly cheap.
Next time I am at Farmers market, I am definitely stopping there for a snack.
bento.author: Maria V.
bento.review: We went to the Ferry building to get something to eat after the Pride Parade and ended up at DELICA rf-1. I got a bento box with many different things including my favorite - wasabi potato salad. Everything in that box was amazing - great flavors and incredibly fresh. The people working the registers are very friendly and there are many choices of yummy food for fairly cheap. Next time I am at Farmers market, I am definitely stopping there for a snack.

excerpts: japanese bento boxes / deli food.
exactly what my hub was craving for!

we shared a:
-- bento box w/ spicy fried chicken, eggplant side, a green bean w/ mayo side, & rice.
sides complimented the main entree well.

we also ordered:
--  1 crab cream croquette (hub didn't care for this.

another simple pleasure in life............

its a bit pricey -- $9.50 for a bento box.
bento.author: Cindi N.
bento.review:
came here by chance while checking out the ferry building's farmer's market.  absolute perfect place to come after shopping around & sampling @ the farmer's market.  

japanese bento boxes / deli food.   exactly what my hub was craving for!    
we shared a:
-- bento box w/ spicy fried chicken, eggplant side, a green bean w/ mayo side, & rice.  sides complimented the main entree well.  
we also ordered:
--  1 crab cream croquette (hub didn't care for this.  i thought it was good -- but feels bad -- very rich, creamy & fried on top of that)
-- 1 shrimp & veggie tempura nest tower -- good, but bet it would've tasted so much better right off the fryer.      

we took it to go & sat on one of the benches off the side of the ferry building overlooking the bay.  it was a gorgeous, warm sunny summer day w/ a slight breeze.  another simple pleasure in life............

its a bit pricey -- $9.50 for a bento box.  but good to treat ourselves to once in awhile.........

excerpts: I usually get the chicken bento box with the Japanese seaweed salad, which goes for about 9 bucks.
It's a little pricey
so I only go here occasionally
but it's a real treat when I go.
bento.author: Stephen G.
bento.review: One of the best lunch places in the financial district.  The food is freshly made, tastes delicious, and isn't overwhelming.  I usually get the chicken bento box with the Japanese seaweed salad, which goes for about 9 bucks.  It's a little pricey so I only go here occasionally but it's a real treat when I go.

excerpts: The Summer Bento Box is amazing and the perfect amount of food.
The fact that a place like Delica exists and thrives here is one of the reasons I love SF!
bento.author: Shan K.
bento.review: I'll echo the I'd-eat-here-every-day-if-I-could sentiment.  Yummy, healthy, super-fresh and interesting food.   The Summer Bento Box is amazing and the perfect amount of food.  The fact that a place like Delica exists and thrives here is one of the reasons I love SF!

excerpts: Delicious (and nutritious) bento boxes which remind me of my time in Japan
bento.author: S. B.
bento.review:
A great place to catch a quick lunch. Delicious (and nutritious) bento boxes which remind me of my time in Japan ^_^. 

They use fresh ingredients and have great (authentic) selections. I try to go whenever I can!

excerpts: Pre-prepared Bento boxes, squid salads, etc.
In the Ferry building, so great view and atmosphere.
Try the Karokke, the Japanese version (in tyical fashion they have improved matters by both adapting and mispronouncing the original) of a Croquette.
Prices a little high under the circumstances.
bento.author: Gil S.
bento.review: First local (and perhaps first USA) outlet of a well-known chain of Japanese take-out delis.  Impeccable quality and presentation, and homesick Japanese and Hawaiians can have a field day here.  Pre-prepared Bento boxes, squid salads, etc.  In the Ferry building, so great view and atmosphere.  Try the Karokke, the Japanese version (in tyical fashion they have improved matters by both adapting and mispronouncing the original) of a Croquette.  Prices a little high under the circumstances.

excerpts: Recommend the chicken-tofu patty, the fried chicken pieces (3 per order), the Chicken Dumplings and the many salads and bento boxes.
Feels like I am the prepared foods section of a high-end Tokyo department store -- you who have been there know what I mean.
Like Harrods only great-tasting and with endless choices.
That's my Delica!
bento.author: Xander S.
bento.review: Love love love love this Ferry Building take-out eatery.  The flavors are exquisite.  Balanced and consistent yet a delight for the tastebuds.  Recommend the chicken-tofu patty, the fried chicken pieces (3 per order), the Chicken Dumplings and the many salads and bento boxes.  Feels like I am the prepared foods section of a high-end Tokyo department store -- you who have been there know what I mean.  Like Harrods only great-tasting and with endless choices.  That's my Delica!

excerpts: and she had the bento box which looked just as good.
i'll go for that next time... and there will be many next times.
this is quite possibly the best financial district lunch i've ever had.
bento.author: Steven C.
bento.review:
umm... wow.  why have i not eaten here until today.

$7.75 for the regular portion of eggplant curry (which is dynamite, $9.75 for the large) and pair it with a $2.00 corn and potato croquette and a $2.00 (unnecessary price gouging, but i knew it would fit the meal) ito en oi ocha green tea (engrish m*&$%#$%@, do you speak it?!) and you have yourself a KILLER tuesday lunch.

it's the good japanese curry, even though it's eggplant, it's nice and starchy and complete with little meat chunks so you'll feel super guilty and have to hit the gym right after work.  the croquette, fried to perfection.  not to oily and delightfully crisp. you're at mixt greens three out of five days of the week anyway.  you might as well throw some carbs and fried goodies in to your diet. 

the gf and i met up for lunch and she had the bento box which looked just as good.  i'll go for that next time... and there will be many next times.  this is quite possibly the best financial district lunch i've ever had.

excerpts: But so good - freshness, flavor, and for Japanese bento, stunningly authentic, everything as I remembered it!
The vegetable mixes (hijiki, konnyaku, etc.) are a highlight, and the fried stuff (including croquette) is great.
bento.author: Josh L.
bento.review:
For everyday lunch, pricey. 

But so good - freshness, flavor, and for Japanese bento, stunningly authentic, everything as I remembered it! The vegetable mixes (hijiki, konnyaku, etc.) are a highlight, and the fried stuff (including croquette) is great. They have several small a la carte items too, including a beef sushi which I'll have to try soon...

I have to mention the space - the large open kitchen, high ceiling, clean lines comprised of wood, glass and steel, make it a comfortable place for you to choose your food. Thanks for bringing me, Uni!

excerpts: $10 for a bento box might seem steep (not including a bottle of green tea), but I think it's worth it.
Usually grab some ohashi and eat outside by the bay.
Favorites are the chicken balls and the wasabi mashed potatoes...although I've never eaten anything here I don't like.
bento.author: Mi M.
bento.review: I come here for lunch at least once a week. $10 for a bento box might seem steep (not including a bottle of green tea), but I think it's worth it. Usually grab some ohashi and eat outside by the bay. Favorites are the chicken balls and the wasabi mashed potatoes...although I've never eaten anything here I don't like.

excerpts: Their bento boxes let you pick out 1 entree and 2 salads
and it's actually enough food.
Plenty of vegetarian and vegan options
and they let you know which one is vegan and which isn't.
They are a honest, healthy, great tasting restaurant.
I would come back again and again.
bento.author: AhLin C.
bento.review: I love it here.  It's fresh, light and they give you the vitamins/nutrients found in their food.  Doesn't get better than that.  $10 for a lunch may seem expensive, but to eat healthy, it's not that expensive.  Their bento boxes let you pick out 1 entree and 2 salads and it's actually enough food.  Plenty of vegetarian and vegan options and they let you know which one is vegan and which isn't.  They are a honest, healthy, great tasting restaurant.  I would come back again and again.

excerpts: Great bento boxes.
So great I had to quit going because I was afraid I had a bento box addiction.
Which made me think about their bento boxes all the time.
I broke down last week, went back and only had one.
Oh well.
bento.author: Mitsi M.
bento.review: Great bento boxes. So great I had to quit going because I was afraid I had a bento box addiction. Which made me think about their bento boxes all the time. I broke down last week, went back and only had one. Oh well.

excerpts: Their bento boxes are pretty good, but their beef curry was tomatoey--
what's up with that?
And it didn't seem that they stewed it long enough, because the beef was pretty tough...
bento.author: Lester L.
bento.review: I wanted to like this place, I really did. Their bento boxes are pretty good, but their beef curry was tomatoey-- what's up with that? And it didn't seem that they stewed it long enough, because the beef was pretty tough...

excerpts: $9.50 for a 4 item bento box of which one item is white rice.
So really, a 3 item bento box.
The wasabi potato salad was ok, the green beans were overpoweringly drenched in some kind of mayonnaise based dressing that was just too much for me to be able to finish.
The chicken cutlet (like tonkatsu only with chicken) was okay.
I will say that their items seemed like they were made with very fresh ingredients.
bento.author: A L.
bento.review: Not sure where all the love is coming from.  Not bad, but very pricey for what you get.  $9.50 for a 4 item bento box of which one item is white rice.  So really, a 3 item bento box.  The wasabi potato salad was ok, the green beans were overpoweringly drenched in some kind of mayonnaise based dressing that was just too much for me to be able to finish.  The chicken cutlet (like tonkatsu only with chicken) was okay.  I will say that their items seemed like they were made with very fresh ingredients.

excerpts: Their bento boxes and salads look good too!
bento.author: Gina R.
bento.review: I think they're fried stuff is delicious because it's not greasy at all and it's actually pretty light. It ain't cheap but I like how it's a snacky kind of food that you can enjoy outside or while you're on the ferry to Sausalito or Larkspur. Their bento boxes and salads look good too!

excerpts: Delica rf1 serves fresh, flavorful, interesting food for a pretty penny - $9 for the lunch combo of one main item and two salads, or $11 for a 9-item bento box filled with sushi, corn salad, wasabi potato salad, shrimp dumplings, and other deliciousness.

I had the summer bento box this afternoon after spending the morning trekking through the city, and although each individual item was small, the combination of flavors and overall volume of the meal was totally satisfying.
The wasabi potato salad, which also appeared to have some edamame mixed in, was my absolute favorite.
The only thing that was a little off was the sushi - but for sushi, I can go elsewhere.
For Japanese salads that are quick, fresh, flavorful, and satisfying, Delica rf1 is it.
bento.author: Rachel B.
bento.review: It's so nice to have Japanese food that isn't dominated by sub-par chicken drenched in overly sweet teriyaki sauce.  Delica rf1 serves fresh, flavorful, interesting food for a pretty penny - $9 for the lunch combo of one main item and two salads, or $11 for a 9-item bento box filled with sushi, corn salad, wasabi potato salad, shrimp dumplings, and other deliciousness.  I had the summer bento box this afternoon after spending the morning trekking through the city, and although each individual item was small, the combination of flavors and overall volume of the meal was totally satisfying.  The wasabi potato salad, which also appeared to have some edamame mixed in, was my absolute favorite.  The only thing that was a little off was the sushi - but for sushi, I can go elsewhere.  For Japanese salads that are quick, fresh, flavorful, and satisfying, Delica rf1 is it.

excerpts: For Delica newbies, go with a bento box, an excellent chance to try several of their offerings in one shot.
The croquette, wasabi potato salad, the chicken/tofu patty...
The bento was 5 for 5 in excellence.
Docked a star for being steep in price.
What's with the cyberpunk anime name anyway?
bento.author: Maximillian M.
bento.review: For Delica newbies, go with a bento box, an excellent chance to try several of their offerings in one shot. The croquette, wasabi potato salad, the chicken/tofu patty... The bento was 5 for 5 in excellence. Docked a star for being steep in price. What's with the cyberpunk anime name anyway?

excerpts: When we got there, I didn't realize there were 2 separate lines - one for bento and one for plated dishes.
So I picked up one of the bento boxes on the table which had 3 or 4 pieces of sweet and spicy chicken, hijiki and soybean salad, and mushroom salad.
My fiance, on the other hand is quite picky and doesn't really eat too many veggies
so he passed on the bento boxes and decided to order fried items by pieces: katsu and sweet and spicy chicken.
I do wish they had more items, not so much for me, but for my fiance and for anyone who is somewhat picky.
But as for my meal and me being not so picky, I really enjoyed the hijiki salad and the sweet and spicy chicken.
The salads were really fresh and had bold flavor.
I also ordered 1 piece of the chicken dumpling which I thought was yummy.
This place would be great for little snacks  to pick up or if you want some flavorful salads and the salads were healthy and fresh to offset the deep fried goodies.
However, my fiance describes this place as a quick fix and nothing more.
bento.author: Allison J.
bento.review: I'm from San Diego and I always stop by the Ferry Building to buy wine and other snacks to take home.  So I thought to kill 2 birds with one stone and eat lunch while shopping here.  All their sit down spots were packed as we went during lunch hour so we thought to just get some "to-go" food and eat it outside and enjoy the beautiful scenery.  When we got there, I didn't realize there were 2 separate lines - one for bento and one for plated dishes.  So I picked up one of the bento boxes on the table which had 3 or 4 pieces of sweet and spicy chicken, hijiki and soybean salad, and mushroom salad.  My fiance, on the other hand is quite picky and doesn't really eat too many veggies so he passed on the bento boxes and decided to order fried items by pieces: katsu and sweet and spicy chicken.  I do wish they had more items, not so much for me, but for my fiance and for anyone who is somewhat picky.  But as for my meal and me being not so picky, I really enjoyed the hijiki salad and the sweet and spicy chicken.  The salads were really fresh and had bold flavor.  I also ordered 1 piece of the chicken dumpling which I thought was yummy.  This place would be great for little snacks  to pick up or if you want some flavorful salads and the salads were healthy and fresh to offset the deep fried goodies.  However, my fiance describes this place as a quick fix and nothing more.

excerpts: I've never had a Bento box before!
Man, that's a lot of food!
I got the 4 item box.
SO GOOD.
The people in there are very friendly and the food is good and you can go right outside and sit on the pier!
What's not to love?
bento.author: Bree W.
bento.review: I've never had a Bento box before!  Man, that's a lot of food!  I got the 4 item box.  SO GOOD.  The people in there are very friendly and the food is good and you can go right outside and sit on the pier!  What's not to love?

excerpts:
while busy at lunch, the line moves fast

Kinda steep at around $10, them bento boxes are pretty solid, I like the beef curry, I can see how it can get plain

Pork cutlet good too although the salad it is served with has some weird greens
bento.author: xo x.
bento.review:
@ The Ferry Bldg so it automatically gets points, while busy at lunch, the line moves fast

Kinda steep at around $10, them bento boxes are pretty solid, I like the beef curry, I can see how it can get plain

Pork cutlet good too although the salad it is served with has some weird greens

excerpts: I ordered a Tonkatsu bento here today, and it was very tender and the meat was brown, the way it should be.
bento.author: Philip T.
bento.review:
I really enjoyed going to lunch here today. Before the review, I am going to say straight-away that I gave this place four stars ONLY because of the lack of seating. 

I ordered a Tonkatsu bento here today, and it was very tender and the meat was brown, the way it should be. 

What impressed me most about this place was the rice: It was just the right texture and tasted like the rice I ate in Japan. The rice can make or break a meal, and it is way too often overlooked. 

In a similar fashion, not all the dishes here are "traditional" to japan, but they are all prepared meticulously and the quality is consistent. 

For a place so good and reasonably priced, its a shame that they don't have many tables to sit down and enjoy a good meal. That may be a fault of the ferry building however.

excerpts: I had one of those pre-made bento boxes.
It had 2 sweet and sour chicken dumpling, a lotus root salad, a mobo tofu salad, and white rice with black sesames on it.
The mobo tofu salad was excellent.
Very flavorful and uniquely asian!
The rest were sadly average.
bento.author: Mindy K.
bento.review: I went to this place for the first time today.  I had one of those pre-made bento boxes.  It had 2 sweet and sour chicken dumpling, a lotus root salad, a mobo tofu salad, and white rice with black sesames on it.  The mobo tofu salad was excellent.  Very flavorful and uniquely asian!  The rest were sadly average.

excerpts: I got the bento box with the tofu salad, tonkatsu, and lotus salad.
An hour later, I started to feel sick and went back to our hotel room.
I was vomiting (among other things) throughout the rest of the trip and our vacation was ruined.
I was pretty upset since this was a vacation we had been planning for a long time.
I'm positive that it was one of the salads through poor food handling and contamination.
bento.author: Grace L.
bento.review:
0 stars.

I GOT FOOD POISONING FROM THIS PLACE!  This past weekend, while vacationing with close friends, we were at the ferry building and casually decided to dine here while walking by.  I got the bento box with the tofu salad, tonkatsu, and lotus salad.  An hour later, I started to feel sick and went back to our hotel room.  I was vomiting (among other things) throughout the rest of the trip and our vacation was ruined.  I was pretty upset since this was a vacation we had been planning for a long time.  I'm positive that it was one of the salads through poor food handling and contamination.  There is no other explanation since my friends didn't get sick (and they had ordered other dishes).

Please don't take your chances and don't order any of the salads/raw food here.  It's SO not worth it.

excerpts: Good bento boxes.
bento.author: hugh k.
bento.review: Good and healthy! The curry rice was kind of kokyu, and I liked the goma spinach salad. Good bento boxes.

excerpts: The bento box lunches are good.
I personally like their potato croquettes and pork katsu.
Yummy!
The service is always very quick, too.
bento.author: Winnie L.
bento.review: This is a great place to get take out lunch if you work downtown.  The bento box lunches are good. I personally like their potato croquettes and pork katsu. Yummy! The service is always very quick, too.

excerpts: -1/2 star for the confusing line setup (custom bento + lunch plates to the left, everything else to the right?
I'm still not sure...) but this rounds up to 5 stars.
bento.author: Vicki M.
bento.review: Loved it!  I went here for lunch over the weekend and had the chinese chicken salad, wasabi potato salad, and sesame green beans.  Lunch for under $8 at the Ferry Building on a weekend is not too bad in my book.  Plus they jam-packed the plate, so by the end of the meal I was totally stuffed.  -1/2 star for the confusing line setup (custom bento + lunch plates to the left, everything else to the right?  I'm still not sure...) but this rounds up to 5 stars.

excerpts: the vegetarian bento box to go - was amazing!!
you have to try it - the potato gratin, noodles, broccoli, tofu, all of it was great.
can't wait to go back just for the bento box!!
bento.author: bhavna p.
bento.review: the vegetarian bento box to go - was amazing!! you have to try it - the potato gratin, noodles, broccoli, tofu, all of it was great. can't wait to go back just for the bento box!!

excerpts: I've ordered the Assorted Sushi Bento via Caviar and I must emphasize that the to-go packaging was so adorable!
The bento was $14, but wasn't nearly as filling!
I have yet to also try the other bento options, so will be back in the near future.
assorted sushi bento.author: Jenny H.
assorted sushi bento.review:
Pretty cool sushi rolls and salads! I've ordered the Assorted Sushi Bento via Caviar and I must emphasize that the to-go packaging was so adorable! I've heard great things about the curry, so it's definitely on my hit list.

Although I appreciate the creativity, I wish they provided larger portions. The bento was $14, but wasn't nearly as filling! I could've finished another box because it was so delicious.

I have yet to also try the other bento options, so will be back in the near future. :)

excerpts: I must say the Assorted Sushi Bento is so cute!
I've been dying to try, there are preset 9 items that can be sushi, salads or small dishes.
I love the idea of just trying a bit of everything.
Everything was delicious and presentation was on
assorted sushi bento.author: Natalie L.
assorted sushi bento.review:
I must say the Assorted Sushi Bento is so cute! I've been dying to try, there are preset 9 items that can be sushi, salads or small dishes. I love the idea of just trying a bit of everything. Everything was delicious and presentation was on it's A game for sure.

I would definitely come back next time to try their sushi rolls and curry!

OH CASH ONLY. Had to walk to the ATM and get cash :D

excerpts: My least favorite was the Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad.
I was expecting it to taste like the sweet potato
wasabi garlic potato salad.author: Junella T.
wasabi garlic potato salad.review:
I'm so torn. I wanted to love this place, but it was only a like for me. I'll def return and try some of their other items on the menu, but I ordered from Caviar and they didn't carry everything. Warning though the portions are small for the price you're paying. I spent $20+ and only received a piece of tofu and a bento box.

Agedashi Tofu Steak - This was my favorite. I've eaten this in a handful of restaurants in different countries and the tentsuyu sauce was very good. It was the right amount of sweet and savory. I ate this cold, which was fine, but I'm not sure if you are supposed to heat it up first. A little pricey at $5 a piece.

Assorted 9-item Sushi Bento - I loved the arrangement of this and the presentation, but I wish I got to pick what went inside my bento box. It was a pre-set amount of things. I loved most of the things in there, but my favorite was the chicken dumpling and the hijiki & soybean. The flavors were great and pretty close to a bento box from the corner store in japan. I love burdock but I wasn't a fan of the way they mixed theirs. The celery in the mix threw the flavors off.  My least favorite was the Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad. I was expecting it to taste like the sweet potato salad that's available in most Japanese grocery stores, but the wasab was overpowering. 

The bento also came with 4 pieces of sushi from a roll.The bento has one piece Salmon, Tuna, 16 grain, and Shrimp & Crab. Besides the raw piece of salmon and tuna on top of the roll, everything inside the roll was cooked. The roll also had pieces of raw red peppers. It threw off the taste completely. If you had to add a veggie, they should have went with takuwan. The only roll that I finished was the 16 grain and I liked that one the most.

excerpts:
I typically get the 4 item bento box:

Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad
wasabi garlic potato salad.author: Tanya C.
wasabi garlic potato salad.review:
Delica is a Japanese deli located in the Ferry Building.  They have pre-packaged and make your own bento boxes.  You can also buy individual items by the piece or weight.

I always get the bento boxes when I go there.  You can choose from 4 ($9.75 - 1 fried, 2 salads, rice), 5 ($9.75 - 3 salads, half shrimp cake, 1 chicken dumpling) or 9 ($11.00 - 5 salads, 3 salmon, 1 chicken dumpling) items. 

 I typically get the 4 item bento box:

Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad - This potato salad looks bizarre, but is super delicious.  The wasabi mayo in it is so good!  It also has edamame and snap peas in it.

Green Bean Salad - comes with a sesame dressing and is really good as well.

For the fried item, I usually get the chicken dumpling or the tonkatsu.

There's usually a line here, but it goes fast.  They have plenty of  seating.  A nice lunch option if you are in the area.

excerpts: Others are vegetarian like the wasabi garlic potato salad and the green beans salads.
Price may be a hindering factor for making this a regular lunch spot, but for the most part, my long time asian food trained tongue says yes.
wasabi garlic potato salad.author: Cici T.
wasabi garlic potato salad.review:
Why are the graphics for this little shop so adorable? I let them lure me in, yes I did. The cartoonized orange carrots, yellow radishes, and green asparagus conjure that homey, organic, and delicate feel. Hence the name Delica, I suppose.

(RyanY, I'm so glad you ate here and approve! Your mom must cook up such memorable Japanese meals.)

For the sake of diversity and equally to appease my gluttony, I ordered 2 lunch meals (I shared with someone else..).

Hijiki and soybean salad: with edamame, konnyaku (mountain potato), daikon, fried tofu, kuko (aka wolfberry or goji, the bright red berry), as well as wild mizuna (a mustard).

Spinach and sesame salad: cold spinach mixed with rougher sesame paste (slightly sweet to the palate).

Spicy burdock root salad: braised burdock (the winner! a mighty root vegetable), konnyaku (mountain potato), onion, celery, julienne carrots, and wild mizuna. (Burdock, which I didn't even know is called that, is so refreshing!)

Chinese chicken salad: with Japanese cucumber, daikon, carrot, and celery in a soy dressing. (I probably wouldn't order this one again for a lack of creativity in the flavors on Delica's part).

Agedashi tofu: firm tofu deep fried and served with a thick tentsuyu broth topped with grated daikon (served cold! that part I didn't like.. the deep fried covering was soggy and the taste of oil was too apparent).

Tofu and chicken patty with hijiki: meatball like with tofu and chicken and bits of carrots. (not mindblowing, but inspiration to something I might try to make in my own kitchen. also served cold).

Accompanying the two lunch dishes, which were carefully carried from Delica to the rustic wooden tables in the hall, were a salmon rice ball and an edamame and kuko rice ball. Our meal definitely looked the part. Now for the tasting!

I was happy with lunch, more because of the ingredients used in the dishes and the way they were presented. Everything tasted delightful: light and yet flavorful. You don't get sick of any one dish and there's the added benefit that what you're dining on is both tasty and healthful.

Certain dishes are vegan friendly, namely the hijiki and soybean salad and the burdock salad. Others are vegetarian like the wasabi garlic potato salad and the green beans salads. Price may be a hindering factor for making this a regular lunch spot, but for the most part, my long time asian food trained tongue says yes.

excerpts: The wasabi garlic potato salad didn't wow me, but the Zuckerman(?)
wasabi garlic potato salad.author: Evan G.
wasabi garlic potato salad.review:
A return to the Ferry Building for a lunch landed a friend and I at Delica.  The clean, inviting interior sucked us in.  I was all ready to have soba noodles (I caught a glimpse of the words on the menu board and starting salivating like a Pavlovian dog), but then I got distracted by all the stuff in the deli case.  

And then we realized it.  We'd been had.  This place is really just a social experiment on how to get into line.  It was very confusing to try to figure out how and where to order.  "Are you in line?"  "Is there just one line?"  "Can I go ahead?"  "Did I just cut in front of you?"  are all things I asked.  Eventually, we ordered, helped the woman in front of us who was tasked with carrying 80 bajillion things back to her office, and paid.

The ginger carrot soup got the thumbs up from my friend, and I enjoyed the chicken dumplings - highly recommend them, in fact.  The chicken and tofu patty was OK - not all that stellar.  The wasabi garlic potato salad didn't wow me, but the Zuckerman(?) Farms asparagus salad was really interesting and tasty.  

I forgot about my annoyance/confusion about the line when I got outside, and it was 70 and sunny and I could look at the Bay.  I miss SF.

excerpts: - Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad -  a spicy kick, rich, & will get you full.
wasabi garlic potato salad.author: Manda Bear B.
wasabi garlic potato salad.review:
************* REVIEW 99 ****************

Great place to have a light afternoon sushi snack & Japanese food. I come here often when shopping for meat & cheese at the Ferry Building, especially after buy everything I don't need at the Farmer Market.

Beside the awesome Bento box that most people like, I never ordered that here. I actually just come here for the sushi & the salads. What I love most is the special daily menu & always fresh surprises. Today was no different, before my shoot, I decided to swing by to pick up some salumi @ Boccalone,  then I ended up here. 

A few dishes I enjoy very much:

- Seared Toro with Daikon, chai & ponzu sauce - so rich in taste.
- Aji with ginger, chai - I always love this shiny mackerel.
- Hirame carpaccio - 8 pieces thinly sliced with cilantro, olive oil, & sliced of Kumquat - so refreshing & delicate to eat. My FAV dish here!
- Tonkatsu - Pork tenderloin cutlet topped with tonkatsu sauce - giant piece for $1.50 - so crunchy-ly good!

Salads that I like:

- Spicy Burdock Root Salad - very nice, sweet & pleasant.
- Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad -  a spicy kick, rich, & will get you full.
- Tofu, green bean salad - surprisingly nice, great dish for vegetarian!

Service here has always been excellent for me. I love sitting here & looking out the water.  Did I mentioned they serve cold sake in traditional glass & box? nice!

excerpts:
(Notably the Hijiki and Soybean Salad ($15/lb), Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad ($8/lb), Tofu Steak with Miso Sauce ($4/ea), Organic Vegetable Sushi Roll ($7.75/two), and of course the Potato Croquette).

Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad and/or........
wasabi garlic potato salad.author: Kay N.
wasabi garlic potato salad.review:
Got Beef Curry ($9.50) and Green Tea ($2) 'cause I didn't feel like going bento. Maybe I will try one next time. 
The meal was simple and satisfying. Not heavy at all. Thumbs up. Will return again.

The Potato ($1.50/ea) and Crab ($3.75/ea) Croquettes looked tempting. 
I think I would feel fairly healthy eating most anything on Delica's menu. 
This restaurant is a good place to bring vegetarian/vegan friends if you want to eat with them near the water. Lots of good options for them. (Notably the Hijiki and Soybean Salad ($15/lb), Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad ($8/lb), Tofu Steak with Miso Sauce ($4/ea), Organic Vegetable Sushi Roll ($7.75/two), and of course the Potato Croquette).

Next visit: 
maybe a Bento box 5 items ($9.50), Summer Bento 9 items ($11), Croquettes, Shrimp Cake ($3.75/ea), Seared Tuna Salad ($10) or Spicy Tuna Genmai Rice Bowl ($10), Hijiki and Soybean Salad or Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad and/or........

Roast Beef Sushi ($2/ea), Sushi Rolls ($7.75/two), Tonkatsu/Pork Cutlet ($1.25), Chicken Dumpling w/Sweet Chili Sauce ($1.75), Kaki-age/Tempura ($3.75).

excerpts: Where else can you get wasabi garlic potato salad?
Sadly, I didn't try and now looking at all the good reviews here
wasabi garlic potato salad.author: Steve S.
wasabi garlic potato salad.review:
A Japanese delicatessen. Awesome.

Where else can you get wasabi garlic potato salad? Sadly, I didn't try and now looking at all the good reviews here, I wish I had.

Tried the shrimp and crab roll. Saw that it didn't have an expiration date but rather an expiration time! That's how fresh it was, and it tasted very fresh. 

Also tried the katsu don sandwich which was creatively prepared and quite delicious. The organic tofu miso soup was also good.

Definitely recommended.

overall enjoyed my lunch but out of all the foodie options in the ferry building, not at the top of my list. I'm at 3.5 stars...and as much as I liked the wasabi potato salad, it wasn't good enough to bump everything else up to a solid 4 :(

excerpts:
: yes, i do mean vats...delicious tubs of yellow goodness
2) wasabi garlic potato salad: who would have thought that romaine mixed with garlicky wasabi mashed potatoes was so delicious?
i was suspicious...
wasabi garlic potato salad.author: Fontane L.
wasabi garlic potato salad.review:
Awesome Japanese deli!  They've catered for lunches at my work, and they are fabulous!  Delicious items worth mentioning:

1) giant VATS of curry: yes, i do mean vats...delicious tubs of yellow goodness
2) wasabi garlic potato salad: who would have thought that romaine mixed with garlicky wasabi mashed potatoes was so delicious?  i was suspicious...but it totally won me over!

I know we had two lunches in a row from Delica, but I can't wait for more!  :)

excerpts:
This is the list: 

Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad - so unusual and so delicious!
wasabi garlic potato salad.author: Suge K.
wasabi garlic potato salad.review:
I work with a bunch of assholes. A bunch of lazy assholes. A bunch of rich lazy assholes. They're rich men, what do you expect? But I love them.

What I don't love, however, is hearing them complain. Often what they complain about is lunch, even though our company buys it for us. So as the only girl in our department, I'll take on the role of wife (they all call me Wife Number Two) and make sure they are well fed just so I can have my peace and quiet and continue to waste time on the internet. When the lunch menu comes around, I don't like them to interrupt my Yelping with questions like "What do I like from this place again? What do I usually order?" Since I know them so well, I know what they eat from every one of our lunch spots.

Delica rf-1 is a perfect example. These boys in my office wouldn't even begin to know what to order, but they sure can bitch if they fuck up their own orders and don't like what they get. So I order a bunch of stuff for us all to split and everyone is happy and I can get back to being non-productive. This is the list: 

Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad - so unusual and so delicious!
Chicken Dumplings - I'm pretty sure they put crack in these
Roast Beef Sushi - YUM!
Soba Noodle Soup - great flavor

So I order this, everyone is happy, and the guys are so appreciative that they make it up to me with dinners at Boulevard and bottles of Radio Couteau. Being Wife Number Two isn't so bad - especially since I don't have to put out.

excerpts: All of their salads are so good, especially Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad.
It is so unique and yummy!

Besides salads, they also have fried and deli items: 
1.
wasabi garlic potato salad.author: Liza T.
wasabi garlic potato salad.review:
Came here couple times and I love this place. Clean, fast, creative, healthy and good quality......Although it is kind of overpriced but I think it is still worth it! 

All of their salads are so good, especially Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad. It is so unique and yummy! Besides salads, they also have fried and deli items: 
1. Tofu and Chicken Patty with Hijiki (seaweed) $4.25 each - sounds like a good combination but not taste good 
2. Chicken Dumpling with Sweet and Chili Sauce $2.00 each - small but yummy; good to try 
3. Carrot & Ginger Soup $3.50 cup/ $5.50 bowl - rich, very creamy and flavorful; good to add it as side dish 
4. Roast Beef Sushi $2.50 each - really want to try this one, always looks fresh but too bad I don't eat beef @-@ 

The only thing that I don't like is lack of seating. It is quite difficult to find a seat during peak lunch hour! They should have some more tables so we can all enjoy a good meal there!

excerpts: I had wasabi garlic potato salad, asparagus with sesame dressing, rice, and a fantastic crab cream croquette.
wasabi garlic potato salad.author: Devon S.
wasabi garlic potato salad.review:
I have recently been living beyond my means. I make a modest teacher's salary, but my card activity reads like I should be working in the FiDi and getting lunch complimentary at some swanky restaurant because of a benevolent client. My last paycheck was broken into thirds - 1/3 rent, 1/3 necessities, and 1/3 clothes and expensive meals out.

Oops.

After a recent shopping trip, my roommate and I decided to explore the Ferry building. We were tempted by the freshly baked Acme bread, the sweet Scharfen-Berger chocolate, the sumptuous Cowgirl Creamery cheeses, and the little stand that serves a half hundred of the finest olive oils. We were so proud of ourselves, because we resisted them all. We wanted an inexpensive dinner, and neither of us make enough to consider $40 "inexpensive."

And so we settled on Delica, a sleek Japanese deli. We must have hit the place just before it closed, because it was nearly empty and the shelves were sparse, at best. For a very reasonable $12 (including tip) I had wasabi garlic potato salad, asparagus with sesame dressing, rice, and a fantastic crab cream croquette. 

It was a perfect end to a pleasant evening, as we ate our classy and cheap dinner while the sun set on the bay. Not bad for a couple of overspending junkies.

excerpts: I chose the wasabi garlic potato salad and the eggplant salad.
wasabi garlic potato salad.author: Maritel C.
wasabi garlic potato salad.review:
So, I couldn't resist eating here again today, since I will be back working in suburbia next week. Ha!

Today I opted for the 2 salads + rice = $6. I chose the wasabi garlic potato salad and the eggplant salad. Both were to die for! 

1) I loooooooooooooove Japanese potato salad and Delica's version, just took it up another notch with the addition of edamame and the subtle flavor of wasabi which was not overpowering. 

2) The eggplant salad had ground chicken and glass noodles in it and had a yummy seasame-soy sauce on it. 

I wish I could bring Delica back with me to Pleasanton....(sigh)...

excerpts: Got the Hijiki and Soy Bean Salad, Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad, and Spicy Burdock and Lotus Root Salad.
All three were different but in a good way.
My favorite was probably the Lotus Root salad since I do enjoy Lotus Root.
I liked the flavor of the Hijiki, which came with jelly slivers.
The Wasabi salad wasn't too spicy
but I just don't enjoy the taste of wasabi very much -
I did like the beans that were mixed in, though.
Also got one Roast Beef Sushi
but that was basically roast beef on top of rice
- I can make that myself!
Portions were a bit small for the $8.25 we paid for the three salads.
They were also out of two of the salads we really wanted to try and said it would take another 15 minutes - no thanks!
Their cooked food looked delicious, so I'll have to try out one of those next time.
If you're in the mood for something different, eat here!
wasabi garlic potato salad.author: Caroline K.
wasabi garlic potato salad.review: Ordered the three-salad combo here to taste as recommended by a friend who swears by this place.  Got the Hijiki and Soy Bean Salad, Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad, and Spicy Burdock and Lotus Root Salad.  All three were different but in a good way.  My favorite was probably the Lotus Root salad since I do enjoy Lotus Root.  I liked the flavor of the Hijiki, which came with jelly slivers.  The Wasabi salad wasn't too spicy but I just don't enjoy the taste of wasabi very much - I did like the beans that were mixed in, though.  Also got one Roast Beef Sushi but that was basically roast beef on top of rice - I can make that myself!  Portions were a bit small for the $8.25 we paid for the three salads.  They were also out of two of the salads we really wanted to try and said it would take another 15 minutes - no thanks!  Their cooked food looked delicious, so I'll have to try out one of those next time.  If you're in the mood for something different, eat here!

excerpts: I will come back to try the Chinese Chicken Salad,Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad and Japanese Tea.
wasabi garlic potato salad.author: Dani D.
wasabi garlic potato salad.review:
Delica rf-1 is worth a stop to try out.I have to admit I was a little stuffed after eating some of Acme's bread.I did find the place quite nice,clean and a polite guy behind the register(this helps).

Upon entering I notice salads on display.It seemed that this is the only thing I did see at the time,but then I noticed the fried items.

-Fried Shrimp Cake(tasty,but didn't finish)
-White Corn and Potato Croquette(I enjoyed than the previous,but didn't finish)

Both overall,were quite tasty and I didn't find the prices overall outstanding,the guy again was quite nice and patient while I thought about the salad(ugh) or indulging in my fried food fixation.

I will come back to try the Chinese Chicken Salad,Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad and Japanese Tea.


Worth a stop during the week or weekend.

excerpts: Signature dishes include wasabi garlic potato salad, spicy burdock and lotus root salad, green bean salad with a sesame dressing, DELICA sushi rolls, hijiki and soy bean salad, Japanese curries, and Kobe-style deep-fried savory croquettes filled with potatoes, Dungeness crab in a bechamel sauce, or shrimp.
wasabi garlic potato salad.author: Grace O.
wasabi garlic potato salad.review:
So, the first week after WLB got married (congrats to WLB & WLB's wife!) we decided to head over to the ferry building and check out Delica rf-1...we had seen it on another weekly lunch outing and surprisingly WLB had yet to eat there!

according to it's website, delica rf-1 "offers a variety of beautifully prepared meals to take away. Side dishes, main courses, fresh-fried foods, and substantial salads. Signature dishes include wasabi garlic potato salad, spicy burdock and lotus root salad, green bean salad with a sesame dressing, DELICA sushi rolls, hijiki and soy bean salad, Japanese curries, and Kobe-style deep-fried savory croquettes filled with potatoes, Dungeness crab in a bechamel sauce, or shrimp. " 

to put it simpler, in this foodie's terms, delica is a good place to get some japanese-CA fusion cuisine, made with organic and fresh ingredients, offering a yummy lunch that's flavorful and not heavy.  they have decent-priced lunch combinations where you can pick a combination of salads, main dishes, + with or w/o rice...their menu changes so the variety is never boring or repetitive...

additionally, the presentation of the japanese deli is clean, visually pleasing and just makes you want to order their food...and on that note, item to order next time? -- pork cutlet sandwich and a cream puff for desert!

excerpts: Soy Bean salad, Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad, Eggplant salad, lotus root salad, Chinese Chicken salad and wild mushroom salad to choose from.
wasabi garlic potato salad.author: Paul K.
wasabi garlic potato salad.review:
This is one of my favorite lunch spots.  It's essentially an upscale take out serving contemporary &  traditional Japanese food.

The items that stand out are their fresh Japanese salads.  Usually there is a Hijiki (seaweed) Soy Bean salad, Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad, Eggplant salad, lotus root salad, Chinese Chicken salad and wild mushroom salad to choose from.  There's also a variety of cold small entrees such as tofu steak with sauce, chickent and tofu patty, roast beef sushi, etc.

Hot items are mostly fried - shrimp cake, potato croquet, chicken dumplings, sweet & sour chicken, crab cake, tempura, tonkatsu (fried pork with breading).  They also offer beef/chicken curry over rice.

YOu can buy salads by weight and many items by piece.  For lunch, you can get  2 salad item with rice for about $7.  You can also get a deep friend item with a salad and rice for $7.50.  Curry chicken/beef will run you a bit more around $8.50 or so.

Delica is located in the Ferry Building across from Pete's Coffee.

excerpts: I had the Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad and its yummy -- who doesn't like a mix of wasabi mayo + edamames and for the sushi fans try out the Roast Beef Sushi.
wasabi garlic potato salad.author: Sherman H.
wasabi garlic potato salad.review:
What a great concept!  Think Italian deli or small plates tapas, but Japanese style.  I am sure these are a dime a dozen back in the motherland, but for us Californian Japanese food luvers we must admit that our range of Japanese cuisines is very limited.  Sure we've all had our lunch boxes, raw tunas and fancy rolls.  A few creative souls probably tried out some Japanese curries and udon/sobas/ramen but DELICA rf-1 is fun, unique, clean and you just feel this is a whole different type of Japanese food that the locals in CA haven't had before, but would try once they go.

DELICA rf-1 is a perfect lunch place (especially once summer comes and this damn rain goes away).  I had the Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad and its yummy -- who doesn't like a mix of wasabi mayo + edamames and for the sushi fans try out the Roast Beef Sushi.  And for bento box fans take a look at the bento boxes they have here.  When I was in Japan as a kid once (I was 12 yrs old) the thing that stuck out to me the most was the lil neatly packed bento boxes.  Seeing the bento boxes here brought back some childhood flashbacks.

excerpts: Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad (with edamame!)
wasabi garlic potato salad.author: Natalie S.
wasabi garlic potato salad.review:
Mmmmm, I love to go here and get the bento boxes - full of stuff I know I like, and maybe a new thing or two that's guaranteed to be tasty.  Delica rf-1 is a delicious, healthy way to jolt yourself out of the weekday lunch doldrums.  The flavors are interesting, and the food is fresh - it won't make you feel like you need to take a big nap under your desk.  It is on the slightly pricier end of the lunch spectrum - a box is around $10-$11 - but it's a great treat, and you can fill up there for less if you're content to try only one or two of their offerings.  As for me, if I'm going all the way to the Ferry Building, I'm determined to sample several items.  It's all good but I'll mention a few offerings so you know what you're getting into . . . 

Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad (with edamame!)
Corn and Mascarpone Cheese Salad
Eggplant Salad (with chicken and onions)
Crab Cream Croquette
Chicken Dumpling with Sweet Chili Sauce (and water chestnutes and mushrooms)

it's pretty deli-style - I'm such a visual person that I usually just go for the stuff on display, but evidently they have sushi rolls, rice bowls, and several kinds of soup.

excerpts:
Salad Trio for $8
- Hijiki and Soybean Salad
- Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad 
- Corn and Mascarpone Salad
wasabi garlic potato salad.author: Katie K.
wasabi garlic potato salad.review:
A sunny warm day in downtown calls for lunch at the Ferry Building. Since I don't work in Downtown, I don't have the luxury to visit Delica too often. The food is always fresh and reliably delicious.

I really enjoyed:
*Salad Trio for $8
- Hijiki and Soybean Salad
- Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad 
- Corn and Mascarpone Salad 

*Sushi Roll $7.75
*Roast Beef Sushi $2
*Fried Shrimp Cake $3.75
*White Corn and Potato Croquette $2
*Mango Tea $2

Find a bench in the back and enjoy the perfect lunch with an amazing view.

excerpts: With a wide variety of vegetarian items, the Chinese Chicken Salad, Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad, and Spicy Burdock Root Salad are good choices.
wasabi garlic potato salad.author: Renee Y.
wasabi garlic potato salad.review:
Visiting this place during the summer season was quite an expedition as hoards of people congregate to the Ferry Building to sample fine wine and cheeses from the myriad of other stores.

Upon first arrival you come across two separate lines, one which is for Hot/Deli Items and the other for Boxed Items.  However, if you're looking for a quick line, I suggest having cash at hand to fork it over to the guy in the front of the store passing out bento boxes.

The relatively long wait during the lunch hours are worth it as the Roast Beef Sushi is excellent in presentation and taste.  Many people have the misconception that sushi has to be fish, which they would be promptly corrected.  Sushi, literally translated, just means rice vinegar--denoting that if you put it on top of rice, it's sushi. But I digress.

I always enjoy getting the Number 4 combo at the Deli which includes one Hot Item, Rice and one Salad.  With a wide variety of vegetarian items, the Chinese Chicken Salad, Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad, and Spicy Burdock Root Salad are good choices.  However, I would love to try the Corn and Mascarpone Salad.

As far as the curry and fried items, the beef curry wasn't anything too special, as I could easily attain this from any other place in Japantown.  Also, the Kakiage Tempura was what seemed like a "hot mess" as it is filled with pretty much anything in my fridge currently, but not much can be said about things that people say are "authentic" to Japanese cuisine.

The food here, though, is fairly cheap, fairly tasty, and of good quality for the Ferry Building, and because of it, I continue to come back, as most other places in and around Market charge you an arm and a leg for good food.

excerpts: We went with the sushi roll, beef curry, tofu steak with miso sauce, spicy burdock root salad and wasabi garlic potato salad.
My favorites were the tofu steak and potato salad.
The miso sauce atop the tofu steak totally made the dish.
It was perfectly flavored and not too salty.
Put with the tofu, it became very refreshing and light.
I was wary at first to try the potato salad since it had wasabi, but boy was I glad to have given it a try!
There was only the slightest bit of wasabi flavor!
The potato salad was drowned with mayo like other restaurants mistakenly do, instead it was lightly coated.
The curry was pretty average.
It was perfectly cooked not. too thick and not too watery, which is another rare find.
The sushi was quite interesting in that instead of a seaweed wrapper they used soy wraps.
There was barely any rice, but more lettuce.
You could almost say it's what happens when Japanese sushi meets Vietnamese spring rolls.
wasabi garlic potato salad.author: Gloria C.
wasabi garlic potato salad.review:
Located in the Ferry Building, Delica rf-1 is a rare Japanese find with healthy alternatives! I came on a Saturday afternoon, and this place was continuously packed. At first I was quite flustered since the place was crowded and there were two lines that seemed to have different purposes, but with a little help with some of the customers, we figured out the right line was for taking ready to go meals or to order to be made items like curry, and the left line was the line to pick and choose which pre-cooked items behind the glass you wanted. 

We went with the sushi roll, beef curry, tofu steak with miso sauce, spicy burdock root salad and wasabi garlic potato salad. My favorites were the tofu steak and potato salad. The miso sauce atop the tofu steak totally made the dish. It was perfectly flavored and not too salty. Put with the tofu, it became very refreshing and light. I was wary at first to try the potato salad since it had wasabi, but boy was I glad to have given it a try! There was only the slightest bit of wasabi flavor! The potato salad was drowned with mayo like other restaurants mistakenly do, instead it was lightly coated. The curry was pretty average. It was perfectly cooked not. too thick and not too watery, which is another rare find. The sushi was quite interesting in that instead of a seaweed wrapper they used soy wraps. There was barely any rice, but more lettuce. You could almost say it's what happens when Japanese sushi meets Vietnamese spring rolls. The sashimi that was placed on top wasn't very fresh, but otherwise the sushi was what you'd expect if it's been refrigerated and made into a take-out item.

The main reason why I love Delica is because their food is always light and you don't feel the slightest bit sluggish after eating their food.  The only minor problem with eating here and anywhere else in the Ferry building for that matter is because there's a lot of people/tourists making it  always hard to find places to sit. Delica has a few tables of their own, but they're always already taken. If you are able to find a seat, there's a superb view of the bay.

excerpts: Just go for the three-salad combo of Hijiki and Soybean Salad, Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad, and Spinach with Sesame Dressing (Goma-ae).
You will feel like a new man or woman, or some combination of the two...and there's nothing wrong with that!
Besides the salads, I can only recommend the Roast Beef Sushi.
Sounds odd, but I give that bad boy five stars!
Also, just ten feet away from one of the best views in California, which...face it, is really the best state on earth.
wasabi garlic potato salad.author: Johnny O.
wasabi garlic potato salad.review: Five stars for the salads, 3 or 4 stars for everything else. Just go for the three-salad combo of Hijiki and Soybean Salad, Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad, and Spinach with Sesame Dressing (Goma-ae). You will feel like a new man or woman, or some combination of the two...and there's nothing wrong with that! Besides the salads, I can only recommend the Roast Beef Sushi. Sounds odd, but I give that bad boy five stars! Also, just ten feet away from one of the best views in California, which...face it, is really the best state on earth.

excerpts: I love the Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad  and the Pork Cutlet (Tonkatsu) is delicious.
The sushi rolls are also scrumptious.
The food is always fresh.
I'm giving this place 5 stars because it definitely deserves it.
wasabi garlic potato salad.author: Roddster V.
wasabi garlic potato salad.review: I'm not an avid fan of Japanese food/sushi, but I'm catching on.  This place is excellent!  Our company has this catered in and I have to say this is the best Japanese they've ever had.   I love the Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad  and the Pork Cutlet (Tonkatsu) is delicious.  The sushi rolls are also scrumptious.  The food is always fresh.   I'm giving this place 5 stars because it definitely deserves it.

excerpts: we had the wasabi garlic potato salad, lotus root salad, soybean salad, and the tofu and they were ALL delicious.
All the salads are unusual and most importantly FRESH.
A good quick n grabber lunch for financial districters.
wasabi garlic potato salad.author: stephanie n.
wasabi garlic potato salad.review: we had the wasabi garlic potato salad, lotus root salad, soybean salad, and the tofu and they were ALL delicious.  All the salads are unusual and most importantly FRESH.  A good quick n grabber lunch for financial districters.

excerpts: It comes with a few delicious pieces of pork katsu with their tonkatsu sauce, white rice, Hijiki and Soybean Salad, and their Spicy Burdock Root Salad.
So delicious!
Sure the box sets you back $9.75 plus tax, but it's definitely a complete meal.
Their combos where you can order a variety of salad/side combinations is also really cool!
Anyway, this is a great place for lunch during the weekend or weekday!
I highly recommend it!
spicy burdock root salad.author: Lisa I.
spicy burdock root salad.review: I love Delica, I love that Delica is authentic with traditional Japanese salads/sides/bento boxes, and I love that it's SO close to where I work and live.  When I've stopped by for lunch, I've picked up with their Pork Katsu bento box without having to wait in a typically long line.  It comes with a few delicious pieces of pork katsu with their tonkatsu sauce, white rice, Hijiki and Soybean Salad, and their Spicy Burdock Root Salad.  So delicious! Sure the box sets you back $9.75 plus tax, but it's definitely a complete meal.  Their combos where you can order a variety of salad/side combinations is also really cool!  Anyway, this is a great place for lunch during the weekend or weekday! I highly recommend it!

excerpts: *Spicy Burdock Root Salad:
A spicy mix of braised burdock and konnyaku (mountain potato) tossed with thin slices of white onion, celery, julienne carrots, and wild mizuna.
spicy burdock root salad.author: Michelle T.
spicy burdock root salad.review:
Lines here are RIDIC but worth the wait!

I love Japanese style bento boxes and donburis!

My favorite here is the Ginger Beef Bowl (Natural Japanese supreme ground Kobe Beef and ginger served with shredded egg and steamed rice. Topped with green onion) It is full of protein, filling, a good price, and most importantly SOOO delicious. 

They usually have this bowl as grab and pay so no need to wait in the same RIDIC line as those who are waiting to order from the menu whatever dish their hearts desire. 

For grab and go there's usually onigiri and premade bento boxes.

Some other items I love here are:

*Organic Agedashi Tofu Steak: Silken (Kinugoshi) firm tofu is lightly dusted with potato starch and then deep fried until golden brown. It's then served in a hot tentsuyu broth made od dashi, mirin, and sho-yu (Japanese soy sauce), and topped with grated daikon. Though it is deep fried, it does not taste heavy! It is perfectly fried!

*Spicy Burdock Root Salad: A spicy mix of braised burdock and konnyaku (mountain potato) tossed with thin slices of white onion, celery, julienne carrots, and wild mizuna.
This isn't really spicy but WHATEVER it is amazing!!!

*Hijiki and Soybean Salad: Hijiki (seaweed rich in calcium, iron, and fiber) mixed with dried soybeans, edamame, konnyaku (mountain potato), daikon, wild mizuna, fried tofu, and kuko (wolfberry) cooked with soy sauce.

Gosh, thinking about all the delicious food is making me so hungry.

excerpts: Spicy burdock root salad: braised burdock (the winner!
a mighty root vegetable), konnyaku (mountain potato), onion, celery, julienne carrots, and wild mizuna.
spicy burdock root salad.author: Cici T.
spicy burdock root salad.review:
Why are the graphics for this little shop so adorable? I let them lure me in, yes I did. The cartoonized orange carrots, yellow radishes, and green asparagus conjure that homey, organic, and delicate feel. Hence the name Delica, I suppose.

(RyanY, I'm so glad you ate here and approve! Your mom must cook up such memorable Japanese meals.)

For the sake of diversity and equally to appease my gluttony, I ordered 2 lunch meals (I shared with someone else..).

Hijiki and soybean salad: with edamame, konnyaku (mountain potato), daikon, fried tofu, kuko (aka wolfberry or goji, the bright red berry), as well as wild mizuna (a mustard).

Spinach and sesame salad: cold spinach mixed with rougher sesame paste (slightly sweet to the palate).

Spicy burdock root salad: braised burdock (the winner! a mighty root vegetable), konnyaku (mountain potato), onion, celery, julienne carrots, and wild mizuna. (Burdock, which I didn't even know is called that, is so refreshing!)

Chinese chicken salad: with Japanese cucumber, daikon, carrot, and celery in a soy dressing. (I probably wouldn't order this one again for a lack of creativity in the flavors on Delica's part).

Agedashi tofu: firm tofu deep fried and served with a thick tentsuyu broth topped with grated daikon (served cold! that part I didn't like.. the deep fried covering was soggy and the taste of oil was too apparent).

Tofu and chicken patty with hijiki: meatball like with tofu and chicken and bits of carrots. (not mindblowing, but inspiration to something I might try to make in my own kitchen. also served cold).

Accompanying the two lunch dishes, which were carefully carried from Delica to the rustic wooden tables in the hall, were a salmon rice ball and an edamame and kuko rice ball. Our meal definitely looked the part. Now for the tasting!

I was happy with lunch, more because of the ingredients used in the dishes and the way they were presented. Everything tasted delightful: light and yet flavorful. You don't get sick of any one dish and there's the added benefit that what you're dining on is both tasty and healthful.

Certain dishes are vegan friendly, namely the hijiki and soybean salad and the burdock salad. Others are vegetarian like the wasabi garlic potato salad and the green beans salads. Price may be a hindering factor for making this a regular lunch spot, but for the most part, my long time asian food trained tongue says yes.

excerpts:
Salads that I like:

- Spicy Burdock Root Salad - very nice, sweet & pleasant.
spicy burdock root salad.author: Manda Bear B.
spicy burdock root salad.review:
************* REVIEW 99 ****************

Great place to have a light afternoon sushi snack & Japanese food. I come here often when shopping for meat & cheese at the Ferry Building, especially after buy everything I don't need at the Farmer Market.

Beside the awesome Bento box that most people like, I never ordered that here. I actually just come here for the sushi & the salads. What I love most is the special daily menu & always fresh surprises. Today was no different, before my shoot, I decided to swing by to pick up some salumi @ Boccalone,  then I ended up here. 

A few dishes I enjoy very much:

- Seared Toro with Daikon, chai & ponzu sauce - so rich in taste.
- Aji with ginger, chai - I always love this shiny mackerel.
- Hirame carpaccio - 8 pieces thinly sliced with cilantro, olive oil, & sliced of Kumquat - so refreshing & delicate to eat. My FAV dish here!
- Tonkatsu - Pork tenderloin cutlet topped with tonkatsu sauce - giant piece for $1.50 - so crunchy-ly good!

Salads that I like:

- Spicy Burdock Root Salad - very nice, sweet & pleasant.
- Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad -  a spicy kick, rich, & will get you full.
- Tofu, green bean salad - surprisingly nice, great dish for vegetarian!

Service here has always been excellent for me. I love sitting here & looking out the water.  Did I mentioned they serve cold sake in traditional glass & box? nice!

excerpts: The Spicy Burdock Root Salad is authentic and delicious!
The rice and the Sweet and Spicy Chicken (they used chicken breast) are also fantastic.
The service is friendly, the place is clean, and the price is fair.
spicy burdock root salad.author: Food S.
spicy burdock root salad.review:
The Spicy Burdock Root Salad is authentic and delicious!  The rice and the Sweet and Spicy Chicken (they used chicken breast) are also fantastic.  The service is friendly, the place is clean, and the price is fair.  I got all three items for a low price of $7.75 before tax ($8.43 after tax).

Unfortunately, I didn't have the time nor the stomach to sample more dishes.  Nevertheless, I will be back to check out more dishes at a later date.

This place is truly a gem.

excerpts:
Spicy burdock root salad (my friend loves this)
.
spicy burdock root salad.author: Yvonne C.
spicy burdock root salad.review:
Delica is one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. I always get the 3-salad combination -- the portions for salads are generous and the salads are all really exciting that I can't decide which three to get... 

My favorites are: 
. Hijiki and soybean salad (if you like seaweed this is the best salad ever)
. Spicy burdock root salad (my friend loves this)
. Green bean salad (a little crunchy and with creamy sesame dressing -- yummy)

On top of that, the service is impeccable, friendly and beyond helpful: my server suggested a combination salad which would cost less than buying my salad per pound.

Delica gets points for giving consideration to sustainability and humane treatment of animals (e.g. from Prather Ranch which is certified humane http://www.certifiedhumane.org) not to mention making veggie food delicious. 

If Delica was open for dinner I'll be here everyday -- I usually don't make it here by 6 (weekdays) or 5 (weekend) before it closes. I love the food and highly recommend this place to anyone who likes healthy and tasty food.

excerpts:
I love the vegan crunch of the burdock and konnyaku in the Spicy Burdock Root Salad, the Potato Croquettes have always been lightly fried and crisp (at least for me), and I seriously want to eat the Hijiki and Soybean Salad off someone's crotch -- the marvelous, delicate kelp flavor is enhanced by the snap and color of the soybeans. 

...
spicy burdock root salad.author: d s.
spicy burdock root salad.review:
I know you all have opinions about who I am and what kind of guys I'm attracted to. To wit: you think I'm a fucking Potato Queen, right? RIGHT?!?! 

Look, look, it's okay, you can say it, who can blame you for thinking that, after all I skew towards the Occident in my bedside reading and The Ex was a white trash wunderkind, so it's easy to picture me trolling for DL tricks at the Aryan Nation compound or something.

HOWEVER, you're 100% wrong so to put it delicately fuck you. I've used ALL the crayons in the box, kids. I mean, I fucking have the Rainbow Coalition on speed dial, my ass is practically a Benetton ad, and my mouth is a branch of the Equal Rights Commission. I'M EQUAL OPPORTUNITY BITCHES! I like it all, especially my Asian brothas! 

Oh yes. I'm not one of those gaysians who recoil at the very thought of hooking up with another gaysian -- WHAT THE FUCK IS UP WITH THAT?!? Shit, I LOST my virginity at 15 to another Japo boy who, curiously enough, shared my first name which, now that I think about it, is a touch disturbing and probably fodder for my next therapy session and I should print this review out for my shrink, so I'll just do what I always do with traumatic incidents and pretend that never happened. 

I suppose I could chronicle all my sexual exploits in diversity in this review, but I'd probably be sued or something, so I'll just say that the delicious sozai food at Delica Rf-1 has been a consistently excellent performer. In fact, if I could describe to you all the wonders of Delica Rf-1, I'd have a composite of my ideal Japanese lover, who is... 

...SEXY. There's something about driftwood + sleek steel surfaces + glass that makes me cream my pants.

...MEATY. While I know that sushi purists may recoil at the thought  -- and for the record, I too hate California-Unicorn-Dragon-Dropping-Mayo-Surprise Jive Ass Rolls -- please understand me when I say that the Roast Beef nigiri sushi is a gustatory revelation of hormone-free local beef topping a lightly vinegared shari mound. Also, the Tonkatsu meets all expectations and the Chicken Gyoza (dumplings) are worth cheating on your spouse for.

...HEALTHY. Even though I'm an avowed carnivore, I often load up on the vegetarian/vegan items here. I love the vegan crunch of the burdock and konnyaku in the Spicy Burdock Root Salad, the Potato Croquettes have always been lightly fried and crisp (at least for me), and I seriously want to eat the Hijiki and Soybean Salad off someone's crotch -- the marvelous, delicate kelp flavor is enhanced by the snap and color of the soybeans. 

...EXPENSIVE.  Pre-packaged bentos range from $9.50 to $11, or you can prepare a plate featuring two salads and a deli item for $9. Toss in some Roast Beef Sushi at $2 a piece or some freshly fried items (Kakiage Tempura, etc.) and you're looking at a rather expensive lunch. BUT please keep in mind that I have a chronic case of A$IAN CHEAPNE$$ (TM Ken K), so the fact that I will happily hand over $10-$15 for a spread here really says A LOT.

Delica Rf-1, WILL YOU MARRY ME?!?

Wait, how big is your penis again?

excerpts: I ordered the lunch special and picked the spicy burdock root salad with the fried shrimp cake, sweet and spicy chicken and rice.
The salad wasn't spicy in the least but was tasty for being vegan-
the celery gave it a nice crunch to it.
The shrimp cake was probably my favorite item very tasty and filling and the chicken was yummy
but they only give you 3 small pieces.
I would definitely try Delica again, but it is a bit much for lunch $15 for a small box of food.
I might recommend their sushi or soup next time.
spicy burdock root salad.author: Kristy H.
spicy burdock root salad.review: Going to the ferry building and can be mind boggling. So many tasty things under one roof and you really don't want to walk away ordering the wrong thing or missing out on something amazing. I hate having plate envy too. I decided to go with Delica because it looked awesome and tasty. I ordered the lunch special and picked the spicy burdock root salad with the fried shrimp cake, sweet and spicy chicken and rice. The salad wasn't spicy in the least but was tasty for being vegan- the celery gave it a nice crunch to it. The shrimp cake was probably my favorite item very tasty and filling and the chicken was yummy but they only give you 3 small pieces. I would definitely try Delica again, but it is a bit much for lunch $15 for a small box of food. I might recommend their sushi or soup next time.

Tofu & Chicken Patty: Yes

excerpts: We both got the vegetarian bento - which is actually also vegan as far as I can tell, even though it is labeled "vegetarian" - which came with hijiki and soybean salad, spicy burdock root salad, agedashi tofu steak and rice with black sesame seeds.
The rice was the best part, which I think is a little bizarre.
spicy burdock root salad.author: Madeleine T.
spicy burdock root salad.review:
After a morning of errands I met my omnivorous sweetheart for lunch at the Ferry Building. Somehow I had never eaten here! Delica looked like a fabulous option - clean and pretty in a minimalist way. We hadn't eaten Japanese food in a while, plus never Japanese deli food, specifically, so that was kind of exciting as well. Looking - belatedly! - at other reviews now, perhaps it is because we grabbed the pre-made bento boxes rather than ordering a la carte items  that we were not nearly as satisfied as other reviewers? I honestly have no idea.

We both got the vegetarian bento - which is actually also vegan as far as I can tell, even though it is labeled "vegetarian" - which came with hijiki and soybean salad, spicy burdock root salad, agedashi tofu steak and rice with black sesame seeds. The rice was the best part, which I think is a little bizarre. I mean 

1) I like good rice and 
2) bad rice can certainly ruin a meal, but 
3) I don't know that rice should be the best part of any meal. 

So. The rice was the best part, but not amazingly great, zowie-powie, rock 'em-sock 'em rice. There was no subtlety to the other dishes, and no medley or mixture of flavor - everything was weirdly, overwhelmingly sweet, and the tofu wasn't fresh at all. All that for $10 - each! - makes me a little sad.

I had started this review with two stars but had to take it down to one because I just can't even. Boo.

Veg*ns take note: the spinach sesame salad is prepared with traditional bonito flake dashi - they mention this on their website, but I am not sure if it is clear at the deli.

excerpts: With a wide variety of vegetarian items, the Chinese Chicken Salad, Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad, and Spicy Burdock Root Salad are good choices.
spicy burdock root salad.author: Renee Y.
spicy burdock root salad.review:
Visiting this place during the summer season was quite an expedition as hoards of people congregate to the Ferry Building to sample fine wine and cheeses from the myriad of other stores.

Upon first arrival you come across two separate lines, one which is for Hot/Deli Items and the other for Boxed Items.  However, if you're looking for a quick line, I suggest having cash at hand to fork it over to the guy in the front of the store passing out bento boxes.

The relatively long wait during the lunch hours are worth it as the Roast Beef Sushi is excellent in presentation and taste.  Many people have the misconception that sushi has to be fish, which they would be promptly corrected.  Sushi, literally translated, just means rice vinegar--denoting that if you put it on top of rice, it's sushi. But I digress.

I always enjoy getting the Number 4 combo at the Deli which includes one Hot Item, Rice and one Salad.  With a wide variety of vegetarian items, the Chinese Chicken Salad, Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad, and Spicy Burdock Root Salad are good choices.  However, I would love to try the Corn and Mascarpone Salad.

As far as the curry and fried items, the beef curry wasn't anything too special, as I could easily attain this from any other place in Japantown.  Also, the Kakiage Tempura was what seemed like a "hot mess" as it is filled with pretty much anything in my fridge currently, but not much can be said about things that people say are "authentic" to Japanese cuisine.

The food here, though, is fairly cheap, fairly tasty, and of good quality for the Ferry Building, and because of it, I continue to come back, as most other places in and around Market charge you an arm and a leg for good food.

spicy burdock root salad.review: L-O-V-E their selection of salads, from the Wasabi Garlic Potato to the Spicy Burdock Root Salad to the Spinach and Sesame - always freshly made!

I think this places stands out given that it is the only Japanese place in the Ferry Building but if you were to locate it in, for example, Japantown you just know this would just bomb huge.
