Had greens, and some lotus root.
The sauce was vaguely sweet and very tasty.
spicy burdock root salad.author: ann l.
spicy burdock root salad.review:
We stopped by on a Sunday morning and got a couple salads and the chicken/tofu burger.  

Spicy Burdock root salad:  Had greens, and some lotus root.  The sauce was vaguely sweet and very tasty.  Ate it all even without knowing what "burdock" really is...

Hijiki  & soybean salad:  Also vaguely sweet and very tasty.  

Tofu/chicken patty:  They give this to you cold, not sure why.  It looked better than it tasted.  The sauce on it was still gelatinous, not very appetizing.  Would not get this unless they are willing to heat it up.

Kaki-age: wonderful fried goodness.

excerpts: We went with the sushi roll, beef curry, tofu steak with miso sauce, spicy burdock root salad and wasabi garlic potato salad.
My favorites were the tofu steak and potato salad.
The miso sauce atop the tofu steak totally made the dish.
It was perfectly flavored and not too salty.
Put with the tofu, it became very refreshing and light.
I was wary at first to try the potato salad since it had wasabi, but boy was I glad to have given it a try!
There was only the slightest bit of wasabi flavor!
The potato salad was drowned with mayo like other restaurants mistakenly do, instead it was lightly coated.
The curry was pretty average.
It was perfectly cooked not. too thick and not too watery, which is another rare find.
The sushi was quite interesting in that instead of a seaweed wrapper they used soy wraps.
There was barely any rice, but more lettuce.
You could almost say it's what happens when Japanese sushi meets Vietnamese spring rolls.
spicy burdock root salad.author: Gloria C.
spicy burdock root salad.review:
Located in the Ferry Building, Delica rf-1 is a rare Japanese find with healthy alternatives! I came on a Saturday afternoon, and this place was continuously packed. At first I was quite flustered since the place was crowded and there were two lines that seemed to have different purposes, but with a little help with some of the customers, we figured out the right line was for taking ready to go meals or to order to be made items like curry, and the left line was the line to pick and choose which pre-cooked items behind the glass you wanted. 

We went with the sushi roll, beef curry, tofu steak with miso sauce, spicy burdock root salad and wasabi garlic potato salad. My favorites were the tofu steak and potato salad. The miso sauce atop the tofu steak totally made the dish. It was perfectly flavored and not too salty. Put with the tofu, it became very refreshing and light. I was wary at first to try the potato salad since it had wasabi, but boy was I glad to have given it a try! There was only the slightest bit of wasabi flavor! The potato salad was drowned with mayo like other restaurants mistakenly do, instead it was lightly coated. The curry was pretty average. It was perfectly cooked not. too thick and not too watery, which is another rare find. The sushi was quite interesting in that instead of a seaweed wrapper they used soy wraps. There was barely any rice, but more lettuce. You could almost say it's what happens when Japanese sushi meets Vietnamese spring rolls. The sashimi that was placed on top wasn't very fresh, but otherwise the sushi was what you'd expect if it's been refrigerated and made into a take-out item.

The main reason why I love Delica is because their food is always light and you don't feel the slightest bit sluggish after eating their food.  The only minor problem with eating here and anywhere else in the Ferry building for that matter is because there's a lot of people/tourists making it  always hard to find places to sit. Delica has a few tables of their own, but they're always already taken. If you are able to find a seat, there's a superb view of the bay.

excerpts: - Spinach and Sesame Salad: Pretty straightforward, but cooked in dashi broth.
spinach and sesame salad.author: Jen P.
spinach and sesame salad.review:
One of the best bento boxes I've had so far. 

- Spinach and Sesame Salad: Pretty straightforward, but cooked in dashi broth.

- Spicy Burdock and Lotus Root Salad: Loved this. It's a mix of so many veggies; there's also konnyaku, onions, celery, carrots, and other greens tossed in there. Everything is thinly sliced, crunchy, light, and flavorful.

- Fried Shrimp Cake: You know the kind where it's all breading and there's only a few tiny pieces of shrimp inside? NOT the case here. Instead, the entire block is shrimp and covered in very thin crispy panko. Yum.

Being a person who prefers eating meat over veggies, I was surprised I liked this place more than usual, and I think that says a lot. Ingredients are high quality and fresh!

excerpts: Spinach and sesame salad: cold spinach mixed with rougher sesame paste (slightly sweet to the palate).
spinach and sesame salad.author: Cici T.
spinach and sesame salad.review:
Why are the graphics for this little shop so adorable? I let them lure me in, yes I did. The cartoonized orange carrots, yellow radishes, and green asparagus conjure that homey, organic, and delicate feel. Hence the name Delica, I suppose.

(RyanY, I'm so glad you ate here and approve! Your mom must cook up such memorable Japanese meals.)

For the sake of diversity and equally to appease my gluttony, I ordered 2 lunch meals (I shared with someone else..).

Hijiki and soybean salad: with edamame, konnyaku (mountain potato), daikon, fried tofu, kuko (aka wolfberry or goji, the bright red berry), as well as wild mizuna (a mustard).

Spinach and sesame salad: cold spinach mixed with rougher sesame paste (slightly sweet to the palate).

Spicy burdock root salad: braised burdock (the winner! a mighty root vegetable), konnyaku (mountain potato), onion, celery, julienne carrots, and wild mizuna. (Burdock, which I didn't even know is called that, is so refreshing!)

Chinese chicken salad: with Japanese cucumber, daikon, carrot, and celery in a soy dressing. (I probably wouldn't order this one again for a lack of creativity in the flavors on Delica's part).

Agedashi tofu: firm tofu deep fried and served with a thick tentsuyu broth topped with grated daikon (served cold! that part I didn't like.. the deep fried covering was soggy and the taste of oil was too apparent).

Tofu and chicken patty with hijiki: meatball like with tofu and chicken and bits of carrots. (not mindblowing, but inspiration to something I might try to make in my own kitchen. also served cold).

Accompanying the two lunch dishes, which were carefully carried from Delica to the rustic wooden tables in the hall, were a salmon rice ball and an edamame and kuko rice ball. Our meal definitely looked the part. Now for the tasting!

I was happy with lunch, more because of the ingredients used in the dishes and the way they were presented. Everything tasted delightful: light and yet flavorful. You don't get sick of any one dish and there's the added benefit that what you're dining on is both tasty and healthful.

Certain dishes are vegan friendly, namely the hijiki and soybean salad and the burdock salad. Others are vegetarian like the wasabi garlic potato salad and the green beans salads. Price may be a hindering factor for making this a regular lunch spot, but for the most part, my long time asian food trained tongue says yes.

excerpts: But all things considered, the Hijiki and soybean salad, the spinach and sesame salad, and the Chinese chicken salads are all good bets.
spinach and sesame salad.author: Jon L.
spinach and sesame salad.review:
When I have the time, I like to take a walk to the ferry building to 1. soak in the sunshine 2. feel the bay breeze and 3. get me some Japanese delicatessen grub at Delica. 

It's fairly quick and efficient but more importantly, I really like the food. In particular, the salads are fantastic. I get VERY excited when the eggplant salad is back in season. The eggplant is tender and the sauce is so savory but clean-tasting at the same time. Simply delish! Other standout seasonal salads include the mapo tofu salad and the asparagus salad. 

The regular salads aren't bad either but since they are always there, I don't covet them as much as, say, the eggplant salad for example. But all things considered, the Hijiki and soybean salad, the spinach and sesame salad, and the Chinese chicken salads are all good bets. Out of their main dishes, the tofu steak with chicken is surprisingly hearty and the fried shrimp cake is simply mind-blowing. Perfectly fried without being greasy and fresh shrimp on the inside make it a nice accompaniment to the salads. 

Delica is a great interpretation of what deli food can be, incorporating the "clean" taste of Japanese cuisine to offer a light and delicious lunch while you soak in the sun and bay breeze.

excerpts: I had the Hijiki and Soybean Salad, Spinach and Sesame Salad, and the Shrimp Cake.
spinach and sesame salad.author: Dianne S.
spinach and sesame salad.review:
During my short trip to San Francisco I wanted to eat somewhere very affordable and satisfied my traveler's appetite and not disturb my great figure ^_^.  So we headed here and I truly loved their salads.  Very nutritious indeed and it kept me full for the rest of our trek through the city.  

I had the Hijiki and Soybean Salad, Spinach and Sesame Salad, and the Shrimp Cake.

This restaurant makes me want to move to San Francisco.  I can't wait to return again. 

Great for vegetarians too!

excerpts: I typically get the spinach and sesame salad along with the tonkatsu, which is cooked rather well!
If you haven't been, you must go visit and give it a try!
Enjoy!
spinach and sesame salad.author: Edward L.
spinach and sesame salad.review: I have been here twice for lunch and given my love for Japanese cuisine, this place offers great Japanese food in a clean, light and tasty manner.....  I would love to come here more often when I have time to come out for lunch.  I typically get the spinach and sesame salad along with the tonkatsu, which is cooked rather well!  If you haven't been, you must go visit and give it a try!  Enjoy!

excerpts:
After much deliberation I chose the:
Green Beans with Sesame Dressing
Potato Croquette
Spinach and Sesame Salad
spinach and sesame salad.author: Miriam W.
spinach and sesame salad.review:
It's around noon on a flawlessly sunny day in San Francisco. I'm with three co-workers who are tired of sandwiches, have a hankering for something "ethnic" and wouldn't mind sushi. I no longer live here but my taste buds often long for the city that trained them so to the ferry building we go! I explain that there were many options to be had as I wander toward DELICA rf-1. Smartly, they join me to view the many delights in this modern Japanese deli.

After much deliberation I chose the:
Green Beans with Sesame Dressing
Potato Croquette
Spinach and Sesame Salad (Goma-ae)

I found the goma-ae a touch disappointing but the wonderfulness of both the green beans and the croquette made it easy to forget the relative blandness of the spinach salad.

We eat our food outside, looking at the Bay and dodging the occasional pigeon. A lovely respite from the windowless dungeon!

Next time I'll try the:
Japanese Style Curry
Roast Beef Sushi

Sid note on the interior: Modern design enthusiasts will appreciate the Wishbone chairs by Hans Wegner (a favorite among the Japanese).

excerpts: I got the agedashi tofu with the spinach and sesame salad.
I liked the spinach and sesame salad in little doses, I ended up leaving about half of it.
I am definitely going to go back to Delica and try one of their curries.
Maybe thats there specialty.
There is usually a long line outside so they have to be doing something right.
spinach and sesame salad.author: Analisa S.
spinach and sesame salad.review:
Went here and got the #4 lunch special. Which includes one of their main dishes, a salad and rice.  I got the agedashi tofu with the spinach and sesame salad. It was only $8 which is pretty reasonable for downtown SF. 

The food was okay, they claim to be a Japanese place with a California twist. I didn't find too much of the California twist.  I am usually a fan of agedashi tofu and this one was just lacking in the flavor department.  I liked the spinach and sesame salad in little doses, I ended up leaving about half of it. 
 
I am definitely going to go back to Delica and try one of their curries. Maybe thats there specialty. There is usually a long line outside so they have to be doing something right.

excerpts: We also ordered the Spinach and Sesame Salad (Goma-ae), which was very bland, but my sister in law said that that's what it's supposed to taste like.
The Sweet & Spicy Chicken was good but
spinach and sesame salad.author: Arnold G.
spinach and sesame salad.review:
Delica rf-1 is an interesting experiment in Japanese deli food. It's high-end (i.e. expensive), they use fresh ingredients and even utilize some of the vendors that reside in the Ferry Building (Cowgirl Creamery and Prather Meat Company). I was lucky enough to end up here with my wife and sister in law, so we were able to get a pretty good sampling of food between the three of us. $47 later, here's how things broke down. 

For all their talk about fresh, healthy and balanced meals, Delica's strength is definitely in their fried foods. The Potato Croquette was really nice, but the Crab Cream Croquette is even better. Tonkatsu was smaller and bite sized since it's made with pork tenderloin, a smaller, leaner cut of meat that benefits from being fried in panko. They're all perfectly fried, not greasy and still crispy after sitting in the display case for awhile. 

We also tried both curries -- Mushroom and Ground Chicken Curry and Beef Curry served with hot steamed rice -- and they were good, but they also weren't anything special either, although the beef curry featured some perfectly cooked Prather Ranch Meat.

But the real star at Delica is the Roast Beef Sushi. A rare piece of Meyer Ranch meat on top of sushi rice and topped with baby arugula, shallots and julienned radish. It not only looked beautiful, it was absolutely delicious. And to think it was almost an afterthought because it was in a separate box from the rest of the food and we were all pretty full by the time we ate them.

We also ordered the Spinach and Sesame Salad (Goma-ae), which was very bland, but my sister in law said that that's what it's supposed to taste like. The Sweet & Spicy Chicken was good but nothing mind blowing, as was the Chicken Dumpling with sweet chili sauce. 

I really wanted to try the Tofu Steak with Miso Sauce and Kakiage Tempura (mixture of shredded vegetables, white shrimp in a tempura batter), but we already had too much food, but I think the next time I go, I'm just going to get three orders of roast beef sushi and call it a day.

excerpts: I would also recommend pork cutlet and the wasabi potato salad.
The soup portion is so small.
I don't think it's worth it.
pork cutlet.author: Caitlyn S.
pork cutlet.review: Totally what you would expect in the Ferry Building. Overpriced, but decent food. Worth the price? Not really, but it's the Ferry Building what can you expect. The counter service was good. This place reminds me of Lemonade because you just pick what you want and then get the price. I would get the shrimp tempura w/ fried veggies. It looks like a volcano/nest (pictured below) almost. I would also recommend pork cutlet and the wasabi potato salad. The soup portion is so small. I don't think it's worth it.

excerpts: I've had the pleasure to try the crab croquette and the pork cutlet.
Both were fried well and the insides were cooked nicely.
I also tried their Japanese Beef Curry.
I like how big the portion is for a regular $8.50.
Taste was just ok...
pork cutlet.author: Benita M.
pork cutlet.review:
If you have the Paypal app, make sure you clip the coupon. You can get $3-$4 off from this place if you pay through the app. What a steal!

Depending on what time you come, expect a line and a wait. Once the line circled to the place where they sell honey, took about 20 minutes until I got my food.

One thing I like about Delica is how fresh their food is. Everything here looks delicious however, the price puts you off. They sell ONE crab croquette for $4. ONE PIECE. Please just kill me. I usually get the lunch combo, Main, Salad, Soup, which is about $9.75.

My favorite so far is the Tofu salad. It does have a heavy cilantro taste (which I hate) but there's just something about that salad that is refreshing. I also always get the salmon chowder (It is $1 extra with the combo) because I love my chowder.

For Main items, anything fried is good haha. I've had the pleasure to try the crab croquette and the pork cutlet. Both were fried well and the insides were cooked nicely. I also tried their Japanese Beef Curry. I like how big the portion is for a regular $8.50. Taste was just ok... I think I will stick to the main items on display.

On regular days, I would not come here because of how pricey it is and the small portions. However, I will take advantage of the Paypal deal!

excerpts: Pork cutlet isn't too bad.
pork cutlet.author: Alexander Y.
pork cutlet.review:
Not particularly sure what the hype about this place is.  I've been here more than a few times, and the only way I can guarantee that I'm not hungry still is if I order two or three items because the portion size is small for how much you pay for it.  That said, I do have to note the quality of the ingredients here is pretty top-notch.

The Japanese beef curry is pretty good and one of the few items worth coming back for.  Pork cutlet isn't too bad.  I question if the fried shrimp cake is really worth $4 a pop, but at least it is actually stuffed with shrimp so I can make a pass on that.  The roast beef sushi IS worth coming back for, if only because you don't really see too many places sell that.

Overall, it's a decent lunch spot, but nothing more than that.

excerpts: Though I'm staying at three stars for now, because I was underwhelmed by my pork cutlet sandwich, I am 100% excited to come back to try their other items.
They just have too many cool creations to miss.
Judging Delica for one item makes as much sense as judging the 2010 Giants season based on one regular season loss.
With respect to the pork cutlet sandwich I ordered, I thought it was too small and not extraordinary enough to justify the nearly $10 price tag.
I also did not care too much for the sauce and the pork could have been more tender and moist.
pork cutlet.author: Angel S.
pork cutlet.review:
Delica is characteristic of a Ferry Building establishment - gourmet quality, higher priced, and perhaps slightly overrated.

Okay fine, my initial assessment isn't fair.  Though I'm staying at three stars for now, because I was underwhelmed by my pork cutlet sandwich, I am 100% excited to come back to try their other items.  They just have too many cool creations to miss.  Judging Delica for one item makes as much sense as judging the 2010 Giants season based on one regular season loss.  You just wont get the whole picture.

With respect to the pork cutlet sandwich I ordered, I thought it was too small and not extraordinary enough to justify the nearly $10 price tag.  I also did not care too much for the sauce and the pork could have been more tender and moist.  In the end, I was still hungry.  

I think I just ordered the wrong thing.  On a positive note, they really do have a lot of goodies.  Most of their veggies (maybe all) are organic.  Meats are farm raised, hormone-free, and grass fed, and everything seem really fresh.

If you happen to make it, I recommend sampling their $2-$6 a la carte items rather than going for the overpriced sandwiches.  I didn't get to try the roast beef sushi, but that's now on my hit list for my  return trip.

I would have ordered more, but my friend was paying so I was conscious about running up the bill (though here I am complaining about the price of a meal I didn't pay for).  Anyway, I vow to come back, though I wont go on an empty stomach.  I have a feeling this three star review wont last very long (at least I hope so).

excerpts: Main - Pork Cutlet

- you get a few pieces of the cutlet which is topped with some of that tangy/delicious katsu sauce
Salad - Eggplant (Seasonal) or Mapo tofu salad - one of my favorite salads ever, I like dressing and feel like everything goes really well together
Rice - White rice - pretty standard and everything you expect from white rice
pork cutlet.author: Jason T.
pork cutlet.review:
Delica is right there in the ferry building. I love this spot for lunch. I usually go for the 'Main + Salad + Rice' option (I think it's #4 on the menu).

Main - Pork Cutlet - you get a few pieces of the cutlet which is topped with some of that tangy/delicious katsu sauce
Salad - Eggplant (Seasonal) or Mapo tofu salad - one of my favorite salads ever, I like dressing and feel like everything goes really well together
Rice - White rice - pretty standard and everything you expect from white rice lol

They have a wide variety of items here, something for everyone! The curry is delicious as well. Come here for lunch sometime! Good stuff.

excerpts: It's nice sitting on a bench overlooking the bay and eating a pork cutlet.
The menu is pretty easy to follow.
The food is already pre-made so you just pick what you want.
I kinda like that.
Overall the food was good...nice atmosphere...but the price for what you get could be a little less...
but I was happy.
pork cutlet.author: Jacob H.
pork cutlet.review: Coming from LA I was a little spoiled with my Japanese food. This place is great for a quick grab and go. It's nice sitting on a bench overlooking the bay and eating a pork cutlet. The menu is pretty easy to follow. The food is already pre-made so you just pick what you want. I kinda like that. Overall the food was good...nice atmosphere...but the price for what you get could be a little less...but I was happy.

excerpts: I chose the eggplants and pork cutlet.
The eggplants are excellent cold dish item.
It's perfect for warm summer days.
The texture of eggplant is firm without being soggy.
The minced meat and sauce on the eggplant makes this an very appetizing lunch item.
The pork cutlet are given in 3 small pieces.
They are plenty stomach-fulfilling but the taste is not memorable.
pork cutlet.author: Steven M.
pork cutlet.review:
I have found my missed Tokyo Japanese cuisine flavor.  I went here during lunch time on a weekday, and there are two lines.  One to grab the prepared bento to go where as another to select the items you want.  I picked the latter and waited quite a while longer.  

I chose the eggplants and pork cutlet.  The eggplants are excellent cold dish item.  It's perfect for warm summer days.  The texture of eggplant is firm without being soggy. The minced meat and sauce on the eggplant makes this an very appetizing lunch item.  The pork cutlet are given in 3 small pieces. They are plenty stomach-fulfilling but the taste is not memorable. All I can remember is the eggplant.

Come down to Delica and enjoy a great tasting Japanese flavor with a front row seat of the bay.

excerpts: Roast Beef Sushi ($2/ea), Sushi Rolls ($7.75/two), Tonkatsu/Pork Cutlet ($1.25), Chicken Dumpling w/Sweet Chili Sauce ($1.75), Kaki-age/Tempura ($3.75).
pork cutlet.author: Kay N.
pork cutlet.review:
Got Beef Curry ($9.50) and Green Tea ($2) 'cause I didn't feel like going bento. Maybe I will try one next time. 
The meal was simple and satisfying. Not heavy at all. Thumbs up. Will return again.

The Potato ($1.50/ea) and Crab ($3.75/ea) Croquettes looked tempting. 
I think I would feel fairly healthy eating most anything on Delica's menu. 
This restaurant is a good place to bring vegetarian/vegan friends if you want to eat with them near the water. Lots of good options for them. (Notably the Hijiki and Soybean Salad ($15/lb), Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad ($8/lb), Tofu Steak with Miso Sauce ($4/ea), Organic Vegetable Sushi Roll ($7.75/two), and of course the Potato Croquette).

Next visit: 
maybe a Bento box 5 items ($9.50), Summer Bento 9 items ($11), Croquettes, Shrimp Cake ($3.75/ea), Seared Tuna Salad ($10) or Spicy Tuna Genmai Rice Bowl ($10), Hijiki and Soybean Salad or Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad and/or........

Roast Beef Sushi ($2/ea), Sushi Rolls ($7.75/two), Tonkatsu/Pork Cutlet ($1.25), Chicken Dumpling w/Sweet Chili Sauce ($1.75), Kaki-age/Tempura ($3.75).

excerpts: Nevertheless the eggplant and pork cutlet (tonkatsu) that the others ordered were much better.
So thus the 4 stars.
But i still like this place because the food is authentic Japanese, fresh, and healthy.
And the location is prime.
pork cutlet.author: Rick K.
pork cutlet.review: Delica is authentic Japanese food.  Lots of great, healthy items on the menu.  I'd give it five stars, but today my lunch was a bit off.  There were too many good things on the menu and I couldn't decide, but ultimately my selection was not good.  My SO had already selected what I wanted (the eggplant salad), so I went with the green beans, tofu steak and rice.  I guess my disappointment was that I expected the rice and tofu to be warm, but both were cold.  Nevertheless the eggplant and pork cutlet (tonkatsu) that the others ordered were much better.  So thus the 4 stars.  But i still like this place because the food is authentic Japanese, fresh, and healthy.  And the location is prime.  Grab a bento lunch and eat it on the deck overlooking the bay.

excerpts: I tend to get either the tonkatsu (pork cutlet) or karage (fried chicken) bento, along with the sesame string bean/asparagus and spicy burdock salads.
I'll usually follow that with two pieces of the roast beef sushi.
pork cutlet.author: Allen K.
pork cutlet.review:
Lately this has been my go-to spot in the Ferry Building.  

This is probably the best fast/casual Japanese lunch spot within walking distance of the Embarcadero.  I tend to get either the tonkatsu (pork cutlet) or karage (fried chicken) bento, along with the sesame string bean/asparagus and spicy burdock salads.  I'll usually follow that with two pieces of the roast beef sushi.  The roast beef here is such tender goodness.

I've also had the curry here on a few occasions, and have loved it as well.

excerpts: Their fried pork cutlet is light and crunchy on the outside, tender and juicy on the inside.
A beautiful 4-part bento box with seaweed & soybean salad, mixed marinated root veggies, rice with black sesame and pork cutlet is the special work day lunch that made my day!
pork cutlet.author: C L.
pork cutlet.review:
Delica is Japanese style with organic, local freshness.

Their menu has a lot of healthy and delicious options, such as organic vegetarian sushi and salmon brown rice balls. 

There are also the less healthy choices that are equally mouth-watering. Their fried pork cutlet is light and crunchy on the outside, tender and juicy on the inside. In fact,  the meat is so soft and tender that I am convinced that it must came from a newborn baby pig! 

A beautiful 4-part bento box with seaweed & soybean salad, mixed marinated root veggies, rice with black sesame and pork cutlet is the special work day lunch that made my day! 

Go for a sweet treat at Miette Cakes afterwards, there is no such thing as a bad day!

excerpts:
their menu changes so the variety is never boring or repetitive...

additionally, the presentation of the japanese deli is clean, visually pleasing and just makes you want to order their food...and on that note, item to order next time? -- pork cutlet sandwich and a cream puff for desert!
pork cutlet.author: Grace O.
pork cutlet.review:
So, the first week after WLB got married (congrats to WLB & WLB's wife!) we decided to head over to the ferry building and check out Delica rf-1...we had seen it on another weekly lunch outing and surprisingly WLB had yet to eat there!

according to it's website, delica rf-1 "offers a variety of beautifully prepared meals to take away. Side dishes, main courses, fresh-fried foods, and substantial salads. Signature dishes include wasabi garlic potato salad, spicy burdock and lotus root salad, green bean salad with a sesame dressing, DELICA sushi rolls, hijiki and soy bean salad, Japanese curries, and Kobe-style deep-fried savory croquettes filled with potatoes, Dungeness crab in a bechamel sauce, or shrimp. " 

to put it simpler, in this foodie's terms, delica is a good place to get some japanese-CA fusion cuisine, made with organic and fresh ingredients, offering a yummy lunch that's flavorful and not heavy.  they have decent-priced lunch combinations where you can pick a combination of salads, main dishes, + with or w/o rice...their menu changes so the variety is never boring or repetitive...

additionally, the presentation of the japanese deli is clean, visually pleasing and just makes you want to order their food...and on that note, item to order next time? -- pork cutlet sandwich and a cream puff for desert!

excerpts: Super Tonkatsu (fried breaded pork cutlet), Spicy Burdock and lotus root salad, Green Bean with sesame dressing, Tofu and Hijiki Patty,Shrimp Cakes,
Delicious mushroom miso.
Just tried the chestnut bun.
Totemo Oishii!
I love love love the little fried stuff and the little dumplings.
perfect for on the go snacking.
my favorite ever was the fried cream corn.
they must have read my mind.
pork cutlet.author: sarah C.
pork cutlet.review:
Update 11/16/07: Bring back the Kabocha Squash Croquette PLEASE.   My life depends on it. 
This is now a regular to go spot for me.  Super Tonkatsu (fried breaded pork cutlet), Spicy Burdock and lotus root salad, Green Bean with sesame dressing, Tofu and Hijiki Patty,Shrimp Cakes, Delicious mushroom miso. 
1/18: Just tried the chestnut bun. Totemo Oishii!
I love love love the little fried stuff and the little dumplings. perfect for on the go snacking. my favorite ever was the fried cream corn.  they must have read my mind.

excerpts: I also love their croquettes, pork cutlet and wasabi potato salad.
The flavors are always balanced but not too heavy.
pork cutlet.author: Lainy C.
pork cutlet.review: My favorite place in the Ferry building for lunch. They use a lot of fresh, organic ingredients so the prices are a bit high for daily lunch but the quality goes in hand. I really like their tender lamb or beef curries, which is a hearty portion for lunch. I also love their croquettes, pork cutlet and wasabi potato salad. The flavors are always balanced but not too heavy.

excerpts: I was so happy to see they had curry, and my all time favorite donkatsu (fried pork cutlet).
pork cutlet.author: YJ H.
pork cutlet.review:
When I arrived at the Ferry Building starving I was really glad to see this place.  I was so happy to see they had curry, and my all time favorite donkatsu (fried pork cutlet).  Although I enjoyed their donkatsu, crab croquette, and fried chicken thingy, I did not like their soba salad (too much radish shavings), and other fusion items. 

I don't know may be I'm old fashioned. 
As others have stated, it is little pricey, but I would still get their fried items, and the likelihood of my coming back is pretty high.

Bon Appetit

excerpts: I love the Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad  and the Pork Cutlet (Tonkatsu) is delicious.
The sushi rolls are also scrumptious.
The food is always fresh.
I'm giving this place 5 stars because it definitely deserves it.
pork cutlet.author: Roddster V.
pork cutlet.review: I'm not an avid fan of Japanese food/sushi, but I'm catching on.  This place is excellent!  Our company has this catered in and I have to say this is the best Japanese they've ever had.   I love the Wasabi Garlic Potato Salad  and the Pork Cutlet (Tonkatsu) is delicious.  The sushi rolls are also scrumptious.  The food is always fresh.   I'm giving this place 5 stars because it definitely deserves it.

excerpts:
while busy at lunch, the line moves fast

Kinda steep at around $10, them bento boxes are pretty solid, I like the beef curry, I can see how it can get plain

Pork cutlet good too although the salad it is served with has some weird greens
pork cutlet.author: xo x.
pork cutlet.review:
@ The Ferry Bldg so it automatically gets points, while busy at lunch, the line moves fast

Kinda steep at around $10, them bento boxes are pretty solid, I like the beef curry, I can see how it can get plain

Pork cutlet good too although the salad it is served with has some weird greens
